2307 
2308         if (tracing_disabled)
2309                 return;
2310 
2311         /* If global, we need to also start the max tracer */
2312         if (tr->flags & TRACE_ARRAY_FL_GLOBAL)
2313                 return tracing_start();
2314 
2315         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&tr->start_lock, flags);
2316 
2317         if (--tr->stop_count) {
2318                 if (tr->stop_count < 0) {
2319                         /* Someone screwed up their debugging */
2320                         WARN_ON_ONCE(1);
2321                         tr->stop_count = 0;
2322                 }
2323                 goto out;
2324         }
2325 
2326         buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
2327         if (buffer)
2328                 ring_buffer_record_enable(buffer);
2329 
2330  out:
2331         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tr->start_lock, flags);
2332 }
2333 
2334 /**
2335  * tracing_stop - quick stop of the tracer
2336  *
2337  * Light weight way to stop tracing. Use in conjunction with
2338  * tracing_start.
2339  */
2340 void tracing_stop(void)
2341 {
2342         struct trace_buffer *buffer;
2343         unsigned long flags;
2344 
2345         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&global_trace.start_lock, flags);
2346         if (global_trace.stop_count++)
2347                 goto out;
2348 
2349         /* Prevent the buffers from switching */
2350         arch_spin_lock(&global_trace.max_lock);
2351 
2352         buffer = global_trace.array_buffer.buffer;
2353         if (buffer)
2354                 ring_buffer_record_disable(buffer);
2355 
2356 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
2357         buffer = global_trace.max_buffer.buffer;
2358         if (buffer)
2359                 ring_buffer_record_disable(buffer);
2360 #endif
2361 
2362         arch_spin_unlock(&global_trace.max_lock);
2363 
2364  out:
2365         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&global_trace.start_lock, flags);
2366 }
2367 
2368 static void tracing_stop_tr(struct trace_array *tr)
2369 {
2370         struct trace_buffer *buffer;
2371         unsigned long flags;
2372 
2373         /* If global, we need to also stop the max tracer */
2374         if (tr->flags & TRACE_ARRAY_FL_GLOBAL)
2375                 return tracing_stop();
2376 
2377         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&tr->start_lock, flags);
2378         if (tr->stop_count++)
2379                 goto out;
2380 
2381         buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
2382         if (buffer)
2383                 ring_buffer_record_disable(buffer);
2384 
2385  out:
2386         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tr->start_lock, flags);
2387 }
2388 
2389 static int trace_save_cmdline(struct task_struct *tsk)
2390 {
2391         unsigned tpid, idx;
2392 
2393         /* treat recording of idle task as a success */
2394         if (!tsk->pid)
2395                 return 1;
2396 
2397         tpid = tsk->pid & (PID_MAX_DEFAULT - 1);
2398 
2399         /*
2400          * It's not the end of the world if we don't get
2401          * the lock, but we also don't want to spin
2402          * nor do we want to disable interrupts,
2403          * so if we miss here, then better luck next time.
2404          */
2405         if (!arch_spin_trylock(&trace_cmdline_lock))
2406                 return 0;
2407 
2408         idx = savedcmd->map_pid_to_cmdline[tpid];
2409         if (idx == NO_CMDLINE_MAP) {
2410                 idx = (savedcmd->cmdline_idx + 1) % savedcmd->cmdline_num;
2411 
2412                 savedcmd->map_pid_to_cmdline[tpid] = idx;
2413                 savedcmd->cmdline_idx = idx;
2414         }
2415 
2416         savedcmd->map_cmdline_to_pid[idx] = tsk->pid;
2417         set_cmdline(idx, tsk->comm);
2418 
2419         arch_spin_unlock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
2420 
2421         return 1;
2422 }
2423 
2424 static void __trace_find_cmdline(int pid, char comm[])
2425 {
2426         unsigned map;
2427         int tpid;
2428 
2429         if (!pid) {
2430                 strcpy(comm, "<idle>");
2431                 return;
2432         }
2433 
2434         if (WARN_ON_ONCE(pid < 0)) {
2435                 strcpy(comm, "<XXX>");
2436                 return;
2437         }
2438 
2439         tpid = pid & (PID_MAX_DEFAULT - 1);
2440         map = savedcmd->map_pid_to_cmdline[tpid];
2441         if (map != NO_CMDLINE_MAP) {
2442                 tpid = savedcmd->map_cmdline_to_pid[map];
2443                 if (tpid == pid) {
2444                         strlcpy(comm, get_saved_cmdlines(map), TASK_COMM_LEN);
2445                         return;
2446                 }
2447         }
2448         strcpy(comm, "<...>");
2449 }
2450 
2451 void trace_find_cmdline(int pid, char comm[])
2452 {
2453         preempt_disable();
2454         arch_spin_lock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
2455 
2456         __trace_find_cmdline(pid, comm);
2457 
2458         arch_spin_unlock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
2459         preempt_enable();
2460 }
2461 
2462 int trace_find_tgid(int pid)
2463 {
2464         if (unlikely(!tgid_map || !pid || pid > PID_MAX_DEFAULT))
2465                 return 0;
2466 
2467         return tgid_map[pid];
2468 }
2469 
2470 static int trace_save_tgid(struct task_struct *tsk)
2471 {
2472         /* treat recording of idle task as a success */
2473         if (!tsk->pid)
2474                 return 1;
2475 
2476         if (unlikely(!tgid_map || tsk->pid > PID_MAX_DEFAULT))
2477                 return 0;
2478 
2479         tgid_map[tsk->pid] = tsk->tgid;
2480         return 1;
2481 }
2482 
2483 static bool tracing_record_taskinfo_skip(int flags)
2484 {
2485         if (unlikely(!(flags & (TRACE_RECORD_CMDLINE | TRACE_RECORD_TGID))))
2486                 return true;
2487         if (atomic_read(&trace_record_taskinfo_disabled) || !tracing_is_on())
2488                 return true;
2489         if (!__this_cpu_read(trace_taskinfo_save))
2490                 return true;
2491         return false;
2492 }
2493 
2494 /**
2495  * tracing_record_taskinfo - record the task info of a task
2496  *
2497  * @task:  task to record
2498  * @flags: TRACE_RECORD_CMDLINE for recording comm
2499  *         TRACE_RECORD_TGID for recording tgid
2500  */
2501 void tracing_record_taskinfo(struct task_struct *task, int flags)
2502 {
2503         bool done;
2504 
2505         if (tracing_record_taskinfo_skip(flags))
2506                 return;
2507 
2508         /*
2509          * Record as much task information as possible. If some fail, continue
2510          * to try to record the others.
2511          */
2512         done = !(flags & TRACE_RECORD_CMDLINE) || trace_save_cmdline(task);
2513         done &= !(flags & TRACE_RECORD_TGID) || trace_save_tgid(task);
2514 
2515         /* If recording any information failed, retry again soon. */
2516         if (!done)
2517                 return;
2518 
2519         __this_cpu_write(trace_taskinfo_save, false);
2520 }
2521 
2522 /**
2523  * tracing_record_taskinfo_sched_switch - record task info for sched_switch
2524  *
2525  * @prev: previous task during sched_switch
2526  * @next: next task during sched_switch
2527  * @flags: TRACE_RECORD_CMDLINE for recording comm
2528  *         TRACE_RECORD_TGID for recording tgid
2529  */
2530 void tracing_record_taskinfo_sched_switch(struct task_struct *prev,
2531                                           struct task_struct *next, int flags)
2532 {
2533         bool done;
2534 
2535         if (tracing_record_taskinfo_skip(flags))
2536                 return;
2537 
2538         /*
2539          * Record as much task information as possible. If some fail, continue
2540          * to try to record the others.
2541          */
2542         done  = !(flags & TRACE_RECORD_CMDLINE) || trace_save_cmdline(prev);
2543         done &= !(flags & TRACE_RECORD_CMDLINE) || trace_save_cmdline(next);
2544         done &= !(flags & TRACE_RECORD_TGID) || trace_save_tgid(prev);
2545         done &= !(flags & TRACE_RECORD_TGID) || trace_save_tgid(next);
2546 
2547         /* If recording any information failed, retry again soon. */
2548         if (!done)
2549                 return;
2550 
2551         __this_cpu_write(trace_taskinfo_save, false);
2552 }
2553 
2554 /* Helpers to record a specific task information */
2555 void tracing_record_cmdline(struct task_struct *task)
2556 {
2557         tracing_record_taskinfo(task, TRACE_RECORD_CMDLINE);
2558 }
2559 
2560 void tracing_record_tgid(struct task_struct *task)
2561 {
2562         tracing_record_taskinfo(task, TRACE_RECORD_TGID);
2563 }
2564 
2565 /*
2566  * Several functions return TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE if the trace_seq
2567  * overflowed, and TRACE_TYPE_HANDLED otherwise. This helper function
2568  * simplifies those functions and keeps them in sync.
2569  */
2570 enum print_line_t trace_handle_return(struct trace_seq *s)
2571 {
2572         return trace_seq_has_overflowed(s) ?
2573                 TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE : TRACE_TYPE_HANDLED;
2574 }
2575 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_handle_return);
2576 
2577 void
2578 tracing_generic_entry_update(struct trace_entry *entry, unsigned short type,
2579                              unsigned long flags, int pc)
2580 {
2581         struct task_struct *tsk = current;
2582 
2583         entry->preempt_count            = pc & 0xff;
2584         entry->pid                      = (tsk) ? tsk->pid : 0;
2585         entry->type                     = type;
2586         entry->flags =
2587 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACE_IRQFLAGS_SUPPORT
2588                 (irqs_disabled_flags(flags) ? TRACE_FLAG_IRQS_OFF : 0) |
2589 #else
2590                 TRACE_FLAG_IRQS_NOSUPPORT |
2591 #endif
2592                 ((pc & NMI_MASK    ) ? TRACE_FLAG_NMI     : 0) |
2593                 ((pc & HARDIRQ_MASK) ? TRACE_FLAG_HARDIRQ : 0) |
2594                 ((pc & SOFTIRQ_OFFSET) ? TRACE_FLAG_SOFTIRQ : 0) |
2595                 (tif_need_resched() ? TRACE_FLAG_NEED_RESCHED : 0) |
2596                 (test_preempt_need_resched() ? TRACE_FLAG_PREEMPT_RESCHED : 0);
2597 }
2598 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(tracing_generic_entry_update);
2599 
2600 struct ring_buffer_event *
2601 trace_buffer_lock_reserve(struct trace_buffer *buffer,
2602                           int type,
2603                           unsigned long len,
2604                           unsigned long flags, int pc)
2605 {
2606         return __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, type, len, flags, pc);
2607 }
2608 
2609 DEFINE_PER_CPU(struct ring_buffer_event *, trace_buffered_event);
2610 DEFINE_PER_CPU(int, trace_buffered_event_cnt);
2611 static int trace_buffered_event_ref;
2612 
2613 /**
2614  * trace_buffered_event_enable - enable buffering events
2615  *
2616  * When events are being filtered, it is quicker to use a temporary
2617  * buffer to write the event data into if there's a likely chance
2618  * that it will not be committed. The discard of the ring buffer
2619  * is not as fast as committing, and is much slower than copying
2620  * a commit.
2621  *
2622  * When an event is to be filtered, allocate per cpu buffers to
2623  * write the event data into, and if the event is filtered and discarded
2624  * it is simply dropped, otherwise, the entire data is to be committed
2625  * in one shot.
2626  */
2627 void trace_buffered_event_enable(void)
2628 {
2629         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
2630         struct page *page;
2631         int cpu;
2632 
2633         WARN_ON_ONCE(!mutex_is_locked(&event_mutex));
2634 
2635         if (trace_buffered_event_ref++)
2636                 return;
2637 
2638         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
2639                 page = alloc_pages_node(cpu_to_node(cpu),
2640                                         GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_NORETRY, 0);
2641                 if (!page)
2642                         goto failed;
2643 
2644                 event = page_address(page);
2645                 memset(event, 0, sizeof(*event));
2646 
2647                 per_cpu(trace_buffered_event, cpu) = event;
2648 
2649                 preempt_disable();
2650                 if (cpu == smp_processor_id() &&
2651                     __this_cpu_read(trace_buffered_event) !=
2652                     per_cpu(trace_buffered_event, cpu))
2653                         WARN_ON_ONCE(1);
2654                 preempt_enable();
2655         }
2656 
2657         return;
2658  failed:
2659         trace_buffered_event_disable();
2660 }
2661 
2662 static void enable_trace_buffered_event(void *data)
2663 {
2664         /* Probably not needed, but do it anyway */
2665         smp_rmb();
2666         this_cpu_dec(trace_buffered_event_cnt);
2667 }
2668 
2669 static void disable_trace_buffered_event(void *data)
2670 {
2671         this_cpu_inc(trace_buffered_event_cnt);
2672 }
2673 
2674 /**
2675  * trace_buffered_event_disable - disable buffering events
2676  *
2677  * When a filter is removed, it is faster to not use the buffered
2678  * events, and to commit directly into the ring buffer. Free up
2679  * the temp buffers when there are no more users. This requires
2680  * special synchronization with current events.
2681  */
2682 void trace_buffered_event_disable(void)
2683 {
2684         int cpu;
2685 
2686         WARN_ON_ONCE(!mutex_is_locked(&event_mutex));
2687 
2688         if (WARN_ON_ONCE(!trace_buffered_event_ref))
2689                 return;
2690 
2691         if (--trace_buffered_event_ref)
2692                 return;
2693 
2694         preempt_disable();
2695         /* For each CPU, set the buffer as used. */
2696         smp_call_function_many(tracing_buffer_mask,
2697                                disable_trace_buffered_event, NULL, 1);
2698         preempt_enable();
2699 
2700         /* Wait for all current users to finish */
2701         synchronize_rcu();
2702 
2703         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
2704                 free_page((unsigned long)per_cpu(trace_buffered_event, cpu));
2705                 per_cpu(trace_buffered_event, cpu) = NULL;
2706         }
2707         /*
2708          * Make sure trace_buffered_event is NULL before clearing
2709          * trace_buffered_event_cnt.
2710          */
2711         smp_wmb();
2712 
2713         preempt_disable();
2714         /* Do the work on each cpu */
2715         smp_call_function_many(tracing_buffer_mask,
2716                                enable_trace_buffered_event, NULL, 1);
2717         preempt_enable();
2718 }
2719 
2720 static struct trace_buffer *temp_buffer;
2721 
2722 struct ring_buffer_event *
2723 trace_event_buffer_lock_reserve(struct trace_buffer **current_rb,
2724                           struct trace_event_file *trace_file,
2725                           int type, unsigned long len,
2726                           unsigned long flags, int pc)
2727 {
2728         struct ring_buffer_event *entry;
2729         int val;
2730 
2731         *current_rb = trace_file->tr->array_buffer.buffer;
2732 
2733         if (!ring_buffer_time_stamp_abs(*current_rb) && (trace_file->flags &
2734              (EVENT_FILE_FL_SOFT_DISABLED | EVENT_FILE_FL_FILTERED)) &&
2735             (entry = this_cpu_read(trace_buffered_event))) {
2736                 /* Try to use the per cpu buffer first */
2737                 val = this_cpu_inc_return(trace_buffered_event_cnt);
2738                 if ((len < (PAGE_SIZE - sizeof(*entry))) && val == 1) {
2739                         trace_event_setup(entry, type, flags, pc);
2740                         entry->array[0] = len;
2741                         return entry;
2742                 }
2743                 this_cpu_dec(trace_buffered_event_cnt);
2744         }
2745 
2746         entry = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(*current_rb,
2747                                             type, len, flags, pc);
2748         /*
2749          * If tracing is off, but we have triggers enabled
2750          * we still need to look at the event data. Use the temp_buffer
2751          * to store the trace event for the trigger to use. It's recursive
2752          * safe and will not be recorded anywhere.
2753          */
2754         if (!entry && trace_file->flags & EVENT_FILE_FL_TRIGGER_COND) {
2755                 *current_rb = temp_buffer;
2756                 entry = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(*current_rb,
2757                                                     type, len, flags, pc);
2758         }
2759         return entry;
2760 }
2761 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_event_buffer_lock_reserve);
2762 
2763 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(tracepoint_iter_lock);
2764 static DEFINE_MUTEX(tracepoint_printk_mutex);
2765 
2766 static void output_printk(struct trace_event_buffer *fbuffer)
2767 {
2768         struct trace_event_call *event_call;
2769         struct trace_event_file *file;
2770         struct trace_event *event;
2771         unsigned long flags;
2772         struct trace_iterator *iter = tracepoint_print_iter;
2773 
2774         /* We should never get here if iter is NULL */
2775         if (WARN_ON_ONCE(!iter))
2776                 return;
2777 
2778         event_call = fbuffer->trace_file->event_call;
2779         if (!event_call || !event_call->event.funcs ||
2780             !event_call->event.funcs->trace)
2781                 return;
2782 
2783         file = fbuffer->trace_file;
2784         if (test_bit(EVENT_FILE_FL_SOFT_DISABLED_BIT, &file->flags) ||
2785             (unlikely(file->flags & EVENT_FILE_FL_FILTERED) &&
2786              !filter_match_preds(file->filter, fbuffer->entry)))
2787                 return;
2788 
2789         event = &fbuffer->trace_file->event_call->event;
2790 
2791         spin_lock_irqsave(&tracepoint_iter_lock, flags);
2792         trace_seq_init(&iter->seq);
2793         iter->ent = fbuffer->entry;
2794         event_call->event.funcs->trace(iter, 0, event);
2795         trace_seq_putc(&iter->seq, 0);
2796         printk("%s", iter->seq.buffer);
2797 
2798         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tracepoint_iter_lock, flags);
2799 }
2800 
2801 int tracepoint_printk_sysctl(struct ctl_table *table, int write,
2802                              void *buffer, size_t *lenp,
2803                              loff_t *ppos)
2804 {
2805         int save_tracepoint_printk;
2806         int ret;
2807 
2808         mutex_lock(&tracepoint_printk_mutex);
2809         save_tracepoint_printk = tracepoint_printk;
2810 
2811         ret = proc_dointvec(table, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
2812 
2813         /*
2814          * This will force exiting early, as tracepoint_printk
2815          * is always zero when tracepoint_printk_iter is not allocated
2816          */
2817         if (!tracepoint_print_iter)
2818                 tracepoint_printk = 0;
2819 
2820         if (save_tracepoint_printk == tracepoint_printk)
2821                 goto out;
2822 
2823         if (tracepoint_printk)
2824                 static_key_enable(&tracepoint_printk_key.key);
2825         else
2826                 static_key_disable(&tracepoint_printk_key.key);
2827 
2828  out:
2829         mutex_unlock(&tracepoint_printk_mutex);
2830 
2831         return ret;
2832 }
2833 
2834 void trace_event_buffer_commit(struct trace_event_buffer *fbuffer)
2835 {
2836         if (static_key_false(&tracepoint_printk_key.key))
2837                 output_printk(fbuffer);
2838 
2839         if (static_branch_unlikely(&trace_event_exports_enabled))
2840                 ftrace_exports(fbuffer->event, TRACE_EXPORT_EVENT);
2841         event_trigger_unlock_commit_regs(fbuffer->trace_file, fbuffer->buffer,
2842                                     fbuffer->event, fbuffer->entry,
2843                                     fbuffer->flags, fbuffer->pc, fbuffer->regs);
2844 }
2845 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_event_buffer_commit);
2846 
2847 /*
2848  * Skip 3:
2849  *
2850  *   trace_buffer_unlock_commit_regs()
2851  *   trace_event_buffer_commit()
2852  *   trace_event_raw_event_xxx()
2853  */
2854 # define STACK_SKIP 3
2855 
2856 void trace_buffer_unlock_commit_regs(struct trace_array *tr,
2857                                      struct trace_buffer *buffer,
2858                                      struct ring_buffer_event *event,
2859                                      unsigned long flags, int pc,
2860                                      struct pt_regs *regs)
2861 {
2862         __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
2863 
2864         /*
2865          * If regs is not set, then skip the necessary functions.
2866          * Note, we can still get here via blktrace, wakeup tracer
2867          * and mmiotrace, but that's ok if they lose a function or
2868          * two. They are not that meaningful.
2869          */
2870         ftrace_trace_stack(tr, buffer, flags, regs ? 0 : STACK_SKIP, pc, regs);
2871         ftrace_trace_userstack(tr, buffer, flags, pc);
2872 }
2873 
2874 /*
2875  * Similar to trace_buffer_unlock_commit_regs() but do not dump stack.
2876  */
2877 void
2878 trace_buffer_unlock_commit_nostack(struct trace_buffer *buffer,
2879                                    struct ring_buffer_event *event)
2880 {
2881         __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
2882 }
2883 
2884 void
2885 trace_function(struct trace_array *tr,
2886                unsigned long ip, unsigned long parent_ip, unsigned long flags,
2887                int pc)
2888 {
2889         struct trace_event_call *call = &event_function;
2890         struct trace_buffer *buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
2891         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
2892         struct ftrace_entry *entry;
2893 
2894         event = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, TRACE_FN, sizeof(*entry),
2895                                             flags, pc);
2896         if (!event)
2897                 return;
2898         entry   = ring_buffer_event_data(event);
2899         entry->ip                       = ip;
2900         entry->parent_ip                = parent_ip;
2901 
2902         if (!call_filter_check_discard(call, entry, buffer, event)) {
2903                 if (static_branch_unlikely(&trace_function_exports_enabled))
2904                         ftrace_exports(event, TRACE_EXPORT_FUNCTION);
2905                 __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
2906         }
2907 }
2908 
2909 #ifdef CONFIG_STACKTRACE
2910 
2911 /* Allow 4 levels of nesting: normal, softirq, irq, NMI */
2912 #define FTRACE_KSTACK_NESTING   4
2913 
2914 #define FTRACE_KSTACK_ENTRIES   (PAGE_SIZE / FTRACE_KSTACK_NESTING)
2915 
2916 struct ftrace_stack {
2917         unsigned long           calls[FTRACE_KSTACK_ENTRIES];
2918 };
2919 
2920 
2921 struct ftrace_stacks {
2922         struct ftrace_stack     stacks[FTRACE_KSTACK_NESTING];
2923 };
2924 
2925 static DEFINE_PER_CPU(struct ftrace_stacks, ftrace_stacks);
2926 static DEFINE_PER_CPU(int, ftrace_stack_reserve);
2927 
2928 static void __ftrace_trace_stack(struct trace_buffer *buffer,
2929                                  unsigned long flags,
2930                                  int skip, int pc, struct pt_regs *regs)
2931 {
2932         struct trace_event_call *call = &event_kernel_stack;
2933         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
2934         unsigned int size, nr_entries;
2935         struct ftrace_stack *fstack;
2936         struct stack_entry *entry;
2937         int stackidx;
2938 
2939         /*
2940          * Add one, for this function and the call to save_stack_trace()
2941          * If regs is set, then these functions will not be in the way.
2942          */
2943 #ifndef CONFIG_UNWINDER_ORC
2944         if (!regs)
2945                 skip++;
2946 #endif
2947 
2948         preempt_disable_notrace();
2949 
2950         stackidx = __this_cpu_inc_return(ftrace_stack_reserve) - 1;
2951 
2952         /* This should never happen. If it does, yell once and skip */
2953         if (WARN_ON_ONCE(stackidx >= FTRACE_KSTACK_NESTING))
2954                 goto out;
2955 
2956         /*
2957          * The above __this_cpu_inc_return() is 'atomic' cpu local. An
2958          * interrupt will either see the value pre increment or post
2959          * increment. If the interrupt happens pre increment it will have
2960          * restored the counter when it returns.  We just need a barrier to
2961          * keep gcc from moving things around.
2962          */
2963         barrier();
2964 
2965         fstack = this_cpu_ptr(ftrace_stacks.stacks) + stackidx;
2966         size = ARRAY_SIZE(fstack->calls);
2967 
2968         if (regs) {
2969                 nr_entries = stack_trace_save_regs(regs, fstack->calls,
2970                                                    size, skip);
2971         } else {
2972                 nr_entries = stack_trace_save(fstack->calls, size, skip);
2973         }
2974 
2975         size = nr_entries * sizeof(unsigned long);
2976         event = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, TRACE_STACK,
2977                                     (sizeof(*entry) - sizeof(entry->caller)) + size,
2978                                     flags, pc);
2979         if (!event)
2980                 goto out;
2981         entry = ring_buffer_event_data(event);
2982 
2983         memcpy(&entry->caller, fstack->calls, size);
2984         entry->size = nr_entries;
2985 
2986         if (!call_filter_check_discard(call, entry, buffer, event))
2987                 __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
2988 
2989  out:
2990         /* Again, don't let gcc optimize things here */
2991         barrier();
2992         __this_cpu_dec(ftrace_stack_reserve);
2993         preempt_enable_notrace();
2994 
2995 }
2996 
2997 static inline void ftrace_trace_stack(struct trace_array *tr,
2998                                       struct trace_buffer *buffer,
2999                                       unsigned long flags,
3000                                       int skip, int pc, struct pt_regs *regs)
3001 {
3002         if (!(tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_STACKTRACE))
3003                 return;
3004 
3005         __ftrace_trace_stack(buffer, flags, skip, pc, regs);
3006 }
3007 
3008 void __trace_stack(struct trace_array *tr, unsigned long flags, int skip,
3009                    int pc)
3010 {
3011         struct trace_buffer *buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
3012 
3013         if (rcu_is_watching()) {
3014                 __ftrace_trace_stack(buffer, flags, skip, pc, NULL);
3015                 return;
3016         }
3017 
3018         /*
3019          * When an NMI triggers, RCU is enabled via rcu_nmi_enter(),
3020          * but if the above rcu_is_watching() failed, then the NMI
3021          * triggered someplace critical, and rcu_irq_enter() should
3022          * not be called from NMI.
3023          */
3024         if (unlikely(in_nmi()))
3025                 return;
3026 
3027         rcu_irq_enter_irqson();
3028         __ftrace_trace_stack(buffer, flags, skip, pc, NULL);
3029         rcu_irq_exit_irqson();
3030 }
3031 
3032 /**
3033  * trace_dump_stack - record a stack back trace in the trace buffer
3034  * @skip: Number of functions to skip (helper handlers)
3035  */
3036 void trace_dump_stack(int skip)
3037 {
3038         unsigned long flags;
3039 
3040         if (tracing_disabled || tracing_selftest_running)
3041                 return;
3042 
3043         local_save_flags(flags);
3044 
3045 #ifndef CONFIG_UNWINDER_ORC
3046         /* Skip 1 to skip this function. */
3047         skip++;
3048 #endif
3049         __ftrace_trace_stack(global_trace.array_buffer.buffer,
3050                              flags, skip, preempt_count(), NULL);
3051 }
3052 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_dump_stack);
3053 
3054 #ifdef CONFIG_USER_STACKTRACE_SUPPORT
3055 static DEFINE_PER_CPU(int, user_stack_count);
3056 
3057 static void
3058 ftrace_trace_userstack(struct trace_array *tr,
3059                        struct trace_buffer *buffer, unsigned long flags, int pc)
3060 {
3061         struct trace_event_call *call = &event_user_stack;
3062         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
3063         struct userstack_entry *entry;
3064 
3065         if (!(tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_USERSTACKTRACE))
3066                 return;
3067 
3068         /*
3069          * NMIs can not handle page faults, even with fix ups.
3070          * The save user stack can (and often does) fault.
3071          */
3072         if (unlikely(in_nmi()))
3073                 return;
3074 
3075         /*
3076          * prevent recursion, since the user stack tracing may
3077          * trigger other kernel events.
3078          */
3079         preempt_disable();
3080         if (__this_cpu_read(user_stack_count))
3081                 goto out;
3082 
3083         __this_cpu_inc(user_stack_count);
3084 
3085         event = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, TRACE_USER_STACK,
3086                                             sizeof(*entry), flags, pc);
3087         if (!event)
3088                 goto out_drop_count;
3089         entry   = ring_buffer_event_data(event);
3090 
3091         entry->tgid             = current->tgid;
3092         memset(&entry->caller, 0, sizeof(entry->caller));
3093 
3094         stack_trace_save_user(entry->caller, FTRACE_STACK_ENTRIES);
3095         if (!call_filter_check_discard(call, entry, buffer, event))
3096                 __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
3097 
3098  out_drop_count:
3099         __this_cpu_dec(user_stack_count);
3100  out:
3101         preempt_enable();
3102 }
3103 #else /* CONFIG_USER_STACKTRACE_SUPPORT */
3104 static void ftrace_trace_userstack(struct trace_array *tr,
3105                                    struct trace_buffer *buffer,
3106                                    unsigned long flags, int pc)
3107 {
3108 }
3109 #endif /* !CONFIG_USER_STACKTRACE_SUPPORT */
3110 
3111 #endif /* CONFIG_STACKTRACE */
3112 
3113 /* created for use with alloc_percpu */
3114 struct trace_buffer_struct {
3115         int nesting;
3116         char buffer[4][TRACE_BUF_SIZE];
3117 };
3118 
3119 static struct trace_buffer_struct *trace_percpu_buffer;
3120 
3121 /*
3122  * Thise allows for lockless recording.  If we're nested too deeply, then
3123  * this returns NULL.
3124  */
3125 static char *get_trace_buf(void)
3126 {
3127         struct trace_buffer_struct *buffer = this_cpu_ptr(trace_percpu_buffer);
3128 
3129         if (!buffer || buffer->nesting >= 4)
3130                 return NULL;
3131 
3132         buffer->nesting++;
3133 
3134         /* Interrupts must see nesting incremented before we use the buffer */
3135         barrier();
3136         return &buffer->buffer[buffer->nesting - 1][0];
3137 }
3138 
3139 static void put_trace_buf(void)
3140 {
3141         /* Don't let the decrement of nesting leak before this */
3142         barrier();
3143         this_cpu_dec(trace_percpu_buffer->nesting);
3144 }
3145 
3146 static int alloc_percpu_trace_buffer(void)
3147 {
3148         struct trace_buffer_struct *buffers;
3149 
3150         if (trace_percpu_buffer)
3151                 return 0;
3152 
3153         buffers = alloc_percpu(struct trace_buffer_struct);
3154         if (MEM_FAIL(!buffers, "Could not allocate percpu trace_printk buffer"))
3155                 return -ENOMEM;
3156 
3157         trace_percpu_buffer = buffers;
3158         return 0;
3159 }
3160 
3161 static int buffers_allocated;
3162 
3163 void trace_printk_init_buffers(void)
3164 {
3165         if (buffers_allocated)
3166                 return;
3167 
3168         if (alloc_percpu_trace_buffer())
3169                 return;
3170 
3171         /* trace_printk() is for debug use only. Don't use it in production. */
3172 
3173         pr_warn("\n");
3174         pr_warn("**********************************************************\n");
3175         pr_warn("**   NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE   **\n");
3176         pr_warn("**                                                      **\n");
3177         pr_warn("** trace_printk() being used. Allocating extra memory.  **\n");
3178         pr_warn("**                                                      **\n");
3179         pr_warn("** This means that this is a DEBUG kernel and it is     **\n");
3180         pr_warn("** unsafe for production use.                           **\n");
3181         pr_warn("**                                                      **\n");
3182         pr_warn("** If you see this message and you are not debugging    **\n");
3183         pr_warn("** the kernel, report this immediately to your vendor!  **\n");
3184         pr_warn("**                                                      **\n");
3185         pr_warn("**   NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE NOTICE   **\n");
3186         pr_warn("**********************************************************\n");
3187 
3188         /* Expand the buffers to set size */
3189         tracing_update_buffers();
3190 
3191         buffers_allocated = 1;
3192 
3193         /*
3194          * trace_printk_init_buffers() can be called by modules.
3195          * If that happens, then we need to start cmdline recording
3196          * directly here. If the global_trace.buffer is already
3197          * allocated here, then this was called by module code.
3198          */
3199         if (global_trace.array_buffer.buffer)
3200                 tracing_start_cmdline_record();
3201 }
3202 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_printk_init_buffers);
3203 
3204 void trace_printk_start_comm(void)
3205 {
3206         /* Start tracing comms if trace printk is set */
3207         if (!buffers_allocated)
3208                 return;
3209         tracing_start_cmdline_record();
3210 }
3211 
3212 static void trace_printk_start_stop_comm(int enabled)
3213 {
3214         if (!buffers_allocated)
3215                 return;
3216 
3217         if (enabled)
3218                 tracing_start_cmdline_record();
3219         else
3220                 tracing_stop_cmdline_record();
3221 }
3222 
3223 /**
3224  * trace_vbprintk - write binary msg to tracing buffer
3225  * @ip:    The address of the caller
3226  * @fmt:   The string format to write to the buffer
3227  * @args:  Arguments for @fmt
3228  */
3229 int trace_vbprintk(unsigned long ip, const char *fmt, va_list args)
3230 {
3231         struct trace_event_call *call = &event_bprint;
3232         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
3233         struct trace_buffer *buffer;
3234         struct trace_array *tr = &global_trace;
3235         struct bprint_entry *entry;
3236         unsigned long flags;
3237         char *tbuffer;
3238         int len = 0, size, pc;
3239 
3240         if (unlikely(tracing_selftest_running || tracing_disabled))
3241                 return 0;
3242 
3243         /* Don't pollute graph traces with trace_vprintk internals */
3244         pause_graph_tracing();
3245 
3246         pc = preempt_count();
3247         preempt_disable_notrace();
3248 
3249         tbuffer = get_trace_buf();
3250         if (!tbuffer) {
3251                 len = 0;
3252                 goto out_nobuffer;
3253         }
3254 
3255         len = vbin_printf((u32 *)tbuffer, TRACE_BUF_SIZE/sizeof(int), fmt, args);
3256 
3257         if (len > TRACE_BUF_SIZE/sizeof(int) || len < 0)
3258                 goto out_put;
3259 
3260         local_save_flags(flags);
3261         size = sizeof(*entry) + sizeof(u32) * len;
3262         buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
3263         ring_buffer_nest_start(buffer);
3264         event = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, TRACE_BPRINT, size,
3265                                             flags, pc);
3266         if (!event)
3267                 goto out;
3268         entry = ring_buffer_event_data(event);
3269         entry->ip                       = ip;
3270         entry->fmt                      = fmt;
3271 
3272         memcpy(entry->buf, tbuffer, sizeof(u32) * len);
3273         if (!call_filter_check_discard(call, entry, buffer, event)) {
3274                 __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
3275                 ftrace_trace_stack(tr, buffer, flags, 6, pc, NULL);
3276         }
3277 
3278 out:
3279         ring_buffer_nest_end(buffer);
3280 out_put:
3281         put_trace_buf();
3282 
3283 out_nobuffer:
3284         preempt_enable_notrace();
3285         unpause_graph_tracing();
3286 
3287         return len;
3288 }
3289 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_vbprintk);
3290 
3291 __printf(3, 0)
3292 static int
3293 __trace_array_vprintk(struct trace_buffer *buffer,
3294                       unsigned long ip, const char *fmt, va_list args)
3295 {
3296         struct trace_event_call *call = &event_print;
3297         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
3298         int len = 0, size, pc;
3299         struct print_entry *entry;
3300         unsigned long flags;
3301         char *tbuffer;
3302 
3303         if (tracing_disabled || tracing_selftest_running)
3304                 return 0;
3305 
3306         /* Don't pollute graph traces with trace_vprintk internals */
3307         pause_graph_tracing();
3308 
3309         pc = preempt_count();
3310         preempt_disable_notrace();
3311 
3312 
3313         tbuffer = get_trace_buf();
3314         if (!tbuffer) {
3315                 len = 0;
3316                 goto out_nobuffer;
3317         }
3318 
3319         len = vscnprintf(tbuffer, TRACE_BUF_SIZE, fmt, args);
3320 
3321         local_save_flags(flags);
3322         size = sizeof(*entry) + len + 1;
3323         ring_buffer_nest_start(buffer);
3324         event = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, TRACE_PRINT, size,
3325                                             flags, pc);
3326         if (!event)
3327                 goto out;
3328         entry = ring_buffer_event_data(event);
3329         entry->ip = ip;
3330 
3331         memcpy(&entry->buf, tbuffer, len + 1);
3332         if (!call_filter_check_discard(call, entry, buffer, event)) {
3333                 __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
3334                 ftrace_trace_stack(&global_trace, buffer, flags, 6, pc, NULL);
3335         }
3336 
3337 out:
3338         ring_buffer_nest_end(buffer);
3339         put_trace_buf();
3340 
3341 out_nobuffer:
3342         preempt_enable_notrace();
3343         unpause_graph_tracing();
3344 
3345         return len;
3346 }
3347 
3348 __printf(3, 0)
3349 int trace_array_vprintk(struct trace_array *tr,
3350                         unsigned long ip, const char *fmt, va_list args)
3351 {
3352         return __trace_array_vprintk(tr->array_buffer.buffer, ip, fmt, args);
3353 }
3354 
3355 /**
3356  * trace_array_printk - Print a message to a specific instance
3357  * @tr: The instance trace_array descriptor
3358  * @ip: The instruction pointer that this is called from.
3359  * @fmt: The format to print (printf format)
3360  *
3361  * If a subsystem sets up its own instance, they have the right to
3362  * printk strings into their tracing instance buffer using this
3363  * function. Note, this function will not write into the top level
3364  * buffer (use trace_printk() for that), as writing into the top level
3365  * buffer should only have events that can be individually disabled.
3366  * trace_printk() is only used for debugging a kernel, and should not
3367  * be ever encorporated in normal use.
3368  *
3369  * trace_array_printk() can be used, as it will not add noise to the
3370  * top level tracing buffer.
3371  *
3372  * Note, trace_array_init_printk() must be called on @tr before this
3373  * can be used.
3374  */
3375 __printf(3, 0)
3376 int trace_array_printk(struct trace_array *tr,
3377                        unsigned long ip, const char *fmt, ...)
3378 {
3379         int ret;
3380         va_list ap;
3381 
3382         if (!tr)
3383                 return -ENOENT;
3384 
3385         /* This is only allowed for created instances */
3386         if (tr == &global_trace)
3387                 return 0;
3388 
3389         if (!(tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK))
3390                 return 0;
3391 
3392         va_start(ap, fmt);
3393         ret = trace_array_vprintk(tr, ip, fmt, ap);
3394         va_end(ap);
3395         return ret;
3396 }
3397 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_array_printk);
3398 
3399 /**
3400  * trace_array_init_printk - Initialize buffers for trace_array_printk()
3401  * @tr: The trace array to initialize the buffers for
3402  *
3403  * As trace_array_printk() only writes into instances, they are OK to
3404  * have in the kernel (unlike trace_printk()). This needs to be called
3405  * before trace_array_printk() can be used on a trace_array.
3406  */
3407 int trace_array_init_printk(struct trace_array *tr)
3408 {
3409         if (!tr)
3410                 return -ENOENT;
3411 
3412         /* This is only allowed for created instances */
3413         if (tr == &global_trace)
3414                 return -EINVAL;
3415 
3416         return alloc_percpu_trace_buffer();
3417 }
3418 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_array_init_printk);
3419 
3420 __printf(3, 4)
3421 int trace_array_printk_buf(struct trace_buffer *buffer,
3422                            unsigned long ip, const char *fmt, ...)
3423 {
3424         int ret;
3425         va_list ap;
3426 
3427         if (!(global_trace.trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK))
3428                 return 0;
3429 
3430         va_start(ap, fmt);
3431         ret = __trace_array_vprintk(buffer, ip, fmt, ap);
3432         va_end(ap);
3433         return ret;
3434 }
3435 
3436 __printf(2, 0)
3437 int trace_vprintk(unsigned long ip, const char *fmt, va_list args)
3438 {
3439         return trace_array_vprintk(&global_trace, ip, fmt, args);
3440 }
3441 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_vprintk);
3442 
3443 static void trace_iterator_increment(struct trace_iterator *iter)
3444 {
3445         struct ring_buffer_iter *buf_iter = trace_buffer_iter(iter, iter->cpu);
3446 
3447         iter->idx++;
3448         if (buf_iter)
3449                 ring_buffer_iter_advance(buf_iter);
3450 }
3451 
3452 static struct trace_entry *
3453 peek_next_entry(struct trace_iterator *iter, int cpu, u64 *ts,
3454                 unsigned long *lost_events)
3455 {
3456         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
3457         struct ring_buffer_iter *buf_iter = trace_buffer_iter(iter, cpu);
3458 
3459         if (buf_iter) {
3460                 event = ring_buffer_iter_peek(buf_iter, ts);
3461                 if (lost_events)
3462                         *lost_events = ring_buffer_iter_dropped(buf_iter) ?
3463                                 (unsigned long)-1 : 0;
3464         } else {
3465                 event = ring_buffer_peek(iter->array_buffer->buffer, cpu, ts,
3466                                          lost_events);
3467         }
3468 
3469         if (event) {
3470                 iter->ent_size = ring_buffer_event_length(event);
3471                 return ring_buffer_event_data(event);
3472         }
3473         iter->ent_size = 0;
3474         return NULL;
3475 }
3476 
3477 static struct trace_entry *
3478 __find_next_entry(struct trace_iterator *iter, int *ent_cpu,
3479                   unsigned long *missing_events, u64 *ent_ts)
3480 {
3481         struct trace_buffer *buffer = iter->array_buffer->buffer;
3482         struct trace_entry *ent, *next = NULL;
3483         unsigned long lost_events = 0, next_lost = 0;
3484         int cpu_file = iter->cpu_file;
3485         u64 next_ts = 0, ts;
3486         int next_cpu = -1;
3487         int next_size = 0;
3488         int cpu;
3489 
3490         /*
3491          * If we are in a per_cpu trace file, don't bother by iterating over
3492          * all cpu and peek directly.
3493          */
3494         if (cpu_file > RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
3495                 if (ring_buffer_empty_cpu(buffer, cpu_file))
3496                         return NULL;
3497                 ent = peek_next_entry(iter, cpu_file, ent_ts, missing_events);
3498                 if (ent_cpu)
3499                         *ent_cpu = cpu_file;
3500 
3501                 return ent;
3502         }
3503 
3504         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
3505 
3506                 if (ring_buffer_empty_cpu(buffer, cpu))
3507                         continue;
3508 
3509                 ent = peek_next_entry(iter, cpu, &ts, &lost_events);
3510 
3511                 /*
3512                  * Pick the entry with the smallest timestamp:
3513                  */
3514                 if (ent && (!next || ts < next_ts)) {
3515                         next = ent;
3516                         next_cpu = cpu;
3517                         next_ts = ts;
3518                         next_lost = lost_events;
3519                         next_size = iter->ent_size;
3520                 }
3521         }
3522 
3523         iter->ent_size = next_size;
3524 
3525         if (ent_cpu)
3526                 *ent_cpu = next_cpu;
3527 
3528         if (ent_ts)
3529                 *ent_ts = next_ts;
3530 
3531         if (missing_events)
3532                 *missing_events = next_lost;
3533 
3534         return next;
3535 }
3536 
3537 #define STATIC_TEMP_BUF_SIZE    128
3538 static char static_temp_buf[STATIC_TEMP_BUF_SIZE] __aligned(4);
3539 
3540 /* Find the next real entry, without updating the iterator itself */
3541 struct trace_entry *trace_find_next_entry(struct trace_iterator *iter,
3542                                           int *ent_cpu, u64 *ent_ts)
3543 {
3544         /* __find_next_entry will reset ent_size */
3545         int ent_size = iter->ent_size;
3546         struct trace_entry *entry;
3547 
3548         /*
3549          * If called from ftrace_dump(), then the iter->temp buffer
3550          * will be the static_temp_buf and not created from kmalloc.
3551          * If the entry size is greater than the buffer, we can
3552          * not save it. Just return NULL in that case. This is only
3553          * used to add markers when two consecutive events' time
3554          * stamps have a large delta. See trace_print_lat_context()
3555          */
3556         if (iter->temp == static_temp_buf &&
3557             STATIC_TEMP_BUF_SIZE < ent_size)
3558                 return NULL;
3559 
3560         /*
3561          * The __find_next_entry() may call peek_next_entry(), which may
3562          * call ring_buffer_peek() that may make the contents of iter->ent
3563          * undefined. Need to copy iter->ent now.
3564          */
3565         if (iter->ent && iter->ent != iter->temp) {
3566                 if ((!iter->temp || iter->temp_size < iter->ent_size) &&
3567                     !WARN_ON_ONCE(iter->temp == static_temp_buf)) {
3568                         void *temp;
3569                         temp = kmalloc(iter->ent_size, GFP_KERNEL);
3570                         if (!temp)
3571                                 return NULL;
3572                         kfree(iter->temp);
3573                         iter->temp = temp;
3574                         iter->temp_size = iter->ent_size;
3575                 }
3576                 memcpy(iter->temp, iter->ent, iter->ent_size);
3577                 iter->ent = iter->temp;
3578         }
3579         entry = __find_next_entry(iter, ent_cpu, NULL, ent_ts);
3580         /* Put back the original ent_size */
3581         iter->ent_size = ent_size;
3582 
3583         return entry;
3584 }
3585 
3586 /* Find the next real entry, and increment the iterator to the next entry */
3587 void *trace_find_next_entry_inc(struct trace_iterator *iter)
3588 {
3589         iter->ent = __find_next_entry(iter, &iter->cpu,
3590                                       &iter->lost_events, &iter->ts);
3591 
3592         if (iter->ent)
3593                 trace_iterator_increment(iter);
3594 
3595         return iter->ent ? iter : NULL;
3596 }
3597 
3598 static void trace_consume(struct trace_iterator *iter)
3599 {
3600         ring_buffer_consume(iter->array_buffer->buffer, iter->cpu, &iter->ts,
3601                             &iter->lost_events);
3602 }
3603 
3604 static void *s_next(struct seq_file *m, void *v, loff_t *pos)
3605 {
3606         struct trace_iterator *iter = m->private;
3607         int i = (int)*pos;
3608         void *ent;
3609 
3610         WARN_ON_ONCE(iter->leftover);
3611 
3612         (*pos)++;
3613 
3614         /* can't go backwards */
3615         if (iter->idx > i)
3616                 return NULL;
3617 
3618         if (iter->idx < 0)
3619                 ent = trace_find_next_entry_inc(iter);
3620         else
3621                 ent = iter;
3622 
3623         while (ent && iter->idx < i)
3624                 ent = trace_find_next_entry_inc(iter);
3625 
3626         iter->pos = *pos;
3627 
3628         return ent;
3629 }
3630 
3631 void tracing_iter_reset(struct trace_iterator *iter, int cpu)
3632 {
3633         struct ring_buffer_iter *buf_iter;
3634         unsigned long entries = 0;
3635         u64 ts;
3636 
3637         per_cpu_ptr(iter->array_buffer->data, cpu)->skipped_entries = 0;
3638 
3639         buf_iter = trace_buffer_iter(iter, cpu);
3640         if (!buf_iter)
3641                 return;
3642 
3643         ring_buffer_iter_reset(buf_iter);
3644 
3645         /*
3646          * We could have the case with the max latency tracers
3647          * that a reset never took place on a cpu. This is evident
3648          * by the timestamp being before the start of the buffer.
3649          */
3650         while (ring_buffer_iter_peek(buf_iter, &ts)) {
3651                 if (ts >= iter->array_buffer->time_start)
3652                         break;
3653                 entries++;
3654                 ring_buffer_iter_advance(buf_iter);
3655         }
3656 
3657         per_cpu_ptr(iter->array_buffer->data, cpu)->skipped_entries = entries;
3658 }
3659 
3660 /*
3661  * The current tracer is copied to avoid a global locking
3662  * all around.
3663  */
3664 static void *s_start(struct seq_file *m, loff_t *pos)
3665 {
3666         struct trace_iterator *iter = m->private;
3667         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
3668         int cpu_file = iter->cpu_file;
3669         void *p = NULL;
3670         loff_t l = 0;
3671         int cpu;
3672 
3673         /*
3674          * copy the tracer to avoid using a global lock all around.
3675          * iter->trace is a copy of current_trace, the pointer to the
3676          * name may be used instead of a strcmp(), as iter->trace->name
3677          * will point to the same string as current_trace->name.
3678          */
3679         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
3680         if (unlikely(tr->current_trace && iter->trace->name != tr->current_trace->name))
3681                 *iter->trace = *tr->current_trace;
3682         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
3683 
3684 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
3685         if (iter->snapshot && iter->trace->use_max_tr)
3686                 return ERR_PTR(-EBUSY);
3687 #endif
3688 
3689         if (!iter->snapshot)
3690                 atomic_inc(&trace_record_taskinfo_disabled);
3691 
3692         if (*pos != iter->pos) {
3693                 iter->ent = NULL;
3694                 iter->cpu = 0;
3695                 iter->idx = -1;
3696 
3697                 if (cpu_file == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
3698                         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu)
3699                                 tracing_iter_reset(iter, cpu);
3700                 } else
3701                         tracing_iter_reset(iter, cpu_file);
3702 
3703                 iter->leftover = 0;
3704                 for (p = iter; p && l < *pos; p = s_next(m, p, &l))
3705                         ;
3706 
3707         } else {
3708                 /*
3709                  * If we overflowed the seq_file before, then we want
3710                  * to just reuse the trace_seq buffer again.
3711                  */
3712                 if (iter->leftover)
3713                         p = iter;
3714                 else {
3715                         l = *pos - 1;
3716                         p = s_next(m, p, &l);
3717                 }
3718         }
3719 
3720         trace_event_read_lock();
3721         trace_access_lock(cpu_file);
3722         return p;
3723 }
3724 
3725 static void s_stop(struct seq_file *m, void *p)
3726 {
3727         struct trace_iterator *iter = m->private;
3728 
3729 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
3730         if (iter->snapshot && iter->trace->use_max_tr)
3731                 return;
3732 #endif
3733 
3734         if (!iter->snapshot)
3735                 atomic_dec(&trace_record_taskinfo_disabled);
3736 
3737         trace_access_unlock(iter->cpu_file);
3738         trace_event_read_unlock();
3739 }
3740 
3741 static void
3742 get_total_entries_cpu(struct array_buffer *buf, unsigned long *total,
3743                       unsigned long *entries, int cpu)
3744 {
3745         unsigned long count;
3746 
3747         count = ring_buffer_entries_cpu(buf->buffer, cpu);
3748         /*
3749          * If this buffer has skipped entries, then we hold all
3750          * entries for the trace and we need to ignore the
3751          * ones before the time stamp.
3752          */
3753         if (per_cpu_ptr(buf->data, cpu)->skipped_entries) {
3754                 count -= per_cpu_ptr(buf->data, cpu)->skipped_entries;
3755                 /* total is the same as the entries */
3756                 *total = count;
3757         } else
3758                 *total = count +
3759                         ring_buffer_overrun_cpu(buf->buffer, cpu);
3760         *entries = count;
3761 }
3762 
3763 static void
3764 get_total_entries(struct array_buffer *buf,
3765                   unsigned long *total, unsigned long *entries)
3766 {
3767         unsigned long t, e;
3768         int cpu;
3769 
3770         *total = 0;
3771         *entries = 0;
3772 
3773         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
3774                 get_total_entries_cpu(buf, &t, &e, cpu);
3775                 *total += t;
3776                 *entries += e;
3777         }
3778 }
3779 
3780 unsigned long trace_total_entries_cpu(struct trace_array *tr, int cpu)
3781 {
3782         unsigned long total, entries;
3783 
3784         if (!tr)
3785                 tr = &global_trace;
3786 
3787         get_total_entries_cpu(&tr->array_buffer, &total, &entries, cpu);
3788 
3789         return entries;
3790 }
3791 
3792 unsigned long trace_total_entries(struct trace_array *tr)
3793 {
3794         unsigned long total, entries;
3795 
3796         if (!tr)
3797                 tr = &global_trace;
3798 
3799         get_total_entries(&tr->array_buffer, &total, &entries);
3800 
3801         return entries;
3802 }
3803 
3804 static void print_lat_help_header(struct seq_file *m)
3805 {
3806         seq_puts(m, "#                    _------=> CPU#            \n"
3807                     "#                   / _-----=> irqs-off        \n"
3808                     "#                  | / _----=> need-resched    \n"
3809                     "#                  || / _---=> hardirq/softirq \n"
3810                     "#                  ||| / _--=> preempt-depth   \n"
3811                     "#                  |||| /     delay            \n"
3812                     "#  cmd     pid     ||||| time  |   caller      \n"
3813                     "#     \\   /        |||||  \\    |   /         \n");
3814 }
3815 
3816 static void print_event_info(struct array_buffer *buf, struct seq_file *m)
3817 {
3818         unsigned long total;
3819         unsigned long entries;
3820 
3821         get_total_entries(buf, &total, &entries);
3822         seq_printf(m, "# entries-in-buffer/entries-written: %lu/%lu   #P:%d\n",
3823                    entries, total, num_online_cpus());
3824         seq_puts(m, "#\n");
3825 }
3826 
3827 static void print_func_help_header(struct array_buffer *buf, struct seq_file *m,
3828                                    unsigned int flags)
3829 {
3830         bool tgid = flags & TRACE_ITER_RECORD_TGID;
3831 
3832         print_event_info(buf, m);
3833 
3834         seq_printf(m, "#           TASK-PID    %s CPU#     TIMESTAMP  FUNCTION\n", tgid ? "   TGID   " : "");
3835         seq_printf(m, "#              | |      %s   |         |         |\n",      tgid ? "     |    " : "");
3836 }
3837 
3838 static void print_func_help_header_irq(struct array_buffer *buf, struct seq_file *m,
3839                                        unsigned int flags)
3840 {
3841         bool tgid = flags & TRACE_ITER_RECORD_TGID;
3842         const char *space = "            ";
3843         int prec = tgid ? 12 : 2;
3844 
3845         print_event_info(buf, m);
3846 
3847         seq_printf(m, "#                            %.*s  _-----=> irqs-off\n", prec, space);
3848         seq_printf(m, "#                            %.*s / _----=> need-resched\n", prec, space);
3849         seq_printf(m, "#                            %.*s| / _---=> hardirq/softirq\n", prec, space);
3850         seq_printf(m, "#                            %.*s|| / _--=> preempt-depth\n", prec, space);
3851         seq_printf(m, "#                            %.*s||| /     delay\n", prec, space);
3852         seq_printf(m, "#           TASK-PID  %.*s CPU#  ||||   TIMESTAMP  FUNCTION\n", prec, "     TGID   ");
3853         seq_printf(m, "#              | |    %.*s   |   ||||      |         |\n", prec, "       |    ");
3854 }
3855 
3856 void
3857 print_trace_header(struct seq_file *m, struct trace_iterator *iter)
3858 {
3859         unsigned long sym_flags = (global_trace.trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_SYM_MASK);
3860         struct array_buffer *buf = iter->array_buffer;
3861         struct trace_array_cpu *data = per_cpu_ptr(buf->data, buf->cpu);
3862         struct tracer *type = iter->trace;
3863         unsigned long entries;
3864         unsigned long total;
3865         const char *name = "preemption";
3866 
3867         name = type->name;
3868 
3869         get_total_entries(buf, &total, &entries);
3870 
3871         seq_printf(m, "# %s latency trace v1.1.5 on %s\n",
3872                    name, UTS_RELEASE);
3873         seq_puts(m, "# -----------------------------------"
3874                  "---------------------------------\n");
3875         seq_printf(m, "# latency: %lu us, #%lu/%lu, CPU#%d |"
3876                    " (M:%s VP:%d, KP:%d, SP:%d HP:%d",
3877                    nsecs_to_usecs(data->saved_latency),
3878                    entries,
3879                    total,
3880                    buf->cpu,
3881 #if defined(CONFIG_PREEMPT_NONE)
3882                    "server",
3883 #elif defined(CONFIG_PREEMPT_VOLUNTARY)
3884                    "desktop",
3885 #elif defined(CONFIG_PREEMPT)
3886                    "preempt",
3887 #elif defined(CONFIG_PREEMPT_RT)
3888                    "preempt_rt",
3889 #else
3890                    "unknown",
3891 #endif
3892                    /* These are reserved for later use */
3893                    0, 0, 0, 0);
3894 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
3895         seq_printf(m, " #P:%d)\n", num_online_cpus());
3896 #else
3897         seq_puts(m, ")\n");
3898 #endif
3899         seq_puts(m, "#    -----------------\n");
3900         seq_printf(m, "#    | task: %.16s-%d "
3901                    "(uid:%d nice:%ld policy:%ld rt_prio:%ld)\n",
3902                    data->comm, data->pid,
3903                    from_kuid_munged(seq_user_ns(m), data->uid), data->nice,
3904                    data->policy, data->rt_priority);
3905         seq_puts(m, "#    -----------------\n");
3906 
3907         if (data->critical_start) {
3908                 seq_puts(m, "#  => started at: ");
3909                 seq_print_ip_sym(&iter->seq, data->critical_start, sym_flags);
3910                 trace_print_seq(m, &iter->seq);
3911                 seq_puts(m, "\n#  => ended at:   ");
3912                 seq_print_ip_sym(&iter->seq, data->critical_end, sym_flags);
3913                 trace_print_seq(m, &iter->seq);
3914                 seq_puts(m, "\n#\n");
3915         }
3916 
3917         seq_puts(m, "#\n");
3918 }
3919 
3920 static void test_cpu_buff_start(struct trace_iterator *iter)
3921 {
3922         struct trace_seq *s = &iter->seq;
3923         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
3924 
3925         if (!(tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_ANNOTATE))
3926                 return;
3927 
3928         if (!(iter->iter_flags & TRACE_FILE_ANNOTATE))
3929                 return;
3930 
3931         if (cpumask_available(iter->started) &&
3932             cpumask_test_cpu(iter->cpu, iter->started))
3933                 return;
3934 
3935         if (per_cpu_ptr(iter->array_buffer->data, iter->cpu)->skipped_entries)
3936                 return;
3937 
3938         if (cpumask_available(iter->started))
3939                 cpumask_set_cpu(iter->cpu, iter->started);
3940 
3941         /* Don't print started cpu buffer for the first entry of the trace */
3942         if (iter->idx > 1)
3943                 trace_seq_printf(s, "##### CPU %u buffer started ####\n",
3944                                 iter->cpu);
3945 }
3946 
3947 static enum print_line_t print_trace_fmt(struct trace_iterator *iter)
3948 {
3949         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
3950         struct trace_seq *s = &iter->seq;
3951         unsigned long sym_flags = (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_SYM_MASK);
3952         struct trace_entry *entry;
3953         struct trace_event *event;
3954 
3955         entry = iter->ent;
3956 
3957         test_cpu_buff_start(iter);
3958 
3959         event = ftrace_find_event(entry->type);
3960 
3961         if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_CONTEXT_INFO) {
3962                 if (iter->iter_flags & TRACE_FILE_LAT_FMT)
3963                         trace_print_lat_context(iter);
3964                 else
3965                         trace_print_context(iter);
3966         }
3967 
3968         if (trace_seq_has_overflowed(s))
3969                 return TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE;
3970 
3971         if (event)
3972                 return event->funcs->trace(iter, sym_flags, event);
3973 
3974         trace_seq_printf(s, "Unknown type %d\n", entry->type);
3975 
3976         return trace_handle_return(s);
3977 }
3978 
3979 static enum print_line_t print_raw_fmt(struct trace_iterator *iter)
3980 {
3981         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
3982         struct trace_seq *s = &iter->seq;
3983         struct trace_entry *entry;
3984         struct trace_event *event;
3985 
3986         entry = iter->ent;
3987 
3988         if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_CONTEXT_INFO)
3989                 trace_seq_printf(s, "%d %d %llu ",
3990                                  entry->pid, iter->cpu, iter->ts);
3991 
3992         if (trace_seq_has_overflowed(s))
3993                 return TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE;
3994 
3995         event = ftrace_find_event(entry->type);
3996         if (event)
3997                 return event->funcs->raw(iter, 0, event);
3998 
3999         trace_seq_printf(s, "%d ?\n", entry->type);
4000 
4001         return trace_handle_return(s);
4002 }
4003 
4004 static enum print_line_t print_hex_fmt(struct trace_iterator *iter)
4005 {
4006         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
4007         struct trace_seq *s = &iter->seq;
4008         unsigned char newline = '\n';
4009         struct trace_entry *entry;
4010         struct trace_event *event;
4011 
4012         entry = iter->ent;
4013 
4014         if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_CONTEXT_INFO) {
4015                 SEQ_PUT_HEX_FIELD(s, entry->pid);
4016                 SEQ_PUT_HEX_FIELD(s, iter->cpu);
4017                 SEQ_PUT_HEX_FIELD(s, iter->ts);
4018                 if (trace_seq_has_overflowed(s))
4019                         return TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE;
4020         }
4021 
4022         event = ftrace_find_event(entry->type);
4023         if (event) {
4024                 enum print_line_t ret = event->funcs->hex(iter, 0, event);
4025                 if (ret != TRACE_TYPE_HANDLED)
4026                         return ret;
4027         }
4028 
4029         SEQ_PUT_FIELD(s, newline);
4030 
4031         return trace_handle_return(s);
4032 }
4033 
4034 static enum print_line_t print_bin_fmt(struct trace_iterator *iter)
4035 {
4036         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
4037         struct trace_seq *s = &iter->seq;
4038         struct trace_entry *entry;
4039         struct trace_event *event;
4040 
4041         entry = iter->ent;
4042 
4043         if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_CONTEXT_INFO) {
4044                 SEQ_PUT_FIELD(s, entry->pid);
4045                 SEQ_PUT_FIELD(s, iter->cpu);
4046                 SEQ_PUT_FIELD(s, iter->ts);
4047                 if (trace_seq_has_overflowed(s))
4048                         return TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE;
4049         }
4050 
4051         event = ftrace_find_event(entry->type);
4052         return event ? event->funcs->binary(iter, 0, event) :
4053                 TRACE_TYPE_HANDLED;
4054 }
4055 
4056 int trace_empty(struct trace_iterator *iter)
4057 {
4058         struct ring_buffer_iter *buf_iter;
4059         int cpu;
4060 
4061         /* If we are looking at one CPU buffer, only check that one */
4062         if (iter->cpu_file != RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
4063                 cpu = iter->cpu_file;
4064                 buf_iter = trace_buffer_iter(iter, cpu);
4065                 if (buf_iter) {
4066                         if (!ring_buffer_iter_empty(buf_iter))
4067                                 return 0;
4068                 } else {
4069                         if (!ring_buffer_empty_cpu(iter->array_buffer->buffer, cpu))
4070                                 return 0;
4071                 }
4072                 return 1;
4073         }
4074 
4075         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
4076                 buf_iter = trace_buffer_iter(iter, cpu);
4077                 if (buf_iter) {
4078                         if (!ring_buffer_iter_empty(buf_iter))
4079                                 return 0;
4080                 } else {
4081                         if (!ring_buffer_empty_cpu(iter->array_buffer->buffer, cpu))
4082                                 return 0;
4083                 }
4084         }
4085 
4086         return 1;
4087 }
4088 
4089 /*  Called with trace_event_read_lock() held. */
4090 enum print_line_t print_trace_line(struct trace_iterator *iter)
4091 {
4092         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
4093         unsigned long trace_flags = tr->trace_flags;
4094         enum print_line_t ret;
4095 
4096         if (iter->lost_events) {
4097                 if (iter->lost_events == (unsigned long)-1)
4098                         trace_seq_printf(&iter->seq, "CPU:%d [LOST EVENTS]\n",
4099                                          iter->cpu);
4100                 else
4101                         trace_seq_printf(&iter->seq, "CPU:%d [LOST %lu EVENTS]\n",
4102                                          iter->cpu, iter->lost_events);
4103                 if (trace_seq_has_overflowed(&iter->seq))
4104                         return TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE;
4105         }
4106 
4107         if (iter->trace && iter->trace->print_line) {
4108                 ret = iter->trace->print_line(iter);
4109                 if (ret != TRACE_TYPE_UNHANDLED)
4110                         return ret;
4111         }
4112 
4113         if (iter->ent->type == TRACE_BPUTS &&
4114                         trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK &&
4115                         trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK_MSGONLY)
4116                 return trace_print_bputs_msg_only(iter);
4117 
4118         if (iter->ent->type == TRACE_BPRINT &&
4119                         trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK &&
4120                         trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK_MSGONLY)
4121                 return trace_print_bprintk_msg_only(iter);
4122 
4123         if (iter->ent->type == TRACE_PRINT &&
4124                         trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK &&
4125                         trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PRINTK_MSGONLY)
4126                 return trace_print_printk_msg_only(iter);
4127 
4128         if (trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_BIN)
4129                 return print_bin_fmt(iter);
4130 
4131         if (trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_HEX)
4132                 return print_hex_fmt(iter);
4133 
4134         if (trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_RAW)
4135                 return print_raw_fmt(iter);
4136 
4137         return print_trace_fmt(iter);
4138 }
4139 
4140 void trace_latency_header(struct seq_file *m)
4141 {
4142         struct trace_iterator *iter = m->private;
4143         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
4144 
4145         /* print nothing if the buffers are empty */
4146         if (trace_empty(iter))
4147                 return;
4148 
4149         if (iter->iter_flags & TRACE_FILE_LAT_FMT)
4150                 print_trace_header(m, iter);
4151 
4152         if (!(tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_VERBOSE))
4153                 print_lat_help_header(m);
4154 }
4155 
4156 void trace_default_header(struct seq_file *m)
4157 {
4158         struct trace_iterator *iter = m->private;
4159         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
4160         unsigned long trace_flags = tr->trace_flags;
4161 
4162         if (!(trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_CONTEXT_INFO))
4163                 return;
4164 
4165         if (iter->iter_flags & TRACE_FILE_LAT_FMT) {
4166                 /* print nothing if the buffers are empty */
4167                 if (trace_empty(iter))
4168                         return;
4169                 print_trace_header(m, iter);
4170                 if (!(trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_VERBOSE))
4171                         print_lat_help_header(m);
4172         } else {
4173                 if (!(trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_VERBOSE)) {
4174                         if (trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_IRQ_INFO)
4175                                 print_func_help_header_irq(iter->array_buffer,
4176                                                            m, trace_flags);
4177                         else
4178                                 print_func_help_header(iter->array_buffer, m,
4179                                                        trace_flags);
4180                 }
4181         }
4182 }
4183 
4184 static void test_ftrace_alive(struct seq_file *m)
4185 {
4186         if (!ftrace_is_dead())
4187                 return;
4188         seq_puts(m, "# WARNING: FUNCTION TRACING IS CORRUPTED\n"
4189                     "#          MAY BE MISSING FUNCTION EVENTS\n");
4190 }
4191 
4192 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
4193 static void show_snapshot_main_help(struct seq_file *m)
4194 {
4195         seq_puts(m, "# echo 0 > snapshot : Clears and frees snapshot buffer\n"
4196                     "# echo 1 > snapshot : Allocates snapshot buffer, if not already allocated.\n"
4197                     "#                      Takes a snapshot of the main buffer.\n"
4198                     "# echo 2 > snapshot : Clears snapshot buffer (but does not allocate or free)\n"
4199                     "#                      (Doesn't have to be '2' works with any number that\n"
4200                     "#                       is not a '0' or '1')\n");
4201 }
4202 
4203 static void show_snapshot_percpu_help(struct seq_file *m)
4204 {
4205         seq_puts(m, "# echo 0 > snapshot : Invalid for per_cpu snapshot file.\n");
4206 #ifdef CONFIG_RING_BUFFER_ALLOW_SWAP
4207         seq_puts(m, "# echo 1 > snapshot : Allocates snapshot buffer, if not already allocated.\n"
4208                     "#                      Takes a snapshot of the main buffer for this cpu.\n");
4209 #else
4210         seq_puts(m, "# echo 1 > snapshot : Not supported with this kernel.\n"
4211                     "#                     Must use main snapshot file to allocate.\n");
4212 #endif
4213         seq_puts(m, "# echo 2 > snapshot : Clears this cpu's snapshot buffer (but does not allocate)\n"
4214                     "#                      (Doesn't have to be '2' works with any number that\n"
4215                     "#                       is not a '0' or '1')\n");
4216 }
4217 
4218 static void print_snapshot_help(struct seq_file *m, struct trace_iterator *iter)
4219 {
4220         if (iter->tr->allocated_snapshot)
4221                 seq_puts(m, "#\n# * Snapshot is allocated *\n#\n");
4222         else
4223                 seq_puts(m, "#\n# * Snapshot is freed *\n#\n");
4224 
4225         seq_puts(m, "# Snapshot commands:\n");
4226         if (iter->cpu_file == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS)
4227                 show_snapshot_main_help(m);
4228         else
4229                 show_snapshot_percpu_help(m);
4230 }
4231 #else
4232 /* Should never be called */
4233 static inline void print_snapshot_help(struct seq_file *m, struct trace_iterator *iter) { }
4234 #endif
4235 
4236 static int s_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
4237 {
4238         struct trace_iterator *iter = v;
4239         int ret;
4240 
4241         if (iter->ent == NULL) {
4242                 if (iter->tr) {
4243                         seq_printf(m, "# tracer: %s\n", iter->trace->name);
4244                         seq_puts(m, "#\n");
4245                         test_ftrace_alive(m);
4246                 }
4247                 if (iter->snapshot && trace_empty(iter))
4248                         print_snapshot_help(m, iter);
4249                 else if (iter->trace && iter->trace->print_header)
4250                         iter->trace->print_header(m);
4251                 else
4252                         trace_default_header(m);
4253 
4254         } else if (iter->leftover) {
4255                 /*
4256                  * If we filled the seq_file buffer earlier, we
4257                  * want to just show it now.
4258                  */
4259                 ret = trace_print_seq(m, &iter->seq);
4260 
4261                 /* ret should this time be zero, but you never know */
4262                 iter->leftover = ret;
4263 
4264         } else {
4265                 print_trace_line(iter);
4266                 ret = trace_print_seq(m, &iter->seq);
4267                 /*
4268                  * If we overflow the seq_file buffer, then it will
4269                  * ask us for this data again at start up.
4270                  * Use that instead.
4271                  *  ret is 0 if seq_file write succeeded.
4272                  *        -1 otherwise.
4273                  */
4274                 iter->leftover = ret;
4275         }
4276 
4277         return 0;
4278 }
4279 
4280 /*
4281  * Should be used after trace_array_get(), trace_types_lock
4282  * ensures that i_cdev was already initialized.
4283  */
4284 static inline int tracing_get_cpu(struct inode *inode)
4285 {
4286         if (inode->i_cdev) /* See trace_create_cpu_file() */
4287                 return (long)inode->i_cdev - 1;
4288         return RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS;
4289 }
4290 
4291 static const struct seq_operations tracer_seq_ops = {
4292         .start          = s_start,
4293         .next           = s_next,
4294         .stop           = s_stop,
4295         .show           = s_show,
4296 };
4297 
4298 static struct trace_iterator *
4299 __tracing_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file, bool snapshot)
4300 {
4301         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4302         struct trace_iterator *iter;
4303         int cpu;
4304 
4305         if (tracing_disabled)
4306                 return ERR_PTR(-ENODEV);
4307 
4308         iter = __seq_open_private(file, &tracer_seq_ops, sizeof(*iter));
4309         if (!iter)
4310                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
4311 
4312         iter->buffer_iter = kcalloc(nr_cpu_ids, sizeof(*iter->buffer_iter),
4313                                     GFP_KERNEL);
4314         if (!iter->buffer_iter)
4315                 goto release;
4316 
4317         /*
4318          * trace_find_next_entry() may need to save off iter->ent.
4319          * It will place it into the iter->temp buffer. As most
4320          * events are less than 128, allocate a buffer of that size.
4321          * If one is greater, then trace_find_next_entry() will
4322          * allocate a new buffer to adjust for the bigger iter->ent.
4323          * It's not critical if it fails to get allocated here.
4324          */
4325         iter->temp = kmalloc(128, GFP_KERNEL);
4326         if (iter->temp)
4327                 iter->temp_size = 128;
4328 
4329         /*
4330          * We make a copy of the current tracer to avoid concurrent
4331          * changes on it while we are reading.
4332          */
4333         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
4334         iter->trace = kzalloc(sizeof(*iter->trace), GFP_KERNEL);
4335         if (!iter->trace)
4336                 goto fail;
4337 
4338         *iter->trace = *tr->current_trace;
4339 
4340         if (!zalloc_cpumask_var(&iter->started, GFP_KERNEL))
4341                 goto fail;
4342 
4343         iter->tr = tr;
4344 
4345 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
4346         /* Currently only the top directory has a snapshot */
4347         if (tr->current_trace->print_max || snapshot)
4348                 iter->array_buffer = &tr->max_buffer;
4349         else
4350 #endif
4351                 iter->array_buffer = &tr->array_buffer;
4352         iter->snapshot = snapshot;
4353         iter->pos = -1;
4354         iter->cpu_file = tracing_get_cpu(inode);
4355         mutex_init(&iter->mutex);
4356 
4357         /* Notify the tracer early; before we stop tracing. */
4358         if (iter->trace->open)
4359                 iter->trace->open(iter);
4360 
4361         /* Annotate start of buffers if we had overruns */
4362         if (ring_buffer_overruns(iter->array_buffer->buffer))
4363                 iter->iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_ANNOTATE;
4364 
4365         /* Output in nanoseconds only if we are using a clock in nanoseconds. */
4366         if (trace_clocks[tr->clock_id].in_ns)
4367                 iter->iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_TIME_IN_NS;
4368 
4369         /*
4370          * If pause-on-trace is enabled, then stop the trace while
4371          * dumping, unless this is the "snapshot" file
4372          */
4373         if (!iter->snapshot && (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_PAUSE_ON_TRACE))
4374                 tracing_stop_tr(tr);
4375 
4376         if (iter->cpu_file == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
4377                 for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
4378                         iter->buffer_iter[cpu] =
4379                                 ring_buffer_read_prepare(iter->array_buffer->buffer,
4380                                                          cpu, GFP_KERNEL);
4381                 }
4382                 ring_buffer_read_prepare_sync();
4383                 for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
4384                         ring_buffer_read_start(iter->buffer_iter[cpu]);
4385                         tracing_iter_reset(iter, cpu);
4386                 }
4387         } else {
4388                 cpu = iter->cpu_file;
4389                 iter->buffer_iter[cpu] =
4390                         ring_buffer_read_prepare(iter->array_buffer->buffer,
4391                                                  cpu, GFP_KERNEL);
4392                 ring_buffer_read_prepare_sync();
4393                 ring_buffer_read_start(iter->buffer_iter[cpu]);
4394                 tracing_iter_reset(iter, cpu);
4395         }
4396 
4397         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
4398 
4399         return iter;
4400 
4401  fail:
4402         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
4403         kfree(iter->trace);
4404         kfree(iter->temp);
4405         kfree(iter->buffer_iter);
4406 release:
4407         seq_release_private(inode, file);
4408         return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
4409 }
4410 
4411 int tracing_open_generic(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
4412 {
4413         int ret;
4414 
4415         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(NULL);
4416         if (ret)
4417                 return ret;
4418 
4419         filp->private_data = inode->i_private;
4420         return 0;
4421 }
4422 
4423 bool tracing_is_disabled(void)
4424 {
4425         return (tracing_disabled) ? true: false;
4426 }
4427 
4428 /*
4429  * Open and update trace_array ref count.
4430  * Must have the current trace_array passed to it.
4431  */
4432 int tracing_open_generic_tr(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
4433 {
4434         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4435         int ret;
4436
