4437         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
4438         if (ret)
4439                 return ret;
4440 
4441         filp->private_data = inode->i_private;
4442 
4443         return 0;
4444 }
4445 
4446 static int tracing_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
4447 {
4448         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4449         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
4450         struct trace_iterator *iter;
4451         int cpu;
4452 
4453         if (!(file->f_mode & FMODE_READ)) {
4454                 trace_array_put(tr);
4455                 return 0;
4456         }
4457 
4458         /* Writes do not use seq_file */
4459         iter = m->private;
4460         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
4461 
4462         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
4463                 if (iter->buffer_iter[cpu])
4464                         ring_buffer_read_finish(iter->buffer_iter[cpu]);
4465         }
4466 
4467         if (iter->trace && iter->trace->close)
4468                 iter->trace->close(iter);
4469 
4470         if (!iter->snapshot && tr->stop_count)
4471                 /* reenable tracing if it was previously enabled */
4472                 tracing_start_tr(tr);
4473 
4474         __trace_array_put(tr);
4475 
4476         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
4477 
4478         mutex_destroy(&iter->mutex);
4479         free_cpumask_var(iter->started);
4480         kfree(iter->temp);
4481         kfree(iter->trace);
4482         kfree(iter->buffer_iter);
4483         seq_release_private(inode, file);
4484 
4485         return 0;
4486 }
4487 
4488 static int tracing_release_generic_tr(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
4489 {
4490         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4491 
4492         trace_array_put(tr);
4493         return 0;
4494 }
4495 
4496 static int tracing_single_release_tr(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
4497 {
4498         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4499 
4500         trace_array_put(tr);
4501 
4502         return single_release(inode, file);
4503 }
4504 
4505 static int tracing_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
4506 {
4507         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4508         struct trace_iterator *iter;
4509         int ret;
4510 
4511         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
4512         if (ret)
4513                 return ret;
4514 
4515         /* If this file was open for write, then erase contents */
4516         if ((file->f_mode & FMODE_WRITE) && (file->f_flags & O_TRUNC)) {
4517                 int cpu = tracing_get_cpu(inode);
4518                 struct array_buffer *trace_buf = &tr->array_buffer;
4519 
4520 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
4521                 if (tr->current_trace->print_max)
4522                         trace_buf = &tr->max_buffer;
4523 #endif
4524 
4525                 if (cpu == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS)
4526                         tracing_reset_online_cpus(trace_buf);
4527                 else
4528                         tracing_reset_cpu(trace_buf, cpu);
4529         }
4530 
4531         if (file->f_mode & FMODE_READ) {
4532                 iter = __tracing_open(inode, file, false);
4533                 if (IS_ERR(iter))
4534                         ret = PTR_ERR(iter);
4535                 else if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_LATENCY_FMT)
4536                         iter->iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_LAT_FMT;
4537         }
4538 
4539         if (ret < 0)
4540                 trace_array_put(tr);
4541 
4542         return ret;
4543 }
4544 
4545 /*
4546  * Some tracers are not suitable for instance buffers.
4547  * A tracer is always available for the global array (toplevel)
4548  * or if it explicitly states that it is.
4549  */
4550 static bool
4551 trace_ok_for_array(struct tracer *t, struct trace_array *tr)
4552 {
4553         return (tr->flags & TRACE_ARRAY_FL_GLOBAL) || t->allow_instances;
4554 }
4555 
4556 /* Find the next tracer that this trace array may use */
4557 static struct tracer *
4558 get_tracer_for_array(struct trace_array *tr, struct tracer *t)
4559 {
4560         while (t && !trace_ok_for_array(t, tr))
4561                 t = t->next;
4562 
4563         return t;
4564 }
4565 
4566 static void *
4567 t_next(struct seq_file *m, void *v, loff_t *pos)
4568 {
4569         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
4570         struct tracer *t = v;
4571 
4572         (*pos)++;
4573 
4574         if (t)
4575                 t = get_tracer_for_array(tr, t->next);
4576 
4577         return t;
4578 }
4579 
4580 static void *t_start(struct seq_file *m, loff_t *pos)
4581 {
4582         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
4583         struct tracer *t;
4584         loff_t l = 0;
4585 
4586         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
4587 
4588         t = get_tracer_for_array(tr, trace_types);
4589         for (; t && l < *pos; t = t_next(m, t, &l))
4590                         ;
4591 
4592         return t;
4593 }
4594 
4595 static void t_stop(struct seq_file *m, void *p)
4596 {
4597         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
4598 }
4599 
4600 static int t_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
4601 {
4602         struct tracer *t = v;
4603 
4604         if (!t)
4605                 return 0;
4606 
4607         seq_puts(m, t->name);
4608         if (t->next)
4609                 seq_putc(m, ' ');
4610         else
4611                 seq_putc(m, '\n');
4612 
4613         return 0;
4614 }
4615 
4616 static const struct seq_operations show_traces_seq_ops = {
4617         .start          = t_start,
4618         .next           = t_next,
4619         .stop           = t_stop,
4620         .show           = t_show,
4621 };
4622 
4623 static int show_traces_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
4624 {
4625         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4626         struct seq_file *m;
4627         int ret;
4628 
4629         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
4630         if (ret)
4631                 return ret;
4632 
4633         ret = seq_open(file, &show_traces_seq_ops);
4634         if (ret) {
4635                 trace_array_put(tr);
4636                 return ret;
4637         }
4638 
4639         m = file->private_data;
4640         m->private = tr;
4641 
4642         return 0;
4643 }
4644 
4645 static int show_traces_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
4646 {
4647         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
4648 
4649         trace_array_put(tr);
4650         return seq_release(inode, file);
4651 }
4652 
4653 static ssize_t
4654 tracing_write_stub(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
4655                    size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
4656 {
4657         return count;
4658 }
4659 
4660 loff_t tracing_lseek(struct file *file, loff_t offset, int whence)
4661 {
4662         int ret;
4663 
4664         if (file->f_mode & FMODE_READ)
4665                 ret = seq_lseek(file, offset, whence);
4666         else
4667                 file->f_pos = ret = 0;
4668 
4669         return ret;
4670 }
4671 
4672 static const struct file_operations tracing_fops = {
4673         .open           = tracing_open,
4674         .read           = seq_read,
4675         .write          = tracing_write_stub,
4676         .llseek         = tracing_lseek,
4677         .release        = tracing_release,
4678 };
4679 
4680 static const struct file_operations show_traces_fops = {
4681         .open           = show_traces_open,
4682         .read           = seq_read,
4683         .llseek         = seq_lseek,
4684         .release        = show_traces_release,
4685 };
4686 
4687 static ssize_t
4688 tracing_cpumask_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
4689                      size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
4690 {
4691         struct trace_array *tr = file_inode(filp)->i_private;
4692         char *mask_str;
4693         int len;
4694 
4695         len = snprintf(NULL, 0, "%*pb\n",
4696                        cpumask_pr_args(tr->tracing_cpumask)) + 1;
4697         mask_str = kmalloc(len, GFP_KERNEL);
4698         if (!mask_str)
4699                 return -ENOMEM;
4700 
4701         len = snprintf(mask_str, len, "%*pb\n",
4702                        cpumask_pr_args(tr->tracing_cpumask));
4703         if (len >= count) {
4704                 count = -EINVAL;
4705                 goto out_err;
4706         }
4707         count = simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, count, ppos, mask_str, len);
4708 
4709 out_err:
4710         kfree(mask_str);
4711 
4712         return count;
4713 }
4714 
4715 int tracing_set_cpumask(struct trace_array *tr,
4716                         cpumask_var_t tracing_cpumask_new)
4717 {
4718         int cpu;
4719 
4720         if (!tr)
4721                 return -EINVAL;
4722 
4723         local_irq_disable();
4724         arch_spin_lock(&tr->max_lock);
4725         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
4726                 /*
4727                  * Increase/decrease the disabled counter if we are
4728                  * about to flip a bit in the cpumask:
4729                  */
4730                 if (cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, tr->tracing_cpumask) &&
4731                                 !cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, tracing_cpumask_new)) {
4732                         atomic_inc(&per_cpu_ptr(tr->array_buffer.data, cpu)->disabled);
4733                         ring_buffer_record_disable_cpu(tr->array_buffer.buffer, cpu);
4734                 }
4735                 if (!cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, tr->tracing_cpumask) &&
4736                                 cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, tracing_cpumask_new)) {
4737                         atomic_dec(&per_cpu_ptr(tr->array_buffer.data, cpu)->disabled);
4738                         ring_buffer_record_enable_cpu(tr->array_buffer.buffer, cpu);
4739                 }
4740         }
4741         arch_spin_unlock(&tr->max_lock);
4742         local_irq_enable();
4743 
4744         cpumask_copy(tr->tracing_cpumask, tracing_cpumask_new);
4745 
4746         return 0;
4747 }
4748 
4749 static ssize_t
4750 tracing_cpumask_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
4751                       size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
4752 {
4753         struct trace_array *tr = file_inode(filp)->i_private;
4754         cpumask_var_t tracing_cpumask_new;
4755         int err;
4756 
4757         if (!alloc_cpumask_var(&tracing_cpumask_new, GFP_KERNEL))
4758                 return -ENOMEM;
4759 
4760         err = cpumask_parse_user(ubuf, count, tracing_cpumask_new);
4761         if (err)
4762                 goto err_free;
4763 
4764         err = tracing_set_cpumask(tr, tracing_cpumask_new);
4765         if (err)
4766                 goto err_free;
4767 
4768         free_cpumask_var(tracing_cpumask_new);
4769 
4770         return count;
4771 
4772 err_free:
4773         free_cpumask_var(tracing_cpumask_new);
4774 
4775         return err;
4776 }
4777 
4778 static const struct file_operations tracing_cpumask_fops = {
4779         .open           = tracing_open_generic_tr,
4780         .read           = tracing_cpumask_read,
4781         .write          = tracing_cpumask_write,
4782         .release        = tracing_release_generic_tr,
4783         .llseek         = generic_file_llseek,
4784 };
4785 
4786 static int tracing_trace_options_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
4787 {
4788         struct tracer_opt *trace_opts;
4789         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
4790         u32 tracer_flags;
4791         int i;
4792 
4793         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
4794         tracer_flags = tr->current_trace->flags->val;
4795         trace_opts = tr->current_trace->flags->opts;
4796 
4797         for (i = 0; trace_options[i]; i++) {
4798                 if (tr->trace_flags & (1 << i))
4799                         seq_printf(m, "%s\n", trace_options[i]);
4800                 else
4801                         seq_printf(m, "no%s\n", trace_options[i]);
4802         }
4803 
4804         for (i = 0; trace_opts[i].name; i++) {
4805                 if (tracer_flags & trace_opts[i].bit)
4806                         seq_printf(m, "%s\n", trace_opts[i].name);
4807                 else
4808                         seq_printf(m, "no%s\n", trace_opts[i].name);
4809         }
4810         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
4811 
4812         return 0;
4813 }
4814 
4815 static int __set_tracer_option(struct trace_array *tr,
4816                                struct tracer_flags *tracer_flags,
4817                                struct tracer_opt *opts, int neg)
4818 {
4819         struct tracer *trace = tracer_flags->trace;
4820         int ret;
4821 
4822         ret = trace->set_flag(tr, tracer_flags->val, opts->bit, !neg);
4823         if (ret)
4824                 return ret;
4825 
4826         if (neg)
4827                 tracer_flags->val &= ~opts->bit;
4828         else
4829                 tracer_flags->val |= opts->bit;
4830         return 0;
4831 }
4832 
4833 /* Try to assign a tracer specific option */
4834 static int set_tracer_option(struct trace_array *tr, char *cmp, int neg)
4835 {
4836         struct tracer *trace = tr->current_trace;
4837         struct tracer_flags *tracer_flags = trace->flags;
4838         struct tracer_opt *opts = NULL;
4839         int i;
4840 
4841         for (i = 0; tracer_flags->opts[i].name; i++) {
4842                 opts = &tracer_flags->opts[i];
4843 
4844                 if (strcmp(cmp, opts->name) == 0)
4845                         return __set_tracer_option(tr, trace->flags, opts, neg);
4846         }
4847 
4848         return -EINVAL;
4849 }
4850 
4851 /* Some tracers require overwrite to stay enabled */
4852 int trace_keep_overwrite(struct tracer *tracer, u32 mask, int set)
4853 {
4854         if (tracer->enabled && (mask & TRACE_ITER_OVERWRITE) && !set)
4855                 return -1;
4856 
4857         return 0;
4858 }
4859 
4860 int set_tracer_flag(struct trace_array *tr, unsigned int mask, int enabled)
4861 {
4862         if ((mask == TRACE_ITER_RECORD_TGID) ||
4863             (mask == TRACE_ITER_RECORD_CMD))
4864                 lockdep_assert_held(&event_mutex);
4865 
4866         /* do nothing if flag is already set */
4867         if (!!(tr->trace_flags & mask) == !!enabled)
4868                 return 0;
4869 
4870         /* Give the tracer a chance to approve the change */
4871         if (tr->current_trace->flag_changed)
4872                 if (tr->current_trace->flag_changed(tr, mask, !!enabled))
4873                         return -EINVAL;
4874 
4875         if (enabled)
4876                 tr->trace_flags |= mask;
4877         else
4878                 tr->trace_flags &= ~mask;
4879 
4880         if (mask == TRACE_ITER_RECORD_CMD)
4881                 trace_event_enable_cmd_record(enabled);
4882 
4883         if (mask == TRACE_ITER_RECORD_TGID) {
4884                 if (!tgid_map)
4885                         tgid_map = kvcalloc(PID_MAX_DEFAULT + 1,
4886                                            sizeof(*tgid_map),
4887                                            GFP_KERNEL);
4888                 if (!tgid_map) {
4889                         tr->trace_flags &= ~TRACE_ITER_RECORD_TGID;
4890                         return -ENOMEM;
4891                 }
4892 
4893                 trace_event_enable_tgid_record(enabled);
4894         }
4895 
4896         if (mask == TRACE_ITER_EVENT_FORK)
4897                 trace_event_follow_fork(tr, enabled);
4898 
4899         if (mask == TRACE_ITER_FUNC_FORK)
4900                 ftrace_pid_follow_fork(tr, enabled);
4901 
4902         if (mask == TRACE_ITER_OVERWRITE) {
4903                 ring_buffer_change_overwrite(tr->array_buffer.buffer, enabled);
4904 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
4905                 ring_buffer_change_overwrite(tr->max_buffer.buffer, enabled);
4906 #endif
4907         }
4908 
4909         if (mask == TRACE_ITER_PRINTK) {
4910                 trace_printk_start_stop_comm(enabled);
4911                 trace_printk_control(enabled);
4912         }
4913 
4914         return 0;
4915 }
4916 
4917 int trace_set_options(struct trace_array *tr, char *option)
4918 {
4919         char *cmp;
4920         int neg = 0;
4921         int ret;
4922         size_t orig_len = strlen(option);
4923         int len;
4924 
4925         cmp = strstrip(option);
4926 
4927         len = str_has_prefix(cmp, "no");
4928         if (len)
4929                 neg = 1;
4930 
4931         cmp += len;
4932 
4933         mutex_lock(&event_mutex);
4934         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
4935 
4936         ret = match_string(trace_options, -1, cmp);
4937         /* If no option could be set, test the specific tracer options */
4938         if (ret < 0)
4939                 ret = set_tracer_option(tr, cmp, neg);
4940         else
4941                 ret = set_tracer_flag(tr, 1 << ret, !neg);
4942 
4943         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
4944         mutex_unlock(&event_mutex);
4945 
4946         /*
4947          * If the first trailing whitespace is replaced with '\0' by strstrip,
4948          * turn it back into a space.
4949          */
4950         if (orig_len > strlen(option))
4951                 option[strlen(option)] = ' ';
4952 
4953         return ret;
4954 }
4955 
4956 static void __init apply_trace_boot_options(void)
4957 {
4958         char *buf = trace_boot_options_buf;
4959         char *option;
4960 
4961         while (true) {
4962                 option = strsep(&buf, ",");
4963 
4964                 if (!option)
4965                         break;
4966 
4967                 if (*option)
4968                         trace_set_options(&global_trace, option);
4969 
4970                 /* Put back the comma to allow this to be called again */
4971                 if (buf)
4972                         *(buf - 1) = ',';
4973         }
4974 }
4975 
4976 static ssize_t
4977 tracing_trace_options_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
4978                         size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
4979 {
4980         struct seq_file *m = filp->private_data;
4981         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
4982         char buf[64];
4983         int ret;
4984 
4985         if (cnt >= sizeof(buf))
4986                 return -EINVAL;
4987 
4988         if (copy_from_user(buf, ubuf, cnt))
4989                 return -EFAULT;
4990 
4991         buf[cnt] = 0;
4992 
4993         ret = trace_set_options(tr, buf);
4994         if (ret < 0)
4995                 return ret;
4996 
4997         *ppos += cnt;
4998 
4999         return cnt;
5000 }
5001 
5002 static int tracing_trace_options_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
5003 {
5004         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
5005         int ret;
5006 
5007         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
5008         if (ret)
5009                 return ret;
5010 
5011         ret = single_open(file, tracing_trace_options_show, inode->i_private);
5012         if (ret < 0)
5013                 trace_array_put(tr);
5014 
5015         return ret;
5016 }
5017 
5018 static const struct file_operations tracing_iter_fops = {
5019         .open           = tracing_trace_options_open,
5020         .read           = seq_read,
5021         .llseek         = seq_lseek,
5022         .release        = tracing_single_release_tr,
5023         .write          = tracing_trace_options_write,
5024 };
5025 
5026 static const char readme_msg[] =
5027         "tracing mini-HOWTO:\n\n"
5028         "# echo 0 > tracing_on : quick way to disable tracing\n"
5029         "# echo 1 > tracing_on : quick way to re-enable tracing\n\n"
5030         " Important files:\n"
5031         "  trace\t\t\t- The static contents of the buffer\n"
5032         "\t\t\t  To clear the buffer write into this file: echo > trace\n"
5033         "  trace_pipe\t\t- A consuming read to see the contents of the buffer\n"
5034         "  current_tracer\t- function and latency tracers\n"
5035         "  available_tracers\t- list of configured tracers for current_tracer\n"
5036         "  error_log\t- error log for failed commands (that support it)\n"
5037         "  buffer_size_kb\t- view and modify size of per cpu buffer\n"
5038         "  buffer_total_size_kb  - view total size of all cpu buffers\n\n"
5039         "  trace_clock\t\t-change the clock used to order events\n"
5040         "       local:   Per cpu clock but may not be synced across CPUs\n"
5041         "      global:   Synced across CPUs but slows tracing down.\n"
5042         "     counter:   Not a clock, but just an increment\n"
5043         "      uptime:   Jiffy counter from time of boot\n"
5044         "        perf:   Same clock that perf events use\n"
5045 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
5046         "     x86-tsc:   TSC cycle counter\n"
5047 #endif
5048         "\n  timestamp_mode\t-view the mode used to timestamp events\n"
5049         "       delta:   Delta difference against a buffer-wide timestamp\n"
5050         "    absolute:   Absolute (standalone) timestamp\n"
5051         "\n  trace_marker\t\t- Writes into this file writes into the kernel buffer\n"
5052         "\n  trace_marker_raw\t\t- Writes into this file writes binary data into the kernel buffer\n"
5053         "  tracing_cpumask\t- Limit which CPUs to trace\n"
5054         "  instances\t\t- Make sub-buffers with: mkdir instances/foo\n"
5055         "\t\t\t  Remove sub-buffer with rmdir\n"
5056         "  trace_options\t\t- Set format or modify how tracing happens\n"
5057         "\t\t\t  Disable an option by prefixing 'no' to the\n"
5058         "\t\t\t  option name\n"
5059         "  saved_cmdlines_size\t- echo command number in here to store comm-pid list\n"
5060 #ifdef CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE
5061         "\n  available_filter_functions - list of functions that can be filtered on\n"
5062         "  set_ftrace_filter\t- echo function name in here to only trace these\n"
5063         "\t\t\t  functions\n"
5064         "\t     accepts: func_full_name or glob-matching-pattern\n"
5065         "\t     modules: Can select a group via module\n"
5066         "\t      Format: :mod:<module-name>\n"
5067         "\t     example: echo :mod:ext3 > set_ftrace_filter\n"
5068         "\t    triggers: a command to perform when function is hit\n"
5069         "\t      Format: <function>:<trigger>[:count]\n"
5070         "\t     trigger: traceon, traceoff\n"
5071         "\t\t      enable_event:<system>:<event>\n"
5072         "\t\t      disable_event:<system>:<event>\n"
5073 #ifdef CONFIG_STACKTRACE
5074         "\t\t      stacktrace\n"
5075 #endif
5076 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
5077         "\t\t      snapshot\n"
5078 #endif
5079         "\t\t      dump\n"
5080         "\t\t      cpudump\n"
5081         "\t     example: echo do_fault:traceoff > set_ftrace_filter\n"
5082         "\t              echo do_trap:traceoff:3 > set_ftrace_filter\n"
5083         "\t     The first one will disable tracing every time do_fault is hit\n"
5084         "\t     The second will disable tracing at most 3 times when do_trap is hit\n"
5085         "\t       The first time do trap is hit and it disables tracing, the\n"
5086         "\t       counter will decrement to 2. If tracing is already disabled,\n"
5087         "\t       the counter will not decrement. It only decrements when the\n"
5088         "\t       trigger did work\n"
5089         "\t     To remove trigger without count:\n"
5090         "\t       echo '!<function>:<trigger> > set_ftrace_filter\n"
5091         "\t     To remove trigger with a count:\n"
5092         "\t       echo '!<function>:<trigger>:0 > set_ftrace_filter\n"
5093         "  set_ftrace_notrace\t- echo function name in here to never trace.\n"
5094         "\t    accepts: func_full_name, *func_end, func_begin*, *func_middle*\n"
5095         "\t    modules: Can select a group via module command :mod:\n"
5096         "\t    Does not accept triggers\n"
5097 #endif /* CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE */
5098 #ifdef CONFIG_FUNCTION_TRACER
5099         "  set_ftrace_pid\t- Write pid(s) to only function trace those pids\n"
5100         "\t\t    (function)\n"
5101         "  set_ftrace_notrace_pid\t- Write pid(s) to not function trace those pids\n"
5102         "\t\t    (function)\n"
5103 #endif
5104 #ifdef CONFIG_FUNCTION_GRAPH_TRACER
5105         "  set_graph_function\t- Trace the nested calls of a function (function_graph)\n"
5106         "  set_graph_notrace\t- Do not trace the nested calls of a function (function_graph)\n"
5107         "  max_graph_depth\t- Trace a limited depth of nested calls (0 is unlimited)\n"
5108 #endif
5109 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
5110         "\n  snapshot\t\t- Like 'trace' but shows the content of the static\n"
5111         "\t\t\t  snapshot buffer. Read the contents for more\n"
5112         "\t\t\t  information\n"
5113 #endif
5114 #ifdef CONFIG_STACK_TRACER
5115         "  stack_trace\t\t- Shows the max stack trace when active\n"
5116         "  stack_max_size\t- Shows current max stack size that was traced\n"
5117         "\t\t\t  Write into this file to reset the max size (trigger a\n"
5118         "\t\t\t  new trace)\n"
5119 #ifdef CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE
5120         "  stack_trace_filter\t- Like set_ftrace_filter but limits what stack_trace\n"
5121         "\t\t\t  traces\n"
5122 #endif
5123 #endif /* CONFIG_STACK_TRACER */
5124 #ifdef CONFIG_DYNAMIC_EVENTS
5125         "  dynamic_events\t\t- Create/append/remove/show the generic dynamic events\n"
5126         "\t\t\t  Write into this file to define/undefine new trace events.\n"
5127 #endif
5128 #ifdef CONFIG_KPROBE_EVENTS
5129         "  kprobe_events\t\t- Create/append/remove/show the kernel dynamic events\n"
5130         "\t\t\t  Write into this file to define/undefine new trace events.\n"
5131 #endif
5132 #ifdef CONFIG_UPROBE_EVENTS
5133         "  uprobe_events\t\t- Create/append/remove/show the userspace dynamic events\n"
5134         "\t\t\t  Write into this file to define/undefine new trace events.\n"
5135 #endif
5136 #if defined(CONFIG_KPROBE_EVENTS) || defined(CONFIG_UPROBE_EVENTS)
5137         "\t  accepts: event-definitions (one definition per line)\n"
5138         "\t   Format: p[:[<group>/]<event>] <place> [<args>]\n"
5139         "\t           r[maxactive][:[<group>/]<event>] <place> [<args>]\n"
5140 #ifdef CONFIG_HIST_TRIGGERS
5141         "\t           s:[synthetic/]<event> <field> [<field>]\n"
5142 #endif
5143         "\t           -:[<group>/]<event>\n"
5144 #ifdef CONFIG_KPROBE_EVENTS
5145         "\t    place: [<module>:]<symbol>[+<offset>]|<memaddr>\n"
5146   "place (kretprobe): [<module>:]<symbol>[+<offset>]%return|<memaddr>\n"
5147 #endif
5148 #ifdef CONFIG_UPROBE_EVENTS
5149   "   place (uprobe): <path>:<offset>[%return][(ref_ctr_offset)]\n"
5150 #endif
5151         "\t     args: <name>=fetcharg[:type]\n"
5152         "\t fetcharg: %<register>, @<address>, @<symbol>[+|-<offset>],\n"
5153 #ifdef CONFIG_HAVE_FUNCTION_ARG_ACCESS_API
5154         "\t           $stack<index>, $stack, $retval, $comm, $arg<N>,\n"
5155 #else
5156         "\t           $stack<index>, $stack, $retval, $comm,\n"
5157 #endif
5158         "\t           +|-[u]<offset>(<fetcharg>), \\imm-value, \\\"imm-string\"\n"
5159         "\t     type: s8/16/32/64, u8/16/32/64, x8/16/32/64, string, symbol,\n"
5160         "\t           b<bit-width>@<bit-offset>/<container-size>, ustring,\n"
5161         "\t           <type>\\[<array-size>\\]\n"
5162 #ifdef CONFIG_HIST_TRIGGERS
5163         "\t    field: <stype> <name>;\n"
5164         "\t    stype: u8/u16/u32/u64, s8/s16/s32/s64, pid_t,\n"
5165         "\t           [unsigned] char/int/long\n"
5166 #endif
5167 #endif
5168         "  events/\t\t- Directory containing all trace event subsystems:\n"
5169         "      enable\t\t- Write 0/1 to enable/disable tracing of all events\n"
5170         "  events/<system>/\t- Directory containing all trace events for <system>:\n"
5171         "      enable\t\t- Write 0/1 to enable/disable tracing of all <system>\n"
5172         "\t\t\t  events\n"
5173         "      filter\t\t- If set, only events passing filter are traced\n"
5174         "  events/<system>/<event>/\t- Directory containing control files for\n"
5175         "\t\t\t  <event>:\n"
5176         "      enable\t\t- Write 0/1 to enable/disable tracing of <event>\n"
5177         "      filter\t\t- If set, only events passing filter are traced\n"
5178         "      trigger\t\t- If set, a command to perform when event is hit\n"
5179         "\t    Format: <trigger>[:count][if <filter>]\n"
5180         "\t   trigger: traceon, traceoff\n"
5181         "\t            enable_event:<system>:<event>\n"
5182         "\t            disable_event:<system>:<event>\n"
5183 #ifdef CONFIG_HIST_TRIGGERS
5184         "\t            enable_hist:<system>:<event>\n"
5185         "\t            disable_hist:<system>:<event>\n"
5186 #endif
5187 #ifdef CONFIG_STACKTRACE
5188         "\t\t    stacktrace\n"
5189 #endif
5190 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
5191         "\t\t    snapshot\n"
5192 #endif
5193 #ifdef CONFIG_HIST_TRIGGERS
5194         "\t\t    hist (see below)\n"
5195 #endif
5196         "\t   example: echo traceoff > events/block/block_unplug/trigger\n"
5197         "\t            echo traceoff:3 > events/block/block_unplug/trigger\n"
5198         "\t            echo 'enable_event:kmem:kmalloc:3 if nr_rq > 1' > \\\n"
5199         "\t                  events/block/block_unplug/trigger\n"
5200         "\t   The first disables tracing every time block_unplug is hit.\n"
5201         "\t   The second disables tracing the first 3 times block_unplug is hit.\n"
5202         "\t   The third enables the kmalloc event the first 3 times block_unplug\n"
5203         "\t     is hit and has value of greater than 1 for the 'nr_rq' event field.\n"
5204         "\t   Like function triggers, the counter is only decremented if it\n"
5205         "\t    enabled or disabled tracing.\n"
5206         "\t   To remove a trigger without a count:\n"
5207         "\t     echo '!<trigger> > <system>/<event>/trigger\n"
5208         "\t   To remove a trigger with a count:\n"
5209         "\t     echo '!<trigger>:0 > <system>/<event>/trigger\n"
5210         "\t   Filters can be ignored when removing a trigger.\n"
5211 #ifdef CONFIG_HIST_TRIGGERS
5212         "      hist trigger\t- If set, event hits are aggregated into a hash table\n"
5213         "\t    Format: hist:keys=<field1[,field2,...]>\n"
5214         "\t            [:values=<field1[,field2,...]>]\n"
5215         "\t            [:sort=<field1[,field2,...]>]\n"
5216         "\t            [:size=#entries]\n"
5217         "\t            [:pause][:continue][:clear]\n"
5218         "\t            [:name=histname1]\n"
5219         "\t            [:<handler>.<action>]\n"
5220         "\t            [if <filter>]\n\n"
5221         "\t    When a matching event is hit, an entry is added to a hash\n"
5222         "\t    table using the key(s) and value(s) named, and the value of a\n"
5223         "\t    sum called 'hitcount' is incremented.  Keys and values\n"
5224         "\t    correspond to fields in the event's format description.  Keys\n"
5225         "\t    can be any field, or the special string 'stacktrace'.\n"
5226         "\t    Compound keys consisting of up to two fields can be specified\n"
5227         "\t    by the 'keys' keyword.  Values must correspond to numeric\n"
5228         "\t    fields.  Sort keys consisting of up to two fields can be\n"
5229         "\t    specified using the 'sort' keyword.  The sort direction can\n"
5230         "\t    be modified by appending '.descending' or '.ascending' to a\n"
5231         "\t    sort field.  The 'size' parameter can be used to specify more\n"
5232         "\t    or fewer than the default 2048 entries for the hashtable size.\n"
5233         "\t    If a hist trigger is given a name using the 'name' parameter,\n"
5234         "\t    its histogram data will be shared with other triggers of the\n"
5235         "\t    same name, and trigger hits will update this common data.\n\n"
5236         "\t    Reading the 'hist' file for the event will dump the hash\n"
5237         "\t    table in its entirety to stdout.  If there are multiple hist\n"
5238         "\t    triggers attached to an event, there will be a table for each\n"
5239         "\t    trigger in the output.  The table displayed for a named\n"
5240         "\t    trigger will be the same as any other instance having the\n"
5241         "\t    same name.  The default format used to display a given field\n"
5242         "\t    can be modified by appending any of the following modifiers\n"
5243         "\t    to the field name, as applicable:\n\n"
5244         "\t            .hex        display a number as a hex value\n"
5245         "\t            .sym        display an address as a symbol\n"
5246         "\t            .sym-offset display an address as a symbol and offset\n"
5247         "\t            .execname   display a common_pid as a program name\n"
5248         "\t            .syscall    display a syscall id as a syscall name\n"
5249         "\t            .log2       display log2 value rather than raw number\n"
5250         "\t            .usecs      display a common_timestamp in microseconds\n\n"
5251         "\t    The 'pause' parameter can be used to pause an existing hist\n"
5252         "\t    trigger or to start a hist trigger but not log any events\n"
5253         "\t    until told to do so.  'continue' can be used to start or\n"
5254         "\t    restart a paused hist trigger.\n\n"
5255         "\t    The 'clear' parameter will clear the contents of a running\n"
5256         "\t    hist trigger and leave its current paused/active state\n"
5257         "\t    unchanged.\n\n"
5258         "\t    The enable_hist and disable_hist triggers can be used to\n"
5259         "\t    have one event conditionally start and stop another event's\n"
5260         "\t    already-attached hist trigger.  The syntax is analogous to\n"
5261         "\t    the enable_event and disable_event triggers.\n\n"
5262         "\t    Hist trigger handlers and actions are executed whenever a\n"
5263         "\t    a histogram entry is added or updated.  They take the form:\n\n"
5264         "\t        <handler>.<action>\n\n"
5265         "\t    The available handlers are:\n\n"
5266         "\t        onmatch(matching.event)  - invoke on addition or update\n"
5267         "\t        onmax(var)               - invoke if var exceeds current max\n"
5268         "\t        onchange(var)            - invoke action if var changes\n\n"
5269         "\t    The available actions are:\n\n"
5270         "\t        trace(<synthetic_event>,param list)  - generate synthetic event\n"
5271         "\t        save(field,...)                      - save current event fields\n"
5272 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
5273         "\t        snapshot()                           - snapshot the trace buffer\n\n"
5274 #endif
5275 #ifdef CONFIG_SYNTH_EVENTS
5276         "  events/synthetic_events\t- Create/append/remove/show synthetic events\n"
5277         "\t  Write into this file to define/undefine new synthetic events.\n"
5278         "\t     example: echo 'myevent u64 lat; char name[]' >> synthetic_events\n"
5279 #endif
5280 #endif
5281 ;
5282 
5283 static ssize_t
5284 tracing_readme_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
5285                        size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
5286 {
5287         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos,
5288                                         readme_msg, strlen(readme_msg));
5289 }
5290 
5291 static const struct file_operations tracing_readme_fops = {
5292         .open           = tracing_open_generic,
5293         .read           = tracing_readme_read,
5294         .llseek         = generic_file_llseek,
5295 };
5296 
5297 static void *saved_tgids_next(struct seq_file *m, void *v, loff_t *pos)
5298 {
5299         int *ptr = v;
5300 
5301         if (*pos || m->count)
5302                 ptr++;
5303 
5304         (*pos)++;
5305 
5306         for (; ptr <= &tgid_map[PID_MAX_DEFAULT]; ptr++) {
5307                 if (trace_find_tgid(*ptr))
5308                         return ptr;
5309         }
5310 
5311         return NULL;
5312 }
5313 
5314 static void *saved_tgids_start(struct seq_file *m, loff_t *pos)
5315 {
5316         void *v;
5317         loff_t l = 0;
5318 
5319         if (!tgid_map)
5320                 return NULL;
5321 
5322         v = &tgid_map[0];
5323         while (l <= *pos) {
5324                 v = saved_tgids_next(m, v, &l);
5325                 if (!v)
5326                         return NULL;
5327         }
5328 
5329         return v;
5330 }
5331 
5332 static void saved_tgids_stop(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
5333 {
5334 }
5335 
5336 static int saved_tgids_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
5337 {
5338         int pid = (int *)v - tgid_map;
5339 
5340         seq_printf(m, "%d %d\n", pid, trace_find_tgid(pid));
5341         return 0;
5342 }
5343 
5344 static const struct seq_operations tracing_saved_tgids_seq_ops = {
5345         .start          = saved_tgids_start,
5346         .stop           = saved_tgids_stop,
5347         .next           = saved_tgids_next,
5348         .show           = saved_tgids_show,
5349 };
5350 
5351 static int tracing_saved_tgids_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
5352 {
5353         int ret;
5354 
5355         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(NULL);
5356         if (ret)
5357                 return ret;
5358 
5359         return seq_open(filp, &tracing_saved_tgids_seq_ops);
5360 }
5361 
5362 
5363 static const struct file_operations tracing_saved_tgids_fops = {
5364         .open           = tracing_saved_tgids_open,
5365         .read           = seq_read,
5366         .llseek         = seq_lseek,
5367         .release        = seq_release,
5368 };
5369 
5370 static void *saved_cmdlines_next(struct seq_file *m, void *v, loff_t *pos)
5371 {
5372         unsigned int *ptr = v;
5373 
5374         if (*pos || m->count)
5375                 ptr++;
5376 
5377         (*pos)++;
5378 
5379         for (; ptr < &savedcmd->map_cmdline_to_pid[savedcmd->cmdline_num];
5380              ptr++) {
5381                 if (*ptr == -1 || *ptr == NO_CMDLINE_MAP)
5382                         continue;
5383 
5384                 return ptr;
5385         }
5386 
5387         return NULL;
5388 }
5389 
5390 static void *saved_cmdlines_start(struct seq_file *m, loff_t *pos)
5391 {
5392         void *v;
5393         loff_t l = 0;
5394 
5395         preempt_disable();
5396         arch_spin_lock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
5397 
5398         v = &savedcmd->map_cmdline_to_pid[0];
5399         while (l <= *pos) {
5400                 v = saved_cmdlines_next(m, v, &l);
5401                 if (!v)
5402                         return NULL;
5403         }
5404 
5405         return v;
5406 }
5407 
5408 static void saved_cmdlines_stop(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
5409 {
5410         arch_spin_unlock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
5411         preempt_enable();
5412 }
5413 
5414 static int saved_cmdlines_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
5415 {
5416         char buf[TASK_COMM_LEN];
5417         unsigned int *pid = v;
5418 
5419         __trace_find_cmdline(*pid, buf);
5420         seq_printf(m, "%d %s\n", *pid, buf);
5421         return 0;
5422 }
5423 
5424 static const struct seq_operations tracing_saved_cmdlines_seq_ops = {
5425         .start          = saved_cmdlines_start,
5426         .next           = saved_cmdlines_next,
5427         .stop           = saved_cmdlines_stop,
5428         .show           = saved_cmdlines_show,
5429 };
5430 
5431 static int tracing_saved_cmdlines_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
5432 {
5433         int ret;
5434 
5435         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(NULL);
5436         if (ret)
5437                 return ret;
5438 
5439         return seq_open(filp, &tracing_saved_cmdlines_seq_ops);
5440 }
5441 
5442 static const struct file_operations tracing_saved_cmdlines_fops = {
5443         .open           = tracing_saved_cmdlines_open,
5444         .read           = seq_read,
5445         .llseek         = seq_lseek,
5446         .release        = seq_release,
5447 };
5448 
5449 static ssize_t
5450 tracing_saved_cmdlines_size_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
5451                                  size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
5452 {
5453         char buf[64];
5454         int r;
5455 
5456         arch_spin_lock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
5457         r = scnprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%u\n", savedcmd->cmdline_num);
5458         arch_spin_unlock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
5459 
5460         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
5461 }
5462 
5463 static void free_saved_cmdlines_buffer(struct saved_cmdlines_buffer *s)
5464 {
5465         kfree(s->saved_cmdlines);
5466         kfree(s->map_cmdline_to_pid);
5467         kfree(s);
5468 }
5469 
5470 static int tracing_resize_saved_cmdlines(unsigned int val)
5471 {
5472         struct saved_cmdlines_buffer *s, *savedcmd_temp;
5473 
5474         s = kmalloc(sizeof(*s), GFP_KERNEL);
5475         if (!s)
5476                 return -ENOMEM;
5477 
5478         if (allocate_cmdlines_buffer(val, s) < 0) {
5479                 kfree(s);
5480                 return -ENOMEM;
5481         }
5482 
5483         arch_spin_lock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
5484         savedcmd_temp = savedcmd;
5485         savedcmd = s;
5486         arch_spin_unlock(&trace_cmdline_lock);
5487         free_saved_cmdlines_buffer(savedcmd_temp);
5488 
5489         return 0;
5490 }
5491 
5492 static ssize_t
5493 tracing_saved_cmdlines_size_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
5494                                   size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
5495 {
5496         unsigned long val;
5497         int ret;
5498 
5499         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
5500         if (ret)
5501                 return ret;
5502 
5503         /* must have at least 1 entry or less than PID_MAX_DEFAULT */
5504         if (!val || val > PID_MAX_DEFAULT)
5505                 return -EINVAL;
5506 
5507         ret = tracing_resize_saved_cmdlines((unsigned int)val);
5508         if (ret < 0)
5509                 return ret;
5510 
5511         *ppos += cnt;
5512 
5513         return cnt;
5514 }
5515 
5516 static const struct file_operations tracing_saved_cmdlines_size_fops = {
5517         .open           = tracing_open_generic,
5518         .read           = tracing_saved_cmdlines_size_read,
5519         .write          = tracing_saved_cmdlines_size_write,
5520 };
5521 
5522 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACE_EVAL_MAP_FILE
5523 static union trace_eval_map_item *
5524 update_eval_map(union trace_eval_map_item *ptr)
5525 {
5526         if (!ptr->map.eval_string) {
5527                 if (ptr->tail.next) {
5528                         ptr = ptr->tail.next;
5529                         /* Set ptr to the next real item (skip head) */
5530                         ptr++;
5531                 } else
5532                         return NULL;
5533         }
5534         return ptr;
5535 }
5536 
5537 static void *eval_map_next(struct seq_file *m, void *v, loff_t *pos)
5538 {
5539         union trace_eval_map_item *ptr = v;
5540 
5541         /*
5542          * Paranoid! If ptr points to end, we don't want to increment past it.
5543          * This really should never happen.
5544          */
5545         (*pos)++;
5546         ptr = update_eval_map(ptr);
5547         if (WARN_ON_ONCE(!ptr))
5548                 return NULL;
5549 
5550         ptr++;
5551         ptr = update_eval_map(ptr);
5552 
5553         return ptr;
5554 }
5555 
5556 static void *eval_map_start(struct seq_file *m, loff_t *pos)
5557 {
5558         union trace_eval_map_item *v;
5559         loff_t l = 0;
5560 
5561         mutex_lock(&trace_eval_mutex);
5562 
5563         v = trace_eval_maps;
5564         if (v)
5565                 v++;
5566 
5567         while (v && l < *pos) {
5568                 v = eval_map_next(m, v, &l);
5569         }
5570 
5571         return v;
5572 }
5573 
5574 static void eval_map_stop(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
5575 {
5576         mutex_unlock(&trace_eval_mutex);
5577 }
5578 
5579 static int eval_map_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
5580 {
5581         union trace_eval_map_item *ptr = v;
5582 
5583         seq_printf(m, "%s %ld (%s)\n",
5584                    ptr->map.eval_string, ptr->map.eval_value,
5585                    ptr->map.system);
5586 
5587         return 0;
5588 }
5589 
5590 static const struct seq_operations tracing_eval_map_seq_ops = {
5591         .start          = eval_map_start,
5592         .next           = eval_map_next,
5593         .stop           = eval_map_stop,
5594         .show           = eval_map_show,
5595 };
5596 
5597 static int tracing_eval_map_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
5598 {
5599         int ret;
5600 
5601         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(NULL);
5602         if (ret)
5603                 return ret;
5604 
5605         return seq_open(filp, &tracing_eval_map_seq_ops);
5606 }
5607 
5608 static const struct file_operations tracing_eval_map_fops = {
5609         .open           = tracing_eval_map_open,
5610         .read           = seq_read,
5611         .llseek         = seq_lseek,
5612         .release        = seq_release,
5613 };
5614 
5615 static inline union trace_eval_map_item *
5616 trace_eval_jmp_to_tail(union trace_eval_map_item *ptr)
5617 {
5618         /* Return tail of array given the head */
5619         return ptr + ptr->head.length + 1;
5620 }
5621 
5622 static void
5623 trace_insert_eval_map_file(struct module *mod, struct trace_eval_map **start,
5624                            int len)
5625 {
5626         struct trace_eval_map **stop;
5627         struct trace_eval_map **map;
5628         union trace_eval_map_item *map_array;
5629         union trace_eval_map_item *ptr;
5630 
5631         stop = start + len;
5632 
5633         /*
5634          * The trace_eval_maps contains the map plus a head and tail item,
5635          * where the head holds the module and length of array, and the
5636          * tail holds a pointer to the next list.
5637          */
5638         map_array = kmalloc_array(len + 2, sizeof(*map_array), GFP_KERNEL);
5639         if (!map_array) {
5640                 pr_warn("Unable to allocate trace eval mapping\n");
5641                 return;
5642         }
5643 
5644         mutex_lock(&trace_eval_mutex);
5645 
5646         if (!trace_eval_maps)
5647                 trace_eval_maps = map_array;
5648         else {
5649                 ptr = trace_eval_maps;
5650                 for (;;) {
5651                         ptr = trace_eval_jmp_to_tail(ptr);
5652                         if (!ptr->tail.next)
5653                                 break;
5654                         ptr = ptr->tail.next;
5655 
5656                 }
5657                 ptr->tail.next = map_array;
5658         }
5659         map_array->head.mod = mod;
5660         map_array->head.length = len;
5661         map_array++;
5662 
5663         for (map = start; (unsigned long)map < (unsigned long)stop; map++) {
5664                 map_array->map = **map;
5665                 map_array++;
5666         }
5667         memset(map_array, 0, sizeof(*map_array));
5668 
5669         mutex_unlock(&trace_eval_mutex);
5670 }
5671 
5672 static void trace_create_eval_file(struct dentry *d_tracer)
5673 {
5674         trace_create_file("eval_map", 0444, d_tracer,
5675                           NULL, &tracing_eval_map_fops);
5676 }
5677 
5678 #else /* CONFIG_TRACE_EVAL_MAP_FILE */
5679 static inline void trace_create_eval_file(struct dentry *d_tracer) { }
5680 static inline void trace_insert_eval_map_file(struct module *mod,
5681                               struct trace_eval_map **start, int len) { }
5682 #endif /* !CONFIG_TRACE_EVAL_MAP_FILE */
5683 
5684 static void trace_insert_eval_map(struct module *mod,
5685                                   struct trace_eval_map **start, int len)
5686 {
5687         struct trace_eval_map **map;
5688 
5689         if (len <= 0)
5690                 return;
5691 
5692         map = start;
5693 
5694         trace_event_eval_update(map, len);
5695 
5696         trace_insert_eval_map_file(mod, start, len);
5697 }
5698 
5699 static ssize_t
5700 tracing_set_trace_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
5701                        size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
5702 {
5703         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
5704         char buf[MAX_TRACER_SIZE+2];
5705         int r;
5706 
5707         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
5708         r = sprintf(buf, "%s\n", tr->current_trace->name);
5709         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
5710 
5711         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
5712 }
5713 
5714 int tracer_init(struct tracer *t, struct trace_array *tr)
5715 {
5716         tracing_reset_online_cpus(&tr->array_buffer);
5717         return t->init(tr);
5718 }
5719 
5720 static void set_buffer_entries(struct array_buffer *buf, unsigned long val)
5721 {
5722         int cpu;
5723 
5724         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu)
5725                 per_cpu_ptr(buf->data, cpu)->entries = val;
5726 }
5727 
5728 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
5729 /* resize @tr's buffer to the size of @size_tr's entries */
5730 static int resize_buffer_duplicate_size(struct array_buffer *trace_buf,
5731                                         struct array_buffer *size_buf, int cpu_id)
5732 {
5733         int cpu, ret = 0;
5734 
5735         if (cpu_id == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
5736                 for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
5737                         ret = ring_buffer_resize(trace_buf->buffer,
5738                                  per_cpu_ptr(size_buf->data, cpu)->entries, cpu);
5739                         if (ret < 0)
5740                                 break;
5741                         per_cpu_ptr(trace_buf->data, cpu)->entries =
5742                                 per_cpu_ptr(size_buf->data, cpu)->entries;
5743                 }
5744         } else {
5745                 ret = ring_buffer_resize(trace_buf->buffer,
5746                                  per_cpu_ptr(size_buf->data, cpu_id)->entries, cpu_id);
5747                 if (ret == 0)
5748                         per_cpu_ptr(trace_buf->data, cpu_id)->entries =
5749                                 per_cpu_ptr(size_buf->data, cpu_id)->entries;
5750         }
5751 
5752         return ret;
5753 }
5754 #endif /* CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE */
5755 
5756 static int __tracing_resize_ring_buffer(struct trace_array *tr,
5757                                         unsigned long size, int cpu)
5758 {
5759         int ret;
5760 
5761         /*
5762          * If kernel or user changes the size of the ring buffer
5763          * we use the size that was given, and we can forget about
5764          * expanding it later.
5765          */
5766         ring_buffer_expanded = true;
5767 
5768         /* May be called before buffers are initialized */
5769         if (!tr->array_buffer.buffer)
5770                 return 0;
5771 
5772         ret = ring_buffer_resize(tr->array_buffer.buffer, size, cpu);
5773         if (ret < 0)
5774                 return ret;
5775 
5776 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
5777         if (!(tr->flags & TRACE_ARRAY_FL_GLOBAL) ||
5778             !tr->current_trace->use_max_tr)
5779                 goto out;
5780 
5781         ret = ring_buffer_resize(tr->max_buffer.buffer, size, cpu);
5782         if (ret < 0) {
5783                 int r = resize_buffer_duplicate_size(&tr->array_buffer,
5784                                                      &tr->array_buffer, cpu);
5785                 if (r < 0) {
5786                         /*
5787                          * AARGH! We are left with different
5788                          * size max buffer!!!!
5789                          * The max buffer is our "snapshot" buffer.
5790                          * When a tracer needs a snapshot (one of the
5791                          * latency tracers), it swaps the max buffer
5792                          * with the saved snap shot. We succeeded to
5793                          * update the size of the main buffer, but failed to
5794                          * update the size of the max buffer. But when we tried
5795                          * to reset the main buffer to the original size, we
5796                          * failed there too. This is very unlikely to
5797                          * happen, but if it does, warn and kill all
5798                          * tracing.
5799                          */
5800                         WARN_ON(1);
5801                         tracing_disabled = 1;
5802                 }
5803                 return ret;
5804         }
5805 
5806         if (cpu == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS)
5807                 set_buffer_entries(&tr->max_buffer, size);
5808         else
5809                 per_cpu_ptr(tr->max_buffer.data, cpu)->entries = size;
5810 
5811  out:
5812 #endif /* CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE */
5813 
5814         if (cpu == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS)
5815                 set_buffer_entries(&tr->array_buffer, size);
5816         else
5817                 per_cpu_ptr(tr->array_buffer.data, cpu)->entries = size;
5818 
5819         return ret;
5820 }
5821 
5822 ssize_t tracing_resize_ring_buffer(struct trace_array *tr,
5823                                   unsigned long size, int cpu_id)
5824 {
5825         int ret = size;
5826 
5827         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
5828 
5829         if (cpu_id != RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
5830                 /* make sure, this cpu is enabled in the mask */
5831                 if (!cpumask_test_cpu(cpu_id, tracing_buffer_mask)) {
5832                         ret = -EINVAL;
5833                         goto out;
5834                 }
5835         }
5836 
5837         ret = __tracing_resize_ring_buffer(tr, size, cpu_id);
5838         if (ret < 0)
5839                 ret = -ENOMEM;
5840 
5841 out:
5842         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
5843 
5844         return ret;
5845 }
5846 
5847 
5848 /**
5849  * tracing_update_buffers - used by tracing facility to expand ring buffers
5850  *
5851  * To save on memory when the tracing is never used on a system with it
5852  * configured in. The ring buffers are set to a minimum size. But once
5853  * a user starts to use the tracing facility, then they need to grow
5854  * to their default size.
5855  *
5856  * This function is to be called when a tracer is about to be used.
5857  */
5858 int tracing_update_buffers(void)
5859 {
5860         int ret = 0;
5861 
5862         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
5863         if (!ring_buffer_expanded)
5864                 ret = __tracing_resize_ring_buffer(&global_trace, trace_buf_size,
5865                                                 RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS);
5866         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
5867 
5868         return ret;
5869 }
5870 
5871 struct trace_option_dentry;
5872 
5873 static void
5874 create_trace_option_files(struct trace_array *tr, struct tracer *tracer);
5875 
5876 /*
5877  * Used to clear out the tracer before deletion of an instance.
5878  * Must have trace_types_lock held.
5879  */
5880 static void tracing_set_nop(struct trace_array *tr)
5881 {
5882         if (tr->current_trace == &nop_trace)
5883                 return;
5884         
5885         tr->current_trace->enabled--;
5886 
5887         if (tr->current_trace->reset)
5888                 tr->current_trace->reset(tr);
5889 
5890         tr->current_trace = &nop_trace;
5891 }
5892 
5893 static void add_tracer_options(struct trace_array *tr, struct tracer *t)
5894 {
5895         /* Only enable if the directory has been created already. */
5896         if (!tr->dir)
5897                 return;
5898 
5899         create_trace_option_files(tr, t);
5900 }
5901 
5902 int tracing_set_tracer(struct trace_array *tr, const char *buf)
5903 {
5904         struct tracer *t;
5905 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
5906         bool had_max_tr;
5907 #endif
5908         int ret = 0;
5909 
5910         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
5911 
5912         if (!ring_buffer_expanded) {
5913                 ret = __tracing_resize_ring_buffer(tr, trace_buf_size,
5914                                                 RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS);
5915                 if (ret < 0)
5916                         goto out;
5917                 ret = 0;
5918         }
5919 
5920         for (t = trace_types; t; t = t->next) {
5921                 if (strcmp(t->name, buf) == 0)
5922                         break;
5923         }
5924         if (!t) {
5925                 ret = -EINVAL;
5926                 goto out;
5927         }
5928         if (t == tr->current_trace)
5929                 goto out;
5930 
5931 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
5932         if (t->use_max_tr) {
5933                 arch_spin_lock(&tr->max_lock);
5934                 if (tr->cond_snapshot)
5935                         ret = -EBUSY;
5936                 arch_spin_unlock(&tr->max_lock);
5937                 if (ret)
5938                         goto out;
5939         }
5940 #endif
5941         /* Some tracers won't work on kernel command line */
5942         if (system_state < SYSTEM_RUNNING && t->noboot) {
5943                 pr_warn("Tracer '%s' is not allowed on command line, ignored\n",
5944                         t->name);
5945                 goto out;
5946         }
5947 
5948         /* Some tracers are only allowed for the top level buffer */
5949         if (!trace_ok_for_array(t, tr)) {
5950                 ret = -EINVAL;
5951                 goto out;
5952         }
5953 
5954         /* If trace pipe files are being read, we can't change the tracer */
5955         if (tr->trace_ref) {
5956                 ret = -EBUSY;
5957                 goto out;
5958         }
5959 
5960         trace_branch_disable();
5961 
5962         tr->current_trace->enabled--;
5963 
5964         if (tr->current_trace->reset)
5965                 tr->current_trace->reset(tr);
5966 
5967         /* Current trace needs to be nop_trace before synchronize_rcu */
5968         tr->current_trace = &nop_trace;
5969 
5970 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
5971         had_max_tr = tr->allocated_snapshot;
5972 
5973         if (had_max_tr && !t->use_max_tr) {
5974                 /*
5975                  * We need to make sure that the update_max_tr sees that
5976                  * current_trace changed to nop_trace to keep it from
5977                  * swapping the buffers after we resize it.
5978                  * The update_max_tr is called from interrupts disabled
5979                  * so a synchronized_sched() is sufficient.
5980                  */
5981                 synchronize_rcu();
5982                 free_snapshot(tr);
5983         }
5984 #endif
5985 
5986 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
5987         if (t->use_max_tr && !had_max_tr) {
5988                 ret = tracing_alloc_snapshot_instance(tr);
5989                 if (ret < 0)
5990                         goto out;
5991         }
5992 #endif
5993 
5994         if (t->init) {
5995                 ret = tracer_init(t, tr);
5996                 if (ret)
5997                         goto out;
5998         }
5999 
6000         tr->current_trace = t;
6001         tr->current_trace->enabled++;
6002         trace_branch_enable(tr);
6003  out:
6004         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6005 
6006         return ret;
6007 }
6008 
6009 static ssize_t
6010 tracing_set_trace_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6011                         size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6012 {
6013         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
6014         char buf[MAX_TRACER_SIZE+1];
6015         int i;
6016         size_t ret;
6017         int err;
6018 
6019         ret = cnt;
6020 
6021         if (cnt > MAX_TRACER_SIZE)
6022                 cnt = MAX_TRACER_SIZE;
6023 
6024         if (copy_from_user(buf, ubuf, cnt))
6025                 return -EFAULT;
6026 
6027         buf[cnt] = 0;
6028 
6029         /* strip ending whitespace. */
6030         for (i = cnt - 1; i > 0 && isspace(buf[i]); i--)
6031                 buf[i] = 0;
6032 
6033         err = tracing_set_tracer(tr, buf);
6034         if (err)
6035                 return err;
6036 
6037         *ppos += ret;
6038 
6039         return ret;
6040 }
6041 
6042 static ssize_t
6043 tracing_nsecs_read(unsigned long *ptr, char __user *ubuf,
6044                    size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6045 {
6046         char buf[64];
6047         int r;
6048 
6049         r = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%ld\n",
6050                      *ptr == (unsigned long)-1 ? -1 : nsecs_to_usecs(*ptr));
6051         if (r > sizeof(buf))
6052                 r = sizeof(buf);
6053         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
6054 }
6055 
6056 static ssize_t
6057 tracing_nsecs_write(unsigned long *ptr, const char __user *ubuf,
6058                     size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6059 {
6060         unsigned long val;
6061         int ret;
6062 
6063         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
6064         if (ret)
6065                 return ret;
6066 
6067         *ptr = val * 1000;
6068 
6069         return cnt;
6070 }
6071 
6072 static ssize_t
6073 tracing_thresh_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
6074                     size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6075 {
6076         return tracing_nsecs_read(&tracing_thresh, ubuf, cnt, ppos);
6077 }
6078 
6079 static ssize_t
6080 tracing_thresh_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6081                      size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6082 {
6083         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
6084         int ret;
6085 
6086         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6087         ret = tracing_nsecs_write(&tracing_thresh, ubuf, cnt, ppos);
6088         if (ret < 0)
6089                 goto out;
6090 
6091         if (tr->current_trace->update_thresh) {
6092                 ret = tr->current_trace->update_thresh(tr);
6093                 if (ret < 0)
6094                         goto out;
6095         }
6096 
6097         ret = cnt;
6098 out:
6099         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6100 
6101         return ret;
6102 }
6103 
6104 #if defined(CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE) || defined(CONFIG_HWLAT_TRACER)
6105 
6106 static ssize_t
6107 tracing_max_lat_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
6108                      size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6109 {
6110         return tracing_nsecs_read(filp->private_data, ubuf, cnt, ppos);
6111 }
6112 
6113 static ssize_t
6114 tracing_max_lat_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6115                       size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6116 {
6117         return tracing_nsecs_write(filp->private_data, ubuf, cnt, ppos);
6118 }
6119 
6120 #endif
6121 
6122 static int tracing_open_pipe(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
6123 {
6124         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6125         struct trace_iterator *iter;
6126         int ret;
6127 
6128         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
6129         if (ret)
6130                 return ret;
6131 
6132         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6133 
6134         /* create a buffer to store the information to pass to userspace */
6135         iter = kzalloc(sizeof(*iter), GFP_KERNEL);
6136         if (!iter) {
6137                 ret = -ENOMEM;
6138                 __trace_array_put(tr);
6139                 goto out;
6140         }
6141 
6142         trace_seq_init(&iter->seq);
6143         iter->trace = tr->current_trace;
6144 
6145         if (!alloc_cpumask_var(&iter->started, GFP_KERNEL)) {
6146                 ret = -ENOMEM;
6147                 goto fail;
6148         }
6149 
6150         /* trace pipe does not show start of buffer */
6151         cpumask_setall(iter->started);
6152 
6153         if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_LATENCY_FMT)
6154                 iter->iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_LAT_FMT;
6155 
6156         /* Output in nanoseconds only if we are using a clock in nanoseconds. */
6157         if (trace_clocks[tr->clock_id].in_ns)
6158                 iter->iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_TIME_IN_NS;
6159 
6160         iter->tr = tr;
6161         iter->array_buffer = &tr->array_buffer;
6162         iter->cpu_file = tracing_get_cpu(inode);
6163         mutex_init(&iter->mutex);
6164         filp->private_data = iter;
6165 
6166         if (iter->trace->pipe_open)
6167                 iter->trace->pipe_open(iter);
6168 
6169         nonseekable_open(inode, filp);
6170 
6171         tr->trace_ref++;
6172 out:
6173         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6174         return ret;
6175 
6176 fail:
6177         kfree(iter);
6178         __trace_array_put(tr);
6179         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6180         return ret;
6181 }
6182 
6183 static int tracing_release_pipe(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
6184 {
6185         struct trace_iterator *iter = file->private_data;
6186         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6187 
6188         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6189 
6190         tr->trace_ref--;
6191 
6192         if (iter->trace->pipe_close)
6193                 iter->trace->pipe_close(iter);
6194 
6195         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6196 
6197         free_cpumask_var(iter->started);
6198         mutex_destroy(&iter->mutex);
6199         kfree(iter);
6200 
6201         trace_array_put(tr);
6202 
6203         return 0;
6204 }
6205 
6206 static __poll_t
6207 trace_poll(struct trace_iterator *iter, struct file *filp, poll_table *poll_table)
6208 {
6209         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
6210 
6211         /* Iterators are static, they should be filled or empty */
6212         if (trace_buffer_iter(iter, iter->cpu_file))
6213                 return EPOLLIN | EPOLLRDNORM;
6214 
6215         if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_BLOCK)
6216                 /*
6217                  * Always select as readable when in blocking mode
6218                  */
6219                 return EPOLLIN | EPOLLRDNORM;
6220         else
6221                 return ring_buffer_poll_wait(iter->array_buffer->buffer, iter->cpu_file,
6222                                              filp, poll_table);
6223 }
6224 
6225 static __poll_t
6226 tracing_poll_pipe(struct file *filp, poll_table *poll_table)
6227 {
6228         struct trace_iterator *iter = filp->private_data;
6229 
6230         return trace_poll(iter, filp, poll_table);
6231 }
6232 
6233 /* Must be called with iter->mutex held. */
6234 static int tracing_wait_pipe(struct file *filp)
6235 {
6236         struct trace_iterator *iter = filp->private_data;
6237         int ret;
6238 
6239         while (trace_empty(iter)) {
6240 
6241                 if ((filp->f_flags & O_NONBLOCK)) {
6242                         return -EAGAIN;
6243                 }
6244 
6245                 /*
6246                  * We block until we read something and tracing is disabled.
6247                  * We still block if tracing is disabled, but we have never
6248                  * read anything. This allows a user to cat this file, and
6249                  * then enable tracing. But after we have read something,
6250                  * we give an EOF when tracing is again disabled.
6251                  *
6252                  * iter->pos will be 0 if we haven't read anything.
6253                  */
6254                 if (!tracer_tracing_is_on(iter->tr) && iter->pos)
6255                         break;
6256 
6257                 mutex_unlock(&iter->mutex);
6258 
6259                 ret = wait_on_pipe(iter, 0);
6260 
6261                 mutex_lock(&iter->mutex);
6262 
6263                 if (ret)
6264                         return ret;
6265         }
6266 
6267         return 1;
6268 }
6269 
6270 /*
6271  * Consumer reader.
6272  */
6273 static ssize_t
6274 tracing_read_pipe(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
6275                   size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6276 {
6277         struct trace_iterator *iter = filp->private_data;
6278         ssize_t sret;
6279 
6280         /*
6281          * Avoid more than one consumer on a single file descriptor
6282          * This is just a matter of traces coherency, the ring buffer itself
6283          * is protected.
6284          */
6285         mutex_lock(&iter->mutex);
6286 
6287         /* return any leftover data */
6288         sret = trace_seq_to_user(&iter->seq, ubuf, cnt);
6289         if (sret != -EBUSY)
6290                 goto out;
6291 
6292         trace_seq_init(&iter->seq);
6293 
6294         if (iter->trace->read) {
6295                 sret = iter->trace->read(iter, filp, ubuf, cnt, ppos);
6296                 if (sret)
6297                         goto out;
6298         }
6299 
6300 waitagain:
6301         sret = tracing_wait_pipe(filp);
6302         if (sret <= 0)
6303                 goto out;
6304 
6305         /* stop when tracing is finished */
6306         if (trace_empty(iter)) {
6307                 sret = 0;
6308                 goto out;
6309         }
6310 
6311         if (cnt >= PAGE_SIZE)
6312                 cnt = PAGE_SIZE - 1;
6313 
6314         /* reset all but tr, trace, and overruns */
6315         memset(&iter->seq, 0,
6316                sizeof(struct trace_iterator) -
6317                offsetof(struct trace_iterator, seq));
6318         cpumask_clear(iter->started);
6319         trace_seq_init(&iter->seq);
6320         iter->pos = -1;
6321 
6322         trace_event_read_lock();
6323         trace_access_lock(iter->cpu_file);
6324         while (trace_find_next_entry_inc(iter) != NULL) {
6325                 enum print_line_t ret;
6326                 int save_len = iter->seq.seq.len;
6327 
6328                 ret = print_trace_line(iter);
6329                 if (ret == TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE) {
6330                         /* don't print partial lines */
6331                         iter->seq.seq.len = save_len;
6332                         break;
6333                 }
6334                 if (ret != TRACE_TYPE_NO_CONSUME)
6335                         trace_consume(iter);
6336 
6337                 if (trace_seq_used(&iter->seq) >= cnt)
6338                         break;
6339 
6340                 /*
6341                  * Setting the full flag means we reached the trace_seq buffer
6342                  * size and we should leave by partial output condition above.
6343                  * One of the trace_seq_* functions is not used properly.
6344                  */
6345                 WARN_ONCE(iter->seq.full, "full flag set for trace type %d",
6346                           iter->ent->type);
6347         }
6348         trace_access_unlock(iter->cpu_file);
6349         trace_event_read_unlock();
6350 
6351         /* Now copy what we have to the user */
6352         sret = trace_seq_to_user(&iter->seq, ubuf, cnt);
6353         if (iter->seq.seq.readpos >= trace_seq_used(&iter->seq))
6354                 trace_seq_init(&iter->seq);
6355 
6356         /*
6357          * If there was nothing to send to user, in spite of consuming trace
6358          * entries, go back to wait for more entries.
6359          */
6360         if (sret == -EBUSY)
6361                 goto waitagain;
6362 
6363 out:
6364         mutex_unlock(&iter->mutex);
6365 
6366         return sret;
6367 }
6368 
6369 static void tracing_spd_release_pipe(struct splice_pipe_desc *spd,
6370                                      unsigned int idx)
6371 {
6372         __free_page(spd->pages[idx]);
6373 }
6374 
6375 static size_t
6376 tracing_fill_pipe_page(size_t rem, struct trace_iterator *iter)
6377 {
6378         size_t count;
6379         int save_len;
6380         int ret;
6381 
6382         /* Seq buffer is page-sized, exactly what we need. */
6383         for (;;) {
6384                 save_len = iter->seq.seq.len;
6385                 ret = print_trace_line(iter);
6386 
6387                 if (trace_seq_has_overflowed(&iter->seq)) {
6388                         iter->seq.seq.len = save_len;
6389                         break;
6390                 }
6391 
6392                 /*
6393                  * This should not be hit, because it should only
6394                  * be set if the iter->seq overflowed. But check it
6395                  * anyway to be safe.
6396                  */
6397                 if (ret == TRACE_TYPE_PARTIAL_LINE) {
6398                         iter->seq.seq.len = save_len;
6399                         break;
6400                 }
6401 
6402                 count = trace_seq_used(&iter->seq) - save_len;
6403                 if (rem < count) {
6404                         rem = 0;
6405                         iter->seq.seq.len = save_len;
6406                         break;
6407                 }
6408 
6409                 if (ret != TRACE_TYPE_NO_CONSUME)
6410                         trace_consume(iter);
6411                 rem -= count;
6412                 if (!trace_find_next_entry_inc(iter))   {
6413                         rem = 0;
6414                         iter->ent = NULL;
6415                         break;
6416                 }
6417         }
6418 
6419         return rem;
6420 }
6421 
6422 static ssize_t tracing_splice_read_pipe(struct file *filp,
6423                                         loff_t *ppos,
6424                                         struct pipe_inode_info *pipe,
6425                                         size_t len,
6426                                         unsigned int flags)
6427 {
6428         struct page *pages_def[PIPE_DEF_BUFFERS];
6429         struct partial_page partial_def[PIPE_DEF_BUFFERS];
6430         struct trace_iterator *iter = filp->private_data;
6431         struct splice_pipe_desc spd = {
6432                 .pages          = pages_def,
6433                 .partial        = partial_def,
6434                 .nr_pages       = 0, /* This gets updated below. */
6435                 .nr_pages_max   = PIPE_DEF_BUFFERS,
6436                 .ops            = &default_pipe_buf_ops,
6437                 .spd_release    = tracing_spd_release_pipe,
6438         };
6439         ssize_t ret;
6440         size_t rem;
6441         unsigned int i;
6442 
6443         if (splice_grow_spd(pipe, &spd))
6444                 return -ENOMEM;
6445 
6446         mutex_lock(&iter->mutex);
6447 
6448         if (iter->trace->splice_read) {
6449                 ret = iter->trace->splice_read(iter, filp,
6450                                                ppos, pipe, len, flags);
6451                 if (ret)
6452                         goto out_err;
6453         }
6454 
6455         ret = tracing_wait_pipe(filp);
6456         if (ret <= 0)
6457                 goto out_err;
6458 
6459         if (!iter->ent && !trace_find_next_entry_inc(iter)) {
6460                 ret = -EFAULT;
6461                 goto out_err;
6462         }
6463 
6464         trace_event_read_lock();
6465         trace_access_lock(iter->cpu_file);
6466 
6467         /* Fill as many pages as possible. */
6468         for (i = 0, rem = len; i < spd.nr_pages_max && rem; i++) {
6469                 spd.pages[i] = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
6470                 if (!spd.pages[i])
6471                         break;
6472 
6473                 rem = tracing_fill_pipe_page(rem, iter);
6474 
6475                 /* Copy the data into the page, so we can start over. */
6476                 ret = trace_seq_to_buffer(&iter->seq,
6477                                           page_address(spd.pages[i]),
6478                                           trace_seq_used(&iter->seq));
6479                 if (ret < 0) {
6480                         __free_page(spd.pages[i]);
6481                         break;
6482                 }
6483                 spd.partial[i].offset = 0;
6484                 spd.partial[i].len = trace_seq_used(&iter->seq);
6485 
6486                 trace_seq_init(&iter->seq);
6487         }
6488 
6489         trace_access_unlock(iter->cpu_file);
6490         trace_event_read_unlock();
6491         mutex_unlock(&iter->mutex);
6492 
6493         spd.nr_pages = i;
6494 
6495         if (i)
6496                 ret = splice_to_pipe(pipe, &spd);
6497         else
6498                 ret = 0;
6499 out:
6500         splice_shrink_spd(&spd);
6501         return ret;
6502 
6503 out_err:
6504         mutex_unlock(&iter->mutex);
6505         goto out;
6506 }
6507 
6508 static ssize_t
6509 tracing_entries_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
6510                      size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6511 {
6512         struct inode *inode = file_inode(filp);
6513         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6514         int cpu = tracing_get_cpu(inode);
6515         char buf[64];
6516         int r = 0;
6517         ssize_t ret;
6518 
6519         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6520 
6521         if (cpu == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
6522                 int cpu, buf_size_same;
6523                 unsigned long size;
6524 
6525                 size = 0;
6526                 buf_size_same = 1;
6527                 /* check if all cpu sizes are same */
6528                 for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
6529                         /* fill in the size from first enabled cpu */
6530                         if (size == 0)
6531                                 size = per_cpu_ptr(tr->array_buffer.data, cpu)->entries;
6532                         if (size != per_cpu_ptr(tr->array_buffer.data, cpu)->entries) {
6533                                 buf_size_same = 0;
6534                                 break;
6535                         }
6536                 }
6537 
6538                 if (buf_size_same) {
6539                         if (!ring_buffer_expanded)
6540                                 r = sprintf(buf, "%lu (expanded: %lu)\n",
6541                                             size >> 10,
6542                                             trace_buf_size >> 10);
6543                         else
6544                                 r = sprintf(buf, "%lu\n", size >> 10);
6545                 } else
6546                         r = sprintf(buf, "X\n");
6547         } else
6548                 r = sprintf(buf, "%lu\n", per_cpu_ptr(tr->array_buffer.data, cpu)->entries >> 10);
6549 
6550         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6551 
6552         ret = simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
6553         return ret;
6554 }
6555 
6556 static ssize_t
6557 tracing_entries_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6558                       size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6559 {
6560         struct inode *inode = file_inode(filp);
6561         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6562         unsigned long val;
6563         int ret;
6564 
6565         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
6566         if (ret)
6567                 return ret;
6568 
6569         /* must have at least 1 entry */
6570         if (!val)
6571                 return -EINVAL;
6572 
6573         /* value is in KB */
6574         val <<= 10;
6575         ret = tracing_resize_ring_buffer(tr, val, tracing_get_cpu(inode));
6576         if (ret < 0)
6577                 return ret;
6578 
6579         *ppos += cnt;
6580 
6581         return cnt;
6582 }
6583 
6584 static ssize_t
6585 tracing_total_entries_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
6586                                 size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6587 {
6588         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
6589         char buf[64];
6590         int r, cpu;
6591         unsigned long size = 0, expanded_size = 0;
6592 
6593         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6594         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
6595                 size += per_cpu_ptr(tr->array_buffer.data, cpu)->entries >> 10;
6596                 if (!ring_buffer_expanded)
6597                         expanded_size += trace_buf_size >> 10;
6598         }
6599         if (ring_buffer_expanded)
6600                 r = sprintf(buf, "%lu\n", size);
6601         else
