6602                 r = sprintf(buf, "%lu (expanded: %lu)\n", size, expanded_size);
6603         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6604 
6605         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
6606 }
6607 
6608 static ssize_t
6609 tracing_free_buffer_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6610                           size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
6611 {
6612         /*
6613          * There is no need to read what the user has written, this function
6614          * is just to make sure that there is no error when "echo" is used
6615          */
6616 
6617         *ppos += cnt;
6618 
6619         return cnt;
6620 }
6621 
6622 static int
6623 tracing_free_buffer_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
6624 {
6625         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6626 
6627         /* disable tracing ? */
6628         if (tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_STOP_ON_FREE)
6629                 tracer_tracing_off(tr);
6630         /* resize the ring buffer to 0 */
6631         tracing_resize_ring_buffer(tr, 0, RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS);
6632 
6633         trace_array_put(tr);
6634 
6635         return 0;
6636 }
6637 
6638 static ssize_t
6639 tracing_mark_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6640                                         size_t cnt, loff_t *fpos)
6641 {
6642         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
6643         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
6644         enum event_trigger_type tt = ETT_NONE;
6645         struct trace_buffer *buffer;
6646         struct print_entry *entry;
6647         unsigned long irq_flags;
6648         ssize_t written;
6649         int size;
6650         int len;
6651 
6652 /* Used in tracing_mark_raw_write() as well */
6653 #define FAULTED_STR "<faulted>"
6654 #define FAULTED_SIZE (sizeof(FAULTED_STR) - 1) /* '\0' is already accounted for */
6655 
6656         if (tracing_disabled)
6657                 return -EINVAL;
6658 
6659         if (!(tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_MARKERS))
6660                 return -EINVAL;
6661 
6662         if (cnt > TRACE_BUF_SIZE)
6663                 cnt = TRACE_BUF_SIZE;
6664 
6665         BUILD_BUG_ON(TRACE_BUF_SIZE >= PAGE_SIZE);
6666 
6667         local_save_flags(irq_flags);
6668         size = sizeof(*entry) + cnt + 2; /* add '\0' and possible '\n' */
6669 
6670         /* If less than "<faulted>", then make sure we can still add that */
6671         if (cnt < FAULTED_SIZE)
6672                 size += FAULTED_SIZE - cnt;
6673 
6674         buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
6675         event = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, TRACE_PRINT, size,
6676                                             irq_flags, preempt_count());
6677         if (unlikely(!event))
6678                 /* Ring buffer disabled, return as if not open for write */
6679                 return -EBADF;
6680 
6681         entry = ring_buffer_event_data(event);
6682         entry->ip = _THIS_IP_;
6683 
6684         len = __copy_from_user_inatomic(&entry->buf, ubuf, cnt);
6685         if (len) {
6686                 memcpy(&entry->buf, FAULTED_STR, FAULTED_SIZE);
6687                 cnt = FAULTED_SIZE;
6688                 written = -EFAULT;
6689         } else
6690                 written = cnt;
6691 
6692         if (tr->trace_marker_file && !list_empty(&tr->trace_marker_file->triggers)) {
6693                 /* do not add \n before testing triggers, but add \0 */
6694                 entry->buf[cnt] = '\0';
6695                 tt = event_triggers_call(tr->trace_marker_file, entry, event);
6696         }
6697 
6698         if (entry->buf[cnt - 1] != '\n') {
6699                 entry->buf[cnt] = '\n';
6700                 entry->buf[cnt + 1] = '\0';
6701         } else
6702                 entry->buf[cnt] = '\0';
6703 
6704         if (static_branch_unlikely(&trace_marker_exports_enabled))
6705                 ftrace_exports(event, TRACE_EXPORT_MARKER);
6706         __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
6707 
6708         if (tt)
6709                 event_triggers_post_call(tr->trace_marker_file, tt);
6710 
6711         if (written > 0)
6712                 *fpos += written;
6713 
6714         return written;
6715 }
6716 
6717 /* Limit it for now to 3K (including tag) */
6718 #define RAW_DATA_MAX_SIZE (1024*3)
6719 
6720 static ssize_t
6721 tracing_mark_raw_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6722                                         size_t cnt, loff_t *fpos)
6723 {
6724         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
6725         struct ring_buffer_event *event;
6726         struct trace_buffer *buffer;
6727         struct raw_data_entry *entry;
6728         unsigned long irq_flags;
6729         ssize_t written;
6730         int size;
6731         int len;
6732 
6733 #define FAULT_SIZE_ID (FAULTED_SIZE + sizeof(int))
6734 
6735         if (tracing_disabled)
6736                 return -EINVAL;
6737 
6738         if (!(tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_MARKERS))
6739                 return -EINVAL;
6740 
6741         /* The marker must at least have a tag id */
6742         if (cnt < sizeof(unsigned int) || cnt > RAW_DATA_MAX_SIZE)
6743                 return -EINVAL;
6744 
6745         if (cnt > TRACE_BUF_SIZE)
6746                 cnt = TRACE_BUF_SIZE;
6747 
6748         BUILD_BUG_ON(TRACE_BUF_SIZE >= PAGE_SIZE);
6749 
6750         local_save_flags(irq_flags);
6751         size = sizeof(*entry) + cnt;
6752         if (cnt < FAULT_SIZE_ID)
6753                 size += FAULT_SIZE_ID - cnt;
6754 
6755         buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
6756         event = __trace_buffer_lock_reserve(buffer, TRACE_RAW_DATA, size,
6757                                             irq_flags, preempt_count());
6758         if (!event)
6759                 /* Ring buffer disabled, return as if not open for write */
6760                 return -EBADF;
6761 
6762         entry = ring_buffer_event_data(event);
6763 
6764         len = __copy_from_user_inatomic(&entry->id, ubuf, cnt);
6765         if (len) {
6766                 entry->id = -1;
6767                 memcpy(&entry->buf, FAULTED_STR, FAULTED_SIZE);
6768                 written = -EFAULT;
6769         } else
6770                 written = cnt;
6771 
6772         __buffer_unlock_commit(buffer, event);
6773 
6774         if (written > 0)
6775                 *fpos += written;
6776 
6777         return written;
6778 }
6779 
6780 static int tracing_clock_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
6781 {
6782         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
6783         int i;
6784 
6785         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(trace_clocks); i++)
6786                 seq_printf(m,
6787                         "%s%s%s%s", i ? " " : "",
6788                         i == tr->clock_id ? "[" : "", trace_clocks[i].name,
6789                         i == tr->clock_id ? "]" : "");
6790         seq_putc(m, '\n');
6791 
6792         return 0;
6793 }
6794 
6795 int tracing_set_clock(struct trace_array *tr, const char *clockstr)
6796 {
6797         int i;
6798 
6799         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(trace_clocks); i++) {
6800                 if (strcmp(trace_clocks[i].name, clockstr) == 0)
6801                         break;
6802         }
6803         if (i == ARRAY_SIZE(trace_clocks))
6804                 return -EINVAL;
6805 
6806         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6807 
6808         tr->clock_id = i;
6809 
6810         ring_buffer_set_clock(tr->array_buffer.buffer, trace_clocks[i].func);
6811 
6812         /*
6813          * New clock may not be consistent with the previous clock.
6814          * Reset the buffer so that it doesn't have incomparable timestamps.
6815          */
6816         tracing_reset_online_cpus(&tr->array_buffer);
6817 
6818 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
6819         if (tr->max_buffer.buffer)
6820                 ring_buffer_set_clock(tr->max_buffer.buffer, trace_clocks[i].func);
6821         tracing_reset_online_cpus(&tr->max_buffer);
6822 #endif
6823 
6824         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6825 
6826         return 0;
6827 }
6828 
6829 static ssize_t tracing_clock_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
6830                                    size_t cnt, loff_t *fpos)
6831 {
6832         struct seq_file *m = filp->private_data;
6833         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
6834         char buf[64];
6835         const char *clockstr;
6836         int ret;
6837 
6838         if (cnt >= sizeof(buf))
6839                 return -EINVAL;
6840 
6841         if (copy_from_user(buf, ubuf, cnt))
6842                 return -EFAULT;
6843 
6844         buf[cnt] = 0;
6845 
6846         clockstr = strstrip(buf);
6847 
6848         ret = tracing_set_clock(tr, clockstr);
6849         if (ret)
6850                 return ret;
6851 
6852         *fpos += cnt;
6853 
6854         return cnt;
6855 }
6856 
6857 static int tracing_clock_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
6858 {
6859         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6860         int ret;
6861 
6862         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
6863         if (ret)
6864                 return ret;
6865 
6866         ret = single_open(file, tracing_clock_show, inode->i_private);
6867         if (ret < 0)
6868                 trace_array_put(tr);
6869 
6870         return ret;
6871 }
6872 
6873 static int tracing_time_stamp_mode_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
6874 {
6875         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
6876 
6877         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6878 
6879         if (ring_buffer_time_stamp_abs(tr->array_buffer.buffer))
6880                 seq_puts(m, "delta [absolute]\n");
6881         else
6882                 seq_puts(m, "[delta] absolute\n");
6883 
6884         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6885 
6886         return 0;
6887 }
6888 
6889 static int tracing_time_stamp_mode_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
6890 {
6891         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6892         int ret;
6893 
6894         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
6895         if (ret)
6896                 return ret;
6897 
6898         ret = single_open(file, tracing_time_stamp_mode_show, inode->i_private);
6899         if (ret < 0)
6900                 trace_array_put(tr);
6901 
6902         return ret;
6903 }
6904 
6905 int tracing_set_time_stamp_abs(struct trace_array *tr, bool abs)
6906 {
6907         int ret = 0;
6908 
6909         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
6910 
6911         if (abs && tr->time_stamp_abs_ref++)
6912                 goto out;
6913 
6914         if (!abs) {
6915                 if (WARN_ON_ONCE(!tr->time_stamp_abs_ref)) {
6916                         ret = -EINVAL;
6917                         goto out;
6918                 }
6919 
6920                 if (--tr->time_stamp_abs_ref)
6921                         goto out;
6922         }
6923 
6924         ring_buffer_set_time_stamp_abs(tr->array_buffer.buffer, abs);
6925 
6926 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
6927         if (tr->max_buffer.buffer)
6928                 ring_buffer_set_time_stamp_abs(tr->max_buffer.buffer, abs);
6929 #endif
6930  out:
6931         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
6932 
6933         return ret;
6934 }
6935 
6936 struct ftrace_buffer_info {
6937         struct trace_iterator   iter;
6938         void                    *spare;
6939         unsigned int            spare_cpu;
6940         unsigned int            read;
6941 };
6942 
6943 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
6944 static int tracing_snapshot_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
6945 {
6946         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
6947         struct trace_iterator *iter;
6948         struct seq_file *m;
6949         int ret;
6950 
6951         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
6952         if (ret)
6953                 return ret;
6954 
6955         if (file->f_mode & FMODE_READ) {
6956                 iter = __tracing_open(inode, file, true);
6957                 if (IS_ERR(iter))
6958                         ret = PTR_ERR(iter);
6959         } else {
6960                 /* Writes still need the seq_file to hold the private data */
6961                 ret = -ENOMEM;
6962                 m = kzalloc(sizeof(*m), GFP_KERNEL);
6963                 if (!m)
6964                         goto out;
6965                 iter = kzalloc(sizeof(*iter), GFP_KERNEL);
6966                 if (!iter) {
6967                         kfree(m);
6968                         goto out;
6969                 }
6970                 ret = 0;
6971 
6972                 iter->tr = tr;
6973                 iter->array_buffer = &tr->max_buffer;
6974                 iter->cpu_file = tracing_get_cpu(inode);
6975                 m->private = iter;
6976                 file->private_data = m;
6977         }
6978 out:
6979         if (ret < 0)
6980                 trace_array_put(tr);
6981 
6982         return ret;
6983 }
6984 
6985 static ssize_t
6986 tracing_snapshot_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf, size_t cnt,
6987                        loff_t *ppos)
6988 {
6989         struct seq_file *m = filp->private_data;
6990         struct trace_iterator *iter = m->private;
6991         struct trace_array *tr = iter->tr;
6992         unsigned long val;
6993         int ret;
6994 
6995         ret = tracing_update_buffers();
6996         if (ret < 0)
6997                 return ret;
6998 
6999         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
7000         if (ret)
7001                 return ret;
7002 
7003         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
7004 
7005         if (tr->current_trace->use_max_tr) {
7006                 ret = -EBUSY;
7007                 goto out;
7008         }
7009 
7010         arch_spin_lock(&tr->max_lock);
7011         if (tr->cond_snapshot)
7012                 ret = -EBUSY;
7013         arch_spin_unlock(&tr->max_lock);
7014         if (ret)
7015                 goto out;
7016 
7017         switch (val) {
7018         case 0:
7019                 if (iter->cpu_file != RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
7020                         ret = -EINVAL;
7021                         break;
7022                 }
7023                 if (tr->allocated_snapshot)
7024                         free_snapshot(tr);
7025                 break;
7026         case 1:
7027 /* Only allow per-cpu swap if the ring buffer supports it */
7028 #ifndef CONFIG_RING_BUFFER_ALLOW_SWAP
7029                 if (iter->cpu_file != RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS) {
7030                         ret = -EINVAL;
7031                         break;
7032                 }
7033 #endif
7034                 if (tr->allocated_snapshot)
7035                         ret = resize_buffer_duplicate_size(&tr->max_buffer,
7036                                         &tr->array_buffer, iter->cpu_file);
7037                 else
7038                         ret = tracing_alloc_snapshot_instance(tr);
7039                 if (ret < 0)
7040                         break;
7041                 local_irq_disable();
7042                 /* Now, we're going to swap */
7043                 if (iter->cpu_file == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS)
7044                         update_max_tr(tr, current, smp_processor_id(), NULL);
7045                 else
7046                         update_max_tr_single(tr, current, iter->cpu_file);
7047                 local_irq_enable();
7048                 break;
7049         default:
7050                 if (tr->allocated_snapshot) {
7051                         if (iter->cpu_file == RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS)
7052                                 tracing_reset_online_cpus(&tr->max_buffer);
7053                         else
7054                                 tracing_reset_cpu(&tr->max_buffer, iter->cpu_file);
7055                 }
7056                 break;
7057         }
7058 
7059         if (ret >= 0) {
7060                 *ppos += cnt;
7061                 ret = cnt;
7062         }
7063 out:
7064         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
7065         return ret;
7066 }
7067 
7068 static int tracing_snapshot_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
7069 {
7070         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
7071         int ret;
7072 
7073         ret = tracing_release(inode, file);
7074 
7075         if (file->f_mode & FMODE_READ)
7076                 return ret;
7077 
7078         /* If write only, the seq_file is just a stub */
7079         if (m)
7080                 kfree(m->private);
7081         kfree(m);
7082 
7083         return 0;
7084 }
7085 
7086 static int tracing_buffers_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp);
7087 static ssize_t tracing_buffers_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
7088                                     size_t count, loff_t *ppos);
7089 static int tracing_buffers_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file);
7090 static ssize_t tracing_buffers_splice_read(struct file *file, loff_t *ppos,
7091                    struct pipe_inode_info *pipe, size_t len, unsigned int flags);
7092 
7093 static int snapshot_raw_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
7094 {
7095         struct ftrace_buffer_info *info;
7096         int ret;
7097 
7098         /* The following checks for tracefs lockdown */
7099         ret = tracing_buffers_open(inode, filp);
7100         if (ret < 0)
7101                 return ret;
7102 
7103         info = filp->private_data;
7104 
7105         if (info->iter.trace->use_max_tr) {
7106                 tracing_buffers_release(inode, filp);
7107                 return -EBUSY;
7108         }
7109 
7110         info->iter.snapshot = true;
7111         info->iter.array_buffer = &info->iter.tr->max_buffer;
7112 
7113         return ret;
7114 }
7115 
7116 #endif /* CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT */
7117 
7118

7122         .write          = tracing_thresh_write,
7123         .llseek         = generic_file_llseek,
7124 };

7132 };
7133 #endif

7149 };

7211         .open           = snapshot_raw_open,
7212         .read           = tracing_buffers_read,
7213         .release        = tracing_buffers_release,
7214         .splice_read    = tracing_buffers_splice_read,
7215         .llseek         = no_llseek,

7218 #endif /* CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT */
7219 
7220 #define TRACING_LOG_ERRS_MAX    8
7221 #define TRACING_LOG_LOC_MAX     128
7222 
7223 #define CMD_PREFIX "  Command: "
7224 
7225 struct err_info {
7226         const char      **errs; /* ptr to loc-specific array of err strings */
7227         u8              type;   /* index into errs -> specific err string */
7228         u8              pos;    /* MAX_FILTER_STR_VAL = 256 */
7229         u64             ts;
7230 };
7231 
7232 struct tracing_log_err {
7233         struct list_head        list;
7234         struct err_info         info;
7235         char                    loc[TRACING_LOG_LOC_MAX]; /* err location */
7236         char                    cmd[MAX_FILTER_STR_VAL]; /* what caused err */
7237 };
7238 
7239 static DEFINE_MUTEX(tracing_err_log_lock);
7240 
7241 static struct tracing_log_err *get_tracing_log_err(struct trace_array *tr)
7242 {
7243         struct tracing_log_err *err;
7244 
7245         if (tr->n_err_log_entries < TRACING_LOG_ERRS_MAX) {
7246                 err = kzalloc(sizeof(*err), GFP_KERNEL);
7247                 if (!err)
7248                         err = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
7249                 tr->n_err_log_entries++;
7250 
7251                 return err;
7252         }
7253 
7254         err = list_first_entry(&tr->err_log, struct tracing_log_err, list);
7255         list_del(&err->list);
7256 
7257         return err;
7258 }
7259 
7260 /**
7261  * err_pos - find the position of a string within a command for error careting
7262  * @cmd: The tracing command that caused the error
7263  * @str: The string to position the caret at within @cmd
7264  *
7265  * Finds the position of the first occurence of @str within @cmd.  The
7266  * return value can be passed to tracing_log_err() for caret placement
7267  * within @cmd.
7268  *
7269  * Returns the index within @cmd of the first occurence of @str or 0
7270  * if @str was not found.
7271  */
7272 unsigned int err_pos(char *cmd, const char *str)
7273 {
7274         char *found;
7275 
7276         if (WARN_ON(!strlen(cmd)))
7277                 return 0;
7278 
7279         found = strstr(cmd, str);
7280         if (found)
7281                 return found - cmd;
7282 
7283         return 0;
7284 }
7285 
7286 /**
7287  * tracing_log_err - write an error to the tracing error log
7288  * @tr: The associated trace array for the error (NULL for top level array)
7289  * @loc: A string describing where the error occurred
7290  * @cmd: The tracing command that caused the error
7291  * @errs: The array of loc-specific static error strings
7292  * @type: The index into errs[], which produces the specific static err string
7293  * @pos: The position the caret should be placed in the cmd
7294  *
7295  * Writes an error into tracing/error_log of the form:
7296  *
7297  * <loc>: error: <text>
7298  *   Command: <cmd>
7299  *              ^
7300  *
7301  * tracing/error_log is a small log file containing the last
7302  * TRACING_LOG_ERRS_MAX errors (8).  Memory for errors isn't allocated
7303  * unless there has been a tracing error, and the error log can be
7304  * cleared and have its memory freed by writing the empty string in
7305  * truncation mode to it i.e. echo > tracing/error_log.
7306  *
7307  * NOTE: the @errs array along with the @type param are used to
7308  * produce a static error string - this string is not copied and saved
7309  * when the error is logged - only a pointer to it is saved.  See
7310  * existing callers for examples of how static strings are typically
7311  * defined for use with tracing_log_err().
7312  */
7313 void tracing_log_err(struct trace_array *tr,
7314                      const char *loc, const char *cmd,
7315                      const char **errs, u8 type, u8 pos)
7316 {
7317         struct tracing_log_err *err;
7318 
7319         if (!tr)
7320                 tr = &global_trace;
7321 
7322         mutex_lock(&tracing_err_log_lock);
7323         err = get_tracing_log_err(tr);
7324         if (PTR_ERR(err) == -ENOMEM) {
7325                 mutex_unlock(&tracing_err_log_lock);
7326                 return;
7327         }
7328 
7329         snprintf(err->loc, TRACING_LOG_LOC_MAX, "%s: error: ", loc);
7330         snprintf(err->cmd, MAX_FILTER_STR_VAL,"\n" CMD_PREFIX "%s\n", cmd);
7331 
7332         err->info.errs = errs;
7333         err->info.type = type;
7334         err->info.pos = pos;
7335         err->info.ts = local_clock();
7336 
7337         list_add_tail(&err->list, &tr->err_log);
7338         mutex_unlock(&tracing_err_log_lock);
7339 }
7340 
7341 static void clear_tracing_err_log(struct trace_array *tr)
7342 {
7343         struct tracing_log_err *err, *next;
7344 
7345         mutex_lock(&tracing_err_log_lock);
7346         list_for_each_entry_safe(err, next, &tr->err_log, list) {
7347                 list_del(&err->list);
7348                 kfree(err);
7349         }
7350 
7351         tr->n_err_log_entries = 0;
7352         mutex_unlock(&tracing_err_log_lock);
7353 }
7354 
7355 static void *tracing_err_log_seq_start(struct seq_file *m, loff_t *pos)
7356 {
7357         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
7358 
7359         mutex_lock(&tracing_err_log_lock);
7360 
7361         return seq_list_start(&tr->err_log, *pos);
7362 }
7363 
7364 static void *tracing_err_log_seq_next(struct seq_file *m, void *v, loff_t *pos)
7365 {
7366         struct trace_array *tr = m->private;
7367 
7368         return seq_list_next(v, &tr->err_log, pos);
7369 }
7370 
7371 static void tracing_err_log_seq_stop(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
7372 {
7373         mutex_unlock(&tracing_err_log_lock);
7374 }
7375 
7376 static void tracing_err_log_show_pos(struct seq_file *m, u8 pos)
7377 {
7378         u8 i;
7379 
7380         for (i = 0; i < sizeof(CMD_PREFIX) - 1; i++)
7381                 seq_putc(m, ' ');
7382         for (i = 0; i < pos; i++)
7383                 seq_putc(m, ' ');
7384         seq_puts(m, "^\n");
7385 }
7386 
7387 static int tracing_err_log_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
7388 {
7389         struct tracing_log_err *err = v;
7390 
7391         if (err) {
7392                 const char *err_text = err->info.errs[err->info.type];
7393                 u64 sec = err->info.ts;
7394                 u32 nsec;
7395 
7396                 nsec = do_div(sec, NSEC_PER_SEC);
7397                 seq_printf(m, "[%5llu.%06u] %s%s", sec, nsec / 1000,
7398                            err->loc, err_text);
7399                 seq_printf(m, "%s", err->cmd);
7400                 tracing_err_log_show_pos(m, err->info.pos);
7401         }
7402 
7403         return 0;
7404 }
7405 
7406 static const struct seq_operations tracing_err_log_seq_ops = {
7407         .start  = tracing_err_log_seq_start,
7408         .next   = tracing_err_log_seq_next,
7409         .stop   = tracing_err_log_seq_stop,
7410         .show   = tracing_err_log_seq_show
7411 };
7412 
7413 static int tracing_err_log_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
7414 {
7415         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
7416         int ret = 0;
7417 
7418         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
7419         if (ret)
7420                 return ret;
7421 
7422         /* If this file was opened for write, then erase contents */
7423         if ((file->f_mode & FMODE_WRITE) && (file->f_flags & O_TRUNC))
7424                 clear_tracing_err_log(tr);
7425 
7426         if (file->f_mode & FMODE_READ) {
7427                 ret = seq_open(file, &tracing_err_log_seq_ops);
7428                 if (!ret) {
7429                         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
7430                         m->private = tr;
7431                 } else {
7432                         trace_array_put(tr);
7433                 }
7434         }
7435         return ret;
7436 }
7437 
7438 static ssize_t tracing_err_log_write(struct file *file,
7439                                      const char __user *buffer,
7440                                      size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
7441 {
7442         return count;
7443 }
7444 
7445 static int tracing_err_log_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
7446 {
7447         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
7448 
7449         trace_array_put(tr);
7450 
7451         if (file->f_mode & FMODE_READ)
7452                 seq_release(inode, file);
7453 
7454         return 0;
7455 }
7456 
7457 static const struct file_operations tracing_err_log_fops = {
7458         .open           = tracing_err_log_open,
7459         .write          = tracing_err_log_write,
7460         .read           = seq_read,
7461         .llseek         = seq_lseek,
7462         .release        = tracing_err_log_release,
7463 };
7464 
7465 static int tracing_buffers_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *filp)
7466 {
7467         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
7468         struct ftrace_buffer_info *info;
7469         int ret;
7470 
7471         ret = tracing_check_open_get_tr(tr);
7472         if (ret)
7473                 return ret;
7474 
7475         info = kvzalloc(sizeof(*info), GFP_KERNEL);
7476         if (!info) {
7477                 trace_array_put(tr);
7478                 return -ENOMEM;
7479         }
7480 
7481         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
7482 
7483         info->iter.tr           = tr;
7484         info->iter.cpu_file     = tracing_get_cpu(inode);
7485         info->iter.trace        = tr->current_trace;
7486         info->iter.array_buffer = &tr->array_buffer;
7487         info->spare             = NULL;
7488         /* Force reading ring buffer for first read */
7489         info->read              = (unsigned int)-1;
7490 
7491         filp->private_data = info;
7492 
7493         tr->trace_ref++;
7494 
7495         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
7496 
7497         ret = nonseekable_open(inode, filp);
7498         if (ret < 0)
7499                 trace_array_put(tr);
7500 
7501         return ret;
7502 }
7503 
7504 static __poll_t
7505 tracing_buffers_poll(struct file *filp, poll_table *poll_table)
7506 {
7507         struct ftrace_buffer_info *info = filp->private_data;
7508         struct trace_iterator *iter = &info->iter;
7509 
7510         return trace_poll(iter, filp, poll_table);
7511 }
7512 
7513 static ssize_t
7514 tracing_buffers_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
7515                      size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
7516 {
7517         struct ftrace_buffer_info *info = filp->private_data;
7518         struct trace_iterator *iter = &info->iter;
7519         ssize_t ret = 0;
7520         ssize_t size;
7521 
7522         if (!count)
7523                 return 0;
7524 
7525 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
7526         if (iter->snapshot && iter->tr->current_trace->use_max_tr)
7527                 return -EBUSY;
7528 #endif
7529 
7530         if (!info->spare) {
7531                 info->spare = ring_buffer_alloc_read_page(iter->array_buffer->buffer,
7532                                                           iter->cpu_file);
7533                 if (IS_ERR(info->spare)) {
7534                         ret = PTR_ERR(info->spare);
7535                         info->spare = NULL;
7536                 } else {
7537                         info->spare_cpu = iter->cpu_file;
7538                 }
7539         }
7540         if (!info->spare)
7541                 return ret;
7542 
7543         /* Do we have previous read data to read? */
7544         if (info->read < PAGE_SIZE)
7545                 goto read;
7546 
7547  again:
7548         trace_access_lock(iter->cpu_file);
7549         ret = ring_buffer_read_page(iter->array_buffer->buffer,
7550                                     &info->spare,
7551                                     count,
7552                                     iter->cpu_file, 0);
7553         trace_access_unlock(iter->cpu_file);
7554 
7555         if (ret < 0) {
7556                 if (trace_empty(iter)) {
7557                         if ((filp->f_flags & O_NONBLOCK))
7558                                 return -EAGAIN;
7559 
7560                         ret = wait_on_pipe(iter, 0);
7561                         if (ret)
7562                                 return ret;
7563 
7564                         goto again;
7565                 }
7566                 return 0;
7567         }
7568 
7569         info->read = 0;
7570  read:
7571         size = PAGE_SIZE - info->read;
7572         if (size > count)
7573                 size = count;
7574 
7575         ret = copy_to_user(ubuf, info->spare + info->read, size);
7576         if (ret == size)
7577                 return -EFAULT;
7578 
7579         size -= ret;
7580 
7581         *ppos += size;
7582         info->read += size;
7583 
7584         return size;
7585 }
7586 
7587 static int tracing_buffers_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
7588 {
7589         struct ftrace_buffer_info *info = file->private_data;
7590         struct trace_iterator *iter = &info->iter;
7591 
7592         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
7593 
7594         iter->tr->trace_ref--;
7595 
7596         __trace_array_put(iter->tr);
7597 
7598         if (info->spare)
7599                 ring_buffer_free_read_page(iter->array_buffer->buffer,
7600                                            info->spare_cpu, info->spare);
7601         kvfree(info);
7602 
7603         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
7604 
7605         return 0;
7606 }
7607 
7608 struct buffer_ref {
7609         struct trace_buffer     *buffer;
7610         void                    *page;
7611         int                     cpu;
7612         refcount_t              refcount;
7613 };
7614 
7615 static void buffer_ref_release(struct buffer_ref *ref)
7616 {
7617         if (!refcount_dec_and_test(&ref->refcount))
7618                 return;
7619         ring_buffer_free_read_page(ref->buffer, ref->cpu, ref->page);
7620         kfree(ref);
7621 }
7622 
7623 static void buffer_pipe_buf_release(struct pipe_inode_info *pipe,
7624                                     struct pipe_buffer *buf)
7625 {
7626         struct buffer_ref *ref = (struct buffer_ref *)buf->private;
7627 
7628         buffer_ref_release(ref);
7629         buf->private = 0;
7630 }
7631 
7632 static bool buffer_pipe_buf_get(struct pipe_inode_info *pipe,
7633                                 struct pipe_buffer *buf)
7634 {
7635         struct buffer_ref *ref = (struct buffer_ref *)buf->private;
7636 
7637         if (refcount_read(&ref->refcount) > INT_MAX/2)
7638                 return false;
7639 
7640         refcount_inc(&ref->refcount);
7641         return true;
7642 }
7643 
7644 /* Pipe buffer operations for a buffer. */
7645 static const struct pipe_buf_operations buffer_pipe_buf_ops = {
7646         .release                = buffer_pipe_buf_release,
7647         .get                    = buffer_pipe_buf_get,
7648 };
7649 
7650 /*
7651  * Callback from splice_to_pipe(), if we need to release some pages
7652  * at the end of the spd in case we error'ed out in filling the pipe.
7653  */
7654 static void buffer_spd_release(struct splice_pipe_desc *spd, unsigned int i)
7655 {
7656         struct buffer_ref *ref =
7657                 (struct buffer_ref *)spd->partial[i].private;
7658 
7659         buffer_ref_release(ref);
7660         spd->partial[i].private = 0;
7661 }
7662 
7663 static ssize_t
7664 tracing_buffers_splice_read(struct file *file, loff_t *ppos,
7665                             struct pipe_inode_info *pipe, size_t len,
7666                             unsigned int flags)
7667 {
7668         struct ftrace_buffer_info *info = file->private_data;
7669         struct trace_iterator *iter = &info->iter;
7670         struct partial_page partial_def[PIPE_DEF_BUFFERS];
7671         struct page *pages_def[PIPE_DEF_BUFFERS];
7672         struct splice_pipe_desc spd = {
7673                 .pages          = pages_def,
7674                 .partial        = partial_def,
7675                 .nr_pages_max   = PIPE_DEF_BUFFERS,
7676                 .ops            = &buffer_pipe_buf_ops,
7677                 .spd_release    = buffer_spd_release,
7678         };
7679         struct buffer_ref *ref;
7680         int entries, i;
7681         ssize_t ret = 0;
7682 
7683 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
7684         if (iter->snapshot && iter->tr->current_trace->use_max_tr)
7685                 return -EBUSY;
7686 #endif
7687 
7688         if (*ppos & (PAGE_SIZE - 1))
7689                 return -EINVAL;
7690 
7691         if (len & (PAGE_SIZE - 1)) {
7692                 if (len < PAGE_SIZE)
7693                         return -EINVAL;
7694                 len &= PAGE_MASK;
7695         }
7696 
7697         if (splice_grow_spd(pipe, &spd))
7698                 return -ENOMEM;
7699 
7700  again:
7701         trace_access_lock(iter->cpu_file);
7702         entries = ring_buffer_entries_cpu(iter->array_buffer->buffer, iter->cpu_file);
7703 
7704         for (i = 0; i < spd.nr_pages_max && len && entries; i++, len -= PAGE_SIZE) {
7705                 struct page *page;
7706                 int r;
7707 
7708                 ref = kzalloc(sizeof(*ref), GFP_KERNEL);
7709                 if (!ref) {
7710                         ret = -ENOMEM;
7711                         break;
7712                 }
7713 
7714                 refcount_set(&ref->refcount, 1);
7715                 ref->buffer = iter->array_buffer->buffer;
7716                 ref->page = ring_buffer_alloc_read_page(ref->buffer, iter->cpu_file);
7717                 if (IS_ERR(ref->page)) {
7718                         ret = PTR_ERR(ref->page);
7719                         ref->page = NULL;
7720                         kfree(ref);
7721                         break;
7722                 }
7723                 ref->cpu = iter->cpu_file;
7724 
7725                 r = ring_buffer_read_page(ref->buffer, &ref->page,
7726                                           len, iter->cpu_file, 1);
7727                 if (r < 0) {
7728                         ring_buffer_free_read_page(ref->buffer, ref->cpu,
7729                                                    ref->page);
7730                         kfree(ref);
7731                         break;
7732                 }
7733 
7734                 page = virt_to_page(ref->page);
7735 
7736                 spd.pages[i] = page;
7737                 spd.partial[i].len = PAGE_SIZE;
7738                 spd.partial[i].offset = 0;
7739                 spd.partial[i].private = (unsigned long)ref;
7740                 spd.nr_pages++;
7741                 *ppos += PAGE_SIZE;
7742 
7743                 entries = ring_buffer_entries_cpu(iter->array_buffer->buffer, iter->cpu_file);
7744         }
7745 
7746         trace_access_unlock(iter->cpu_file);
7747         spd.nr_pages = i;
7748 
7749         /* did we read anything? */
7750         if (!spd.nr_pages) {
7751                 if (ret)
7752                         goto out;
7753 
7754                 ret = -EAGAIN;
7755                 if ((file->f_flags & O_NONBLOCK) || (flags & SPLICE_F_NONBLOCK))
7756                         goto out;
7757 
7758                 ret = wait_on_pipe(iter, iter->tr->buffer_percent);
7759                 if (ret)
7760                         goto out;
7761 
7762                 goto again;
7763         }
7764 
7765         ret = splice_to_pipe(pipe, &spd);
7766 out:
7767         splice_shrink_spd(&spd);
7768 
7769         return ret;
7770 }
7771 
7772 static const struct file_operations tracing_buffers_fops = {
7773         .open           = tracing_buffers_open,
7774         .read           = tracing_buffers_read,
7775         .poll           = tracing_buffers_poll,
7776         .release        = tracing_buffers_release,
7777         .splice_read    = tracing_buffers_splice_read,
7778         .llseek         = no_llseek,
7779 };
7780 
7781 static ssize_t
7782 tracing_stats_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
7783                    size_t count, loff_t *ppos)
7784 {
7785         struct inode *inode = file_inode(filp);
7786         struct trace_array *tr = inode->i_private;
7787         struct array_buffer *trace_buf = &tr->array_buffer;
7788         int cpu = tracing_get_cpu(inode);
7789         struct trace_seq *s;
7790         unsigned long cnt;
7791         unsigned long long t;
7792         unsigned long usec_rem;
7793 
7794         s = kmalloc(sizeof(*s), GFP_KERNEL);
7795         if (!s)
7796                 return -ENOMEM;
7797 
7798         trace_seq_init(s);
7799 
7800         cnt = ring_buffer_entries_cpu(trace_buf->buffer, cpu);
7801         trace_seq_printf(s, "entries: %ld\n", cnt);
7802 
7803         cnt = ring_buffer_overrun_cpu(trace_buf->buffer, cpu);
7804         trace_seq_printf(s, "overrun: %ld\n", cnt);
7805 
7806         cnt = ring_buffer_commit_overrun_cpu(trace_buf->buffer, cpu);
7807         trace_seq_printf(s, "commit overrun: %ld\n", cnt);
7808 
7809         cnt = ring_buffer_bytes_cpu(trace_buf->buffer, cpu);
7810         trace_seq_printf(s, "bytes: %ld\n", cnt);
7811 
7812         if (trace_clocks[tr->clock_id].in_ns) {
7813                 /* local or global for trace_clock */
7814                 t = ns2usecs(ring_buffer_oldest_event_ts(trace_buf->buffer, cpu));
7815                 usec_rem = do_div(t, USEC_PER_SEC);
7816                 trace_seq_printf(s, "oldest event ts: %5llu.%06lu\n",
7817                                                                 t, usec_rem);
7818 
7819                 t = ns2usecs(ring_buffer_time_stamp(trace_buf->buffer, cpu));
7820                 usec_rem = do_div(t, USEC_PER_SEC);
7821                 trace_seq_printf(s, "now ts: %5llu.%06lu\n", t, usec_rem);
7822         } else {
7823                 /* counter or tsc mode for trace_clock */
7824                 trace_seq_printf(s, "oldest event ts: %llu\n",
7825                                 ring_buffer_oldest_event_ts(trace_buf->buffer, cpu));
7826 
7827                 trace_seq_printf(s, "now ts: %llu\n",
7828                                 ring_buffer_time_stamp(trace_buf->buffer, cpu));
7829         }
7830 
7831         cnt = ring_buffer_dropped_events_cpu(trace_buf->buffer, cpu);
7832         trace_seq_printf(s, "dropped events: %ld\n", cnt);
7833 
7834         cnt = ring_buffer_read_events_cpu(trace_buf->buffer, cpu);
7835         trace_seq_printf(s, "read events: %ld\n", cnt);
7836 
7837         count = simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, count, ppos,
7838                                         s->buffer, trace_seq_used(s));
7839 
7840         kfree(s);
7841 
7842         return count;
7843 }
7844 
7845 static const struct file_operations tracing_stats_fops = {
7846         .open           = tracing_open_generic_tr,
7847         .read           = tracing_stats_read,
7848         .llseek         = generic_file_llseek,
7849         .release        = tracing_release_generic_tr,
7850 };
7851 
7852 #ifdef CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE
7853 
7854 static ssize_t
7855 tracing_read_dyn_info(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
7856                   size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
7857 {
7858         ssize_t ret;
7859         char *buf;
7860         int r;
7861 
7862         /* 256 should be plenty to hold the amount needed */
7863         buf = kmalloc(256, GFP_KERNEL);
7864         if (!buf)
7865                 return -ENOMEM;
7866 
7867         r = scnprintf(buf, 256, "%ld pages:%ld groups: %ld\n",
7868                       ftrace_update_tot_cnt,
7869                       ftrace_number_of_pages,
7870                       ftrace_number_of_groups);
7871 
7872         ret = simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
7873         kfree(buf);
7874         return ret;
7875 }
7876 
7877 static const struct file_operations tracing_dyn_info_fops = {
7878         .open           = tracing_open_generic,
7879         .read           = tracing_read_dyn_info,
7880         .llseek         = generic_file_llseek,
7881 };
7882 #endif /* CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE */
7883 
7884 #if defined(CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT) && defined(CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE)
7885 static void
7886 ftrace_snapshot(unsigned long ip, unsigned long parent_ip,
7887                 struct trace_array *tr, struct ftrace_probe_ops *ops,
7888                 void *data)
7889 {
7890         tracing_snapshot_instance(tr);
7891 }
7892 
7893 static void
7894 ftrace_count_snapshot(unsigned long ip, unsigned long parent_ip,
7895                       struct trace_array *tr, struct ftrace_probe_ops *ops,
7896                       void *data)
7897 {
7898         struct ftrace_func_mapper *mapper = data;
7899         long *count = NULL;
7900 
7901         if (mapper)
7902                 count = (long *)ftrace_func_mapper_find_ip(mapper, ip);
7903 
7904         if (count) {
7905 
7906                 if (*count <= 0)
7907                         return;
7908 
7909                 (*count)--;
7910         }
7911 
7912         tracing_snapshot_instance(tr);
7913 }
7914 
7915 static int
7916 ftrace_snapshot_print(struct seq_file *m, unsigned long ip,
7917                       struct ftrace_probe_ops *ops, void *data)
7918 {
7919         struct ftrace_func_mapper *mapper = data;
7920         long *count = NULL;
7921 
7922         seq_printf(m, "%ps:", (void *)ip);
7923 
7924         seq_puts(m, "snapshot");
7925 
7926         if (mapper)
7927                 count = (long *)ftrace_func_mapper_find_ip(mapper, ip);
7928 
7929         if (count)
7930                 seq_printf(m, ":count=%ld\n", *count);
7931         else
7932                 seq_puts(m, ":unlimited\n");
7933 
7934         return 0;
7935 }
7936 
7937 static int
7938 ftrace_snapshot_init(struct ftrace_probe_ops *ops, struct trace_array *tr,
7939                      unsigned long ip, void *init_data, void **data)
7940 {
7941         struct ftrace_func_mapper *mapper = *data;
7942 
7943         if (!mapper) {
7944                 mapper = allocate_ftrace_func_mapper();
7945                 if (!mapper)
7946                         return -ENOMEM;
7947                 *data = mapper;
7948         }
7949 
7950         return ftrace_func_mapper_add_ip(mapper, ip, init_data);
7951 }
7952 
7953 static void
7954 ftrace_snapshot_free(struct ftrace_probe_ops *ops, struct trace_array *tr,
7955                      unsigned long ip, void *data)
7956 {
7957         struct ftrace_func_mapper *mapper = data;
7958 
7959         if (!ip) {
7960                 if (!mapper)
7961                         return;
7962                 free_ftrace_func_mapper(mapper, NULL);
7963                 return;
7964         }
7965 
7966         ftrace_func_mapper_remove_ip(mapper, ip);
7967 }
7968 
7969 static struct ftrace_probe_ops snapshot_probe_ops = {
7970         .func                   = ftrace_snapshot,
7971         .print                  = ftrace_snapshot_print,
7972 };
7973 
7974 static struct ftrace_probe_ops snapshot_count_probe_ops = {
7975         .func                   = ftrace_count_snapshot,
7976         .print                  = ftrace_snapshot_print,
7977         .init                   = ftrace_snapshot_init,
7978         .free                   = ftrace_snapshot_free,
7979 };
7980 
7981 static int
7982 ftrace_trace_snapshot_callback(struct trace_array *tr, struct ftrace_hash *hash,
7983                                char *glob, char *cmd, char *param, int enable)
7984 {
7985         struct ftrace_probe_ops *ops;
7986         void *count = (void *)-1;
7987         char *number;
7988         int ret;
7989 
7990         if (!tr)
7991                 return -ENODEV;
7992 
7993         /* hash funcs only work with set_ftrace_filter */
7994         if (!enable)
7995                 return -EINVAL;
7996 
7997         ops = param ? &snapshot_count_probe_ops :  &snapshot_probe_ops;
7998 
7999         if (glob[0] == '!')
8000                 return unregister_ftrace_function_probe_func(glob+1, tr, ops);
8001 
8002         if (!param)
8003                 goto out_reg;
8004 
8005         number = strsep(&param, ":");
8006 
8007         if (!strlen(number))
8008                 goto out_reg;
8009 
8010         /*
8011          * We use the callback data field (which is a pointer)
8012          * as our counter.
8013          */
8014         ret = kstrtoul(number, 0, (unsigned long *)&count);
8015         if (ret)
8016                 return ret;
8017 
8018  out_reg:
8019         ret = tracing_alloc_snapshot_instance(tr);
8020         if (ret < 0)
8021                 goto out;
8022 
8023         ret = register_ftrace_function_probe(glob, tr, ops, count);
8024 
8025  out:
8026         return ret < 0 ? ret : 0;
8027 }
8028 
8029 static struct ftrace_func_command ftrace_snapshot_cmd = {
8030         .name                   = "snapshot",
8031         .func                   = ftrace_trace_snapshot_callback,
8032 };
8033 
8034 static __init int register_snapshot_cmd(void)
8035 {
8036         return register_ftrace_command(&ftrace_snapshot_cmd);
8037 }
8038 #else
8039 static inline __init int register_snapshot_cmd(void) { return 0; }
8040 #endif /* defined(CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT) && defined(CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE) */
8041 
8042 static struct dentry *tracing_get_dentry(struct trace_array *tr)
8043 {
8044         if (WARN_ON(!tr->dir))
8045                 return ERR_PTR(-ENODEV);
8046 
8047         /* Top directory uses NULL as the parent */
8048         if (tr->flags & TRACE_ARRAY_FL_GLOBAL)
8049                 return NULL;
8050 
8051         /* All sub buffers have a descriptor */
8052         return tr->dir;
8053 }
8054 
8055 static struct dentry *tracing_dentry_percpu(struct trace_array *tr, int cpu)
8056 {
8057         struct dentry *d_tracer;
8058 
8059         if (tr->percpu_dir)
8060                 return tr->percpu_dir;
8061 
8062         d_tracer = tracing_get_dentry(tr);
8063         if (IS_ERR(d_tracer))
8064                 return NULL;
8065 
8066         tr->percpu_dir = tracefs_create_dir("per_cpu", d_tracer);
8067 
8068         MEM_FAIL(!tr->percpu_dir,
8069                   "Could not create tracefs directory 'per_cpu/%d'\n", cpu);
8070 
8071         return tr->percpu_dir;
8072 }
8073 
8074 static struct dentry *
8075 trace_create_cpu_file(const char *name, umode_t mode, struct dentry *parent,
8076                       void *data, long cpu, const struct file_operations *fops)
8077 {
8078         struct dentry *ret = trace_create_file(name, mode, parent, data, fops);
8079 
8080         if (ret) /* See tracing_get_cpu() */
8081                 d_inode(ret)->i_cdev = (void *)(cpu + 1);
8082         return ret;
8083 }
8084 
8085 static void
8086 tracing_init_tracefs_percpu(struct trace_array *tr, long cpu)
8087 {
8088         struct dentry *d_percpu = tracing_dentry_percpu(tr, cpu);
8089         struct dentry *d_cpu;
8090         char cpu_dir[30]; /* 30 characters should be more than enough */
8091 
8092         if (!d_percpu)
8093                 return;
8094 
8095         snprintf(cpu_dir, 30, "cpu%ld", cpu);
8096         d_cpu = tracefs_create_dir(cpu_dir, d_percpu);
8097         if (!d_cpu) {
8098                 pr_warn("Could not create tracefs '%s' entry\n", cpu_dir);
8099                 return;
8100         }
8101 
8102         /* per cpu trace_pipe */
8103         trace_create_cpu_file("trace_pipe", 0444, d_cpu,
8104                                 tr, cpu, &tracing_pipe_fops);
8105 
8106         /* per cpu trace */
8107         trace_create_cpu_file("trace", 0644, d_cpu,
8108                                 tr, cpu, &tracing_fops);
8109 
8110         trace_create_cpu_file("trace_pipe_raw", 0444, d_cpu,
8111                                 tr, cpu, &tracing_buffers_fops);
8112 
8113         trace_create_cpu_file("stats", 0444, d_cpu,
8114                                 tr, cpu, &tracing_stats_fops);
8115 
8116         trace_create_cpu_file("buffer_size_kb", 0444, d_cpu,
8117                                 tr, cpu, &tracing_entries_fops);
8118 
8119 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
8120         trace_create_cpu_file("snapshot", 0644, d_cpu,
8121                                 tr, cpu, &snapshot_fops);
8122 
8123         trace_create_cpu_file("snapshot_raw", 0444, d_cpu,
8124                                 tr, cpu, &snapshot_raw_fops);
8125 #endif
8126 }
8127 
8128 #ifdef CONFIG_FTRACE_SELFTEST
8129 /* Let selftest have access to static functions in this file */
8130 #include "trace_selftest.c"
8131 #endif
8132 
8133 static ssize_t
8134 trace_options_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf, size_t cnt,
8135                         loff_t *ppos)
8136 {
8137         struct trace_option_dentry *topt = filp->private_data;
8138         char *buf;
8139 
8140         if (topt->flags->val & topt->opt->bit)
8141                 buf = "1\n";
8142         else
8143                 buf = "0\n";
8144 
8145         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, 2);
8146 }
8147 
8148 static ssize_t
8149 trace_options_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf, size_t cnt,
8150                          loff_t *ppos)
8151 {
8152         struct trace_option_dentry *topt = filp->private_data;
8153         unsigned long val;
8154         int ret;
8155 
8156         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
8157         if (ret)
8158                 return ret;
8159 
8160         if (val != 0 && val != 1)
8161                 return -EINVAL;
8162 
8163         if (!!(topt->flags->val & topt->opt->bit) != val) {
8164                 mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8165                 ret = __set_tracer_option(topt->tr, topt->flags,
8166                                           topt->opt, !val);
8167                 mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8168                 if (ret)
8169                         return ret;
8170         }
8171 
8172         *ppos += cnt;
8173 
8174         return cnt;
8175 }
8176 
8177 
8178 static const struct file_operations trace_options_fops = {
8179         .open = tracing_open_generic,
8180         .read = trace_options_read,
8181         .write = trace_options_write,
8182         .llseek = generic_file_llseek,
8183 };
8184 
8185 /*
8186  * In order to pass in both the trace_array descriptor as well as the index
8187  * to the flag that the trace option file represents, the trace_array
8188  * has a character array of trace_flags_index[], which holds the index
8189  * of the bit for the flag it represents. index[0] == 0, index[1] == 1, etc.
8190  * The address of this character array is passed to the flag option file
8191  * read/write callbacks.
8192  *
8193  * In order to extract both the index and the trace_array descriptor,
8194  * get_tr_index() uses the following algorithm.
8195  *
8196  *   idx = *ptr;
8197  *
8198  * As the pointer itself contains the address of the index (remember
8199  * index[1] == 1).
8200  *
8201  * Then to get the trace_array descriptor, by subtracting that index
8202  * from the ptr, we get to the start of the index itself.
8203  *
8204  *   ptr - idx == &index[0]
8205  *
8206  * Then a simple container_of() from that pointer gets us to the
8207  * trace_array descriptor.
8208  */
8209 static void get_tr_index(void *data, struct trace_array **ptr,
8210                          unsigned int *pindex)
8211 {
8212         *pindex = *(unsigned char *)data;
8213 
8214         *ptr = container_of(data - *pindex, struct trace_array,
8215                             trace_flags_index);
8216 }
8217 
8218 static ssize_t
8219 trace_options_core_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf, size_t cnt,
8220                         loff_t *ppos)
8221 {
8222         void *tr_index = filp->private_data;
8223         struct trace_array *tr;
8224         unsigned int index;
8225         char *buf;
8226 
8227         get_tr_index(tr_index, &tr, &index);
8228 
8229         if (tr->trace_flags & (1 << index))
8230                 buf = "1\n";
8231         else
8232                 buf = "0\n";
8233 
8234         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, 2);
8235 }
8236 
8237 static ssize_t
8238 trace_options_core_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf, size_t cnt,
8239                          loff_t *ppos)
8240 {
8241         void *tr_index = filp->private_data;
8242         struct trace_array *tr;
8243         unsigned int index;
8244         unsigned long val;
8245         int ret;
8246 
8247         get_tr_index(tr_index, &tr, &index);
8248 
8249         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
8250         if (ret)
8251                 return ret;
8252 
8253         if (val != 0 && val != 1)
8254                 return -EINVAL;
8255 
8256         mutex_lock(&event_mutex);
8257         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8258         ret = set_tracer_flag(tr, 1 << index, val);
8259         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8260         mutex_unlock(&event_mutex);
8261 
8262         if (ret < 0)
8263                 return ret;
8264 
8265         *ppos += cnt;
8266 
8267         return cnt;
8268 }
8269 
8270 static const struct file_operations trace_options_core_fops = {
8271         .open = tracing_open_generic,
8272         .read = trace_options_core_read,
8273         .write = trace_options_core_write,
8274         .llseek = generic_file_llseek,
8275 };
8276 
8277 struct dentry *trace_create_file(const char *name,
8278                                  umode_t mode,
8279                                  struct dentry *parent,
8280                                  void *data,
8281                                  const struct file_operations *fops)
8282 {
8283         struct dentry *ret;
8284 
8285         ret = tracefs_create_file(name, mode, parent, data, fops);
8286         if (!ret)
8287                 pr_warn("Could not create tracefs '%s' entry\n", name);
8288 
8289         return ret;
8290 }
8291 
8292 
8293 static struct dentry *trace_options_init_dentry(struct trace_array *tr)
8294 {
8295         struct dentry *d_tracer;
8296 
8297         if (tr->options)
8298                 return tr->options;
8299 
8300         d_tracer = tracing_get_dentry(tr);
8301         if (IS_ERR(d_tracer))
8302                 return NULL;
8303 
8304         tr->options = tracefs_create_dir("options", d_tracer);
8305         if (!tr->options) {
8306                 pr_warn("Could not create tracefs directory 'options'\n");
8307                 return NULL;
8308         }
8309 
8310         return tr->options;
8311 }
8312 
8313 static void
8314 create_trace_option_file(struct trace_array *tr,
8315                          struct trace_option_dentry *topt,
8316                          struct tracer_flags *flags,
8317                          struct tracer_opt *opt)
8318 {
8319         struct dentry *t_options;
8320 
8321         t_options = trace_options_init_dentry(tr);
8322         if (!t_options)
8323                 return;
8324 
8325         topt->flags = flags;
8326         topt->opt = opt;
8327         topt->tr = tr;
8328 
8329         topt->entry = trace_create_file(opt->name, 0644, t_options, topt,
8330                                     &trace_options_fops);
8331 
8332 }
8333 
8334 static void
8335 create_trace_option_files(struct trace_array *tr, struct tracer *tracer)
8336 {
8337         struct trace_option_dentry *topts;
8338         struct trace_options *tr_topts;
8339         struct tracer_flags *flags;
8340         struct tracer_opt *opts;
8341         int cnt;
8342         int i;
8343 
8344         if (!tracer)
8345                 return;
8346 
8347         flags = tracer->flags;
8348 
8349         if (!flags || !flags->opts)
8350                 return;
8351 
8352         /*
8353          * If this is an instance, only create flags for tracers
8354          * the instance may have.
8355          */
8356         if (!trace_ok_for_array(tracer, tr))
8357                 return;
8358 
8359         for (i = 0; i < tr->nr_topts; i++) {
8360                 /* Make sure there's no duplicate flags. */
8361                 if (WARN_ON_ONCE(tr->topts[i].tracer->flags == tracer->flags))
8362                         return;
8363         }
8364 
8365         opts = flags->opts;
8366 
8367         for (cnt = 0; opts[cnt].name; cnt++)
8368                 ;
8369 
8370         topts = kcalloc(cnt + 1, sizeof(*topts), GFP_KERNEL);
8371         if (!topts)
8372                 return;
8373 
8374         tr_topts = krealloc(tr->topts, sizeof(*tr->topts) * (tr->nr_topts + 1),
8375                             GFP_KERNEL);
8376         if (!tr_topts) {
8377                 kfree(topts);
8378                 return;
8379         }
8380 
8381         tr->topts = tr_topts;
8382         tr->topts[tr->nr_topts].tracer = tracer;
8383         tr->topts[tr->nr_topts].topts = topts;
8384         tr->nr_topts++;
8385 
8386         for (cnt = 0; opts[cnt].name; cnt++) {
8387                 create_trace_option_file(tr, &topts[cnt], flags,
8388                                          &opts[cnt]);
8389                 MEM_FAIL(topts[cnt].entry == NULL,
8390                           "Failed to create trace option: %s",
8391                           opts[cnt].name);
8392         }
8393 }
8394 
8395 static struct dentry *
8396 create_trace_option_core_file(struct trace_array *tr,
8397                               const char *option, long index)
8398 {
8399         struct dentry *t_options;
8400 
8401         t_options = trace_options_init_dentry(tr);
8402         if (!t_options)
8403                 return NULL;
8404 
8405         return trace_create_file(option, 0644, t_options,
8406                                  (void *)&tr->trace_flags_index[index],
8407                                  &trace_options_core_fops);
8408 }
8409 
8410 static void create_trace_options_dir(struct trace_array *tr)
8411 {
8412         struct dentry *t_options;
8413         bool top_level = tr == &global_trace;
8414         int i;
8415 
8416         t_options = trace_options_init_dentry(tr);
8417         if (!t_options)
8418                 return;
8419 
8420         for (i = 0; trace_options[i]; i++) {
8421                 if (top_level ||
8422                     !((1 << i) & TOP_LEVEL_TRACE_FLAGS))
8423                         create_trace_option_core_file(tr, trace_options[i], i);
8424         }
8425 }
8426 
8427 static ssize_t
8428 rb_simple_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
8429                size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
8430 {
8431         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
8432         char buf[64];
8433         int r;
8434 
8435         r = tracer_tracing_is_on(tr);
8436         r = sprintf(buf, "%d\n", r);
8437 
8438         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
8439 }
8440 
8441 static ssize_t
8442 rb_simple_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
8443                 size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
8444 {
8445         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
8446         struct trace_buffer *buffer = tr->array_buffer.buffer;
8447         unsigned long val;
8448         int ret;
8449 
8450         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
8451         if (ret)
8452                 return ret;
8453 
8454         if (buffer) {
8455                 mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8456                 if (!!val == tracer_tracing_is_on(tr)) {
8457                         val = 0; /* do nothing */
8458                 } else if (val) {
8459                         tracer_tracing_on(tr);
8460                         if (tr->current_trace->start)
8461                                 tr->current_trace->start(tr);
8462                 } else {
8463                         tracer_tracing_off(tr);
8464                         if (tr->current_trace->stop)
8465                                 tr->current_trace->stop(tr);
8466                 }
8467                 mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8468         }
8469 
8470         (*ppos)++;
8471 
8472         return cnt;
8473 }
8474 
8475 static const struct file_operations rb_simple_fops = {
8476         .open           = tracing_open_generic_tr,
8477         .read           = rb_simple_read,
8478         .write          = rb_simple_write,
8479         .release        = tracing_release_generic_tr,
8480         .llseek         = default_llseek,
8481 };
8482 
8483 static ssize_t
8484 buffer_percent_read(struct file *filp, char __user *ubuf,
8485                     size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
8486 {
8487         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
8488         char buf[64];
8489         int r;
8490 
8491         r = tr->buffer_percent;
8492         r = sprintf(buf, "%d\n", r);
8493 
8494         return simple_read_from_buffer(ubuf, cnt, ppos, buf, r);
8495 }
8496 
8497 static ssize_t
8498 buffer_percent_write(struct file *filp, const char __user *ubuf,
8499                      size_t cnt, loff_t *ppos)
8500 {
8501         struct trace_array *tr = filp->private_data;
8502         unsigned long val;
8503         int ret;
8504 
8505         ret = kstrtoul_from_user(ubuf, cnt, 10, &val);
8506         if (ret)
8507                 return ret;
8508 
8509         if (val > 100)
8510                 return -EINVAL;
8511 
8512         if (!val)
8513                 val = 1;
8514 
8515         tr->buffer_percent = val;
8516 
8517         (*ppos)++;
8518 
8519         return cnt;
8520 }
8521 
8522 static const struct file_operations buffer_percent_fops = {
8523         .open           = tracing_open_generic_tr,
8524         .read           = buffer_percent_read,
8525         .write          = buffer_percent_write,
8526         .release        = tracing_release_generic_tr,
8527         .llseek         = default_llseek,
8528 };
8529 
8530 static struct dentry *trace_instance_dir;
8531 
8532 static void
8533 init_tracer_tracefs(struct trace_array *tr, struct dentry *d_tracer);
8534 
8535 static int
8536 allocate_trace_buffer(struct trace_array *tr, struct array_buffer *buf, int size)
8537 {
8538         enum ring_buffer_flags rb_flags;
8539 
8540         rb_flags = tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_OVERWRITE ? RB_FL_OVERWRITE : 0;
8541 
8542         buf->tr = tr;
8543 
8544         buf->buffer = ring_buffer_alloc(size, rb_flags);
8545         if (!buf->buffer)
8546                 return -ENOMEM;
8547 
8548         buf->data = alloc_percpu(struct trace_array_cpu);
8549         if (!buf->data) {
8550                 ring_buffer_free(buf->buffer);
8551                 buf->buffer = NULL;
8552                 return -ENOMEM;
8553         }
8554 
8555         /* Allocate the first page for all buffers */
8556         set_buffer_entries(&tr->array_buffer,
8557                            ring_buffer_size(tr->array_buffer.buffer, 0));
8558 
8559         return 0;
8560 }
8561 
8562 static int allocate_trace_buffers(struct trace_array *tr, int size)
8563 {
8564         int ret;
8565 
8566         ret = allocate_trace_buffer(tr, &tr->array_buffer, size);
8567         if (ret)
8568                 return ret;
8569 
8570 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
8571         ret = allocate_trace_buffer(tr, &tr->max_buffer,
8572                                     allocate_snapshot ? size : 1);
8573         if (MEM_FAIL(ret, "Failed to allocate trace buffer\n")) {
8574                 ring_buffer_free(tr->array_buffer.buffer);
8575                 tr->array_buffer.buffer = NULL;
8576                 free_percpu(tr->array_buffer.data);
8577                 tr->array_buffer.data = NULL;
8578                 return -ENOMEM;
8579         }
8580         tr->allocated_snapshot = allocate_snapshot;
8581 
8582         /*
8583          * Only the top level trace array gets its snapshot allocated
8584          * from the kernel command line.
8585          */
8586         allocate_snapshot = false;
8587 #endif
8588 
8589         return 0;
8590 }
8591 
8592 static void free_trace_buffer(struct array_buffer *buf)
8593 {
8594         if (buf->buffer) {
8595                 ring_buffer_free(buf->buffer);
8596                 buf->buffer = NULL;
8597                 free_percpu(buf->data);
8598                 buf->data = NULL;
8599         }
8600 }
8601 
8602 static void free_trace_buffers(struct trace_array *tr)
8603 {
8604         if (!tr)
8605                 return;
8606 
8607         free_trace_buffer(&tr->array_buffer);
8608 
8609 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE
8610         free_trace_buffer(&tr->max_buffer);
8611 #endif
8612 }
8613 
8614 static void init_trace_flags_index(struct trace_array *tr)
8615 {
8616         int i;
8617 
8618         /* Used by the trace options files */
8619         for (i = 0; i < TRACE_FLAGS_MAX_SIZE; i++)
8620                 tr->trace_flags_index[i] = i;
8621 }
8622 
8623 static void __update_tracer_options(struct trace_array *tr)
8624 {
8625         struct tracer *t;
8626 
8627         for (t = trace_types; t; t = t->next)
8628                 add_tracer_options(tr, t);
8629 }
8630 
8631 static void update_tracer_options(struct trace_array *tr)
8632 {
8633         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8634         __update_tracer_options(tr);
8635         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8636 }
8637 
8638 /* Must have trace_types_lock held */
8639 struct trace_array *trace_array_find(const char *instance)
8640 {
8641         struct trace_array *tr, *found = NULL;
8642 
8643         list_for_each_entry(tr, &ftrace_trace_arrays, list) {
8644                 if (tr->name && strcmp(tr->name, instance) == 0) {
8645                         found = tr;
8646                         break;
8647                 }
8648         }
8649 
8650         return found;
8651 }
8652 
8653 struct trace_array *trace_array_find_get(const char *instance)
8654 {
8655         struct trace_array *tr;
8656 
8657         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8658         tr = trace_array_find(instance);
8659         if (tr)
8660                 tr->ref++;
8661         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8662 
8663         return tr;
8664 }
8665 
8666 static int trace_array_create_dir(struct trace_array *tr)
8667 {
8668         int ret;
8669 
8670         tr->dir = tracefs_create_dir(tr->name, trace_instance_dir);
8671         if (!tr->dir)
8672                 return -EINVAL;
8673 
8674         ret = event_trace_add_tracer(tr->dir, tr);
8675         if (ret)
8676                 tracefs_remove(tr->dir);
8677 
8678         init_tracer_tracefs(tr, tr->dir);
8679         __update_tracer_options(tr);
8680 
8681         return ret;
8682 }
8683 
8684 static struct trace_array *trace_array_create(const char *name)
8685 {
8686         struct trace_array *tr;
8687         int ret;
8688 
8689         ret = -ENOMEM;
8690         tr = kzalloc(sizeof(*tr), GFP_KERNEL);
8691         if (!tr)
8692                 return ERR_PTR(ret);
8693 
8694         tr->name = kstrdup(name, GFP_KERNEL);
8695         if (!tr->name)
8696                 goto out_free_tr;
8697 
8698         if (!alloc_cpumask_var(&tr->tracing_cpumask, GFP_KERNEL))
8699                 goto out_free_tr;
8700 
8701         tr->trace_flags = global_trace.trace_flags & ~ZEROED_TRACE_FLAGS;
8702 
8703         cpumask_copy(tr->tracing_cpumask, cpu_all_mask);
8704 
8705         raw_spin_lock_init(&tr->start_lock);
8706 
8707         tr->max_lock = (arch_spinlock_t)__ARCH_SPIN_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
8708 
8709         tr->current_trace = &nop_trace;
8710 
8711         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tr->systems);
8712         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tr->events);
8713         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tr->hist_vars);
8714         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tr->err_log);
8715 
8716         if (allocate_trace_buffers(tr, trace_buf_size) < 0)
8717                 goto out_free_tr;
8718 
8719         if (ftrace_allocate_ftrace_ops(tr) < 0)
8720                 goto out_free_tr;
8721 
8722         ftrace_init_trace_array(tr);
8723 
8724         init_trace_flags_index(tr);
8725 
8726         if (trace_instance_dir) {
8727                 ret = trace_array_create_dir(tr);
8728                 if (ret)
8729                         goto out_free_tr;
8730         } else
8731                 __trace_early_add_events(tr);
8732 
8733         list_add(&tr->list, &ftrace_trace_arrays);
8734 
8735         tr->ref++;
8736 
8737         return tr;
8738 
8739  out_free_tr:
8740         ftrace_free_ftrace_ops(tr);
8741         free_trace_buffers(tr);
8742         free_cpumask_var(tr->tracing_cpumask);
8743         kfree(tr->name);
8744         kfree(tr);
8745 
8746         return ERR_PTR(ret);
8747 }
8748 
8749 static int instance_mkdir(const char *name)
8750 {
8751         struct trace_array *tr;
8752         int ret;
8753 
8754         mutex_lock(&event_mutex);
8755         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8756 
8757         ret = -EEXIST;
8758         if (trace_array_find(name))
8759                 goto out_unlock;
8760 
8761         tr = trace_array_create(name);
8762 
8763         ret = PTR_ERR_OR_ZERO(tr);
8764 
8765 out_unlock:
8766         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8767         mutex_unlock(&event_mutex);
8768         return ret;
8769 }
8770 
8771 /**
8772  * trace_array_get_by_name - Create/Lookup a trace array, given its name.
8773  * @name: The name of the trace array to be looked up/created.
8774  *
8775  * Returns pointer to trace array with given name.
8776  * NULL, if it cannot be created.
8777  *
8778  * NOTE: This function increments the reference counter associated with the
8779  * trace array returned. This makes sure it cannot be freed while in use.
8780  * Use trace_array_put() once the trace array is no longer needed.
8781  * If the trace_array is to be freed, trace_array_destroy() needs to
8782  * be called after the trace_array_put(), or simply let user space delete
8783  * it from the tracefs instances directory. But until the
8784  * trace_array_put() is called, user space can not delete it.
8785  *
8786  */
8787 struct trace_array *trace_array_get_by_name(const char *name)
8788 {
8789         struct trace_array *tr;
8790 
8791         mutex_lock(&event_mutex);
8792         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8793 
8794         list_for_each_entry(tr, &ftrace_trace_arrays, list) {
8795                 if (tr->name && strcmp(tr->name, name) == 0)
8796                         goto out_unlock;
8797         }
8798 
8799         tr = trace_array_create(name);
8800 
8801         if (IS_ERR(tr))
8802                 tr = NULL;
8803 out_unlock:
8804         if (tr)
8805                 tr->ref++;
8806 
8807         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8808         mutex_unlock(&event_mutex);
8809         return tr;
8810 }
8811 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_array_get_by_name);
8812 
8813 static int __remove_instance(struct trace_array *tr)
8814 {
8815         int i;
8816 
8817         /* Reference counter for a newly created trace array = 1. */
8818         if (tr->ref > 1 || (tr->current_trace && tr->trace_ref))
8819                 return -EBUSY;
8820 
8821         list_del(&tr->list);
8822 
8823         /* Disable all the flags that were enabled coming in */
8824         for (i = 0; i < TRACE_FLAGS_MAX_SIZE; i++) {
8825                 if ((1 << i) & ZEROED_TRACE_FLAGS)
8826                         set_tracer_flag(tr, 1 << i, 0);
8827         }
8828 
8829         tracing_set_nop(tr);
8830         clear_ftrace_function_probes(tr);
8831         event_trace_del_tracer(tr);
8832         ftrace_clear_pids(tr);
8833         ftrace_destroy_function_files(tr);
8834         tracefs_remove(tr->dir);
8835         free_trace_buffers(tr);
8836 
8837         for (i = 0; i < tr->nr_topts; i++) {
8838                 kfree(tr->topts[i].topts);
8839         }
8840         kfree(tr->topts);
8841 
8842         free_cpumask_var(tr->tracing_cpumask);
8843         kfree(tr->name);
8844         kfree(tr);
8845 
8846         return 0;
8847 }
8848 
8849 int trace_array_destroy(struct trace_array *this_tr)
8850 {
8851         struct trace_array *tr;
8852         int ret;
8853 
8854         if (!this_tr)
8855                 return -EINVAL;
8856 
8857         mutex_lock(&event_mutex);
8858         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8859 
8860         ret = -ENODEV;
8861 
8862         /* Making sure trace array exists before destroying it. */
8863         list_for_each_entry(tr, &ftrace_trace_arrays, list) {
8864                 if (tr == this_tr) {
8865                         ret = __remove_instance(tr);
8866                         break;
8867                 }
8868         }
8869 
8870         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8871         mutex_unlock(&event_mutex);
8872 
8873         return ret;
8874 }
8875 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(trace_array_destroy);
8876 
8877 static int instance_rmdir(const char *name)
8878 {
8879         struct trace_array *tr;
8880         int ret;
8881 
8882         mutex_lock(&event_mutex);
8883         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8884 
8885         ret = -ENODEV;
8886         tr = trace_array_find(name);
8887         if (tr)
8888                 ret = __remove_instance(tr);
8889 
8890         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8891         mutex_unlock(&event_mutex);
8892 
8893         return ret;
8894 }
8895 
8896 static __init void create_trace_instances(struct dentry *d_tracer)
8897 {
8898         struct trace_array *tr;
8899 
8900         trace_instance_dir = tracefs_create_instance_dir("instances", d_tracer,
8901                                                          instance_mkdir,
8902                                                          instance_rmdir);
8903         if (MEM_FAIL(!trace_instance_dir, "Failed to create instances directory\n"))
8904                 return;
8905 
8906         mutex_lock(&event_mutex);
8907         mutex_lock(&trace_types_lock);
8908 
8909         list_for_each_entry(tr, &ftrace_trace_arrays, list) {
8910                 if (!tr->name)
8911                         continue;
8912                 if (MEM_FAIL(trace_array_create_dir(tr) < 0,
8913                              "Failed to create instance directory\n"))
8914                         break;
8915         }
8916 
8917         mutex_unlock(&trace_types_lock);
8918         mutex_unlock(&event_mutex);
8919 }
8920 
8921 static void
8922 init_tracer_tracefs(struct trace_array *tr, struct dentry *d_tracer)
8923 {
8924         struct trace_event_file *file;
8925         int cpu;
8926 
8927         trace_create_file("available_tracers", 0444, d_tracer,
8928                         tr, &show_traces_fops);
8929 
8930         trace_create_file("current_tracer", 0644, d_tracer,
8931                         tr, &set_tracer_fops);
8932 
8933         trace_create_file("tracing_cpumask", 0644, d_tracer,
8934                           tr, &tracing_cpumask_fops);
8935 
8936         trace_create_file("trace_options", 0644, d_tracer,
8937                           tr, &tracing_iter_fops);
8938 
8939         trace_create_file("trace", 0644, d_tracer,
8940                           tr, &tracing_fops);
8941 
8942         trace_create_file("trace_pipe", 0444, d_tracer,
8943                           tr, &tracing_pipe_fops);
8944 
8945         trace_create_file("buffer_size_kb", 0644, d_tracer,
8946                           tr, &tracing_entries_fops);
8947 
8948         trace_create_file("buffer_total_size_kb", 0444, d_tracer,
8949                           tr, &tracing_total_entries_fops);
8950 
8951         trace_create_file("free_buffer", 0200, d_tracer,
8952                           tr, &tracing_free_buffer_fops);
8953 
8954         trace_create_file("trace_marker", 0220, d_tracer,
8955                           tr, &tracing_mark_fops);
8956 
8957         file = __find_event_file(tr, "ftrace", "print");
8958         if (file && file->dir)
8959                 trace_create_file("trigger", 0644, file->dir, file,
8960                                   &event_trigger_fops);
8961         tr->trace_marker_file = file;
8962 
8963         trace_create_file("trace_marker_raw", 0220, d_tracer,
8964                           tr, &tracing_mark_raw_fops);
8965 
8966         trace_create_file("trace_clock", 0644, d_tracer, tr,
8967                           &trace_clock_fops);
8968 
8969         trace_create_file("tracing_on", 0644, d_tracer,
8970                           tr, &rb_simple_fops);
8971 
8972         trace_create_file("timestamp_mode", 0444, d_tracer, tr,
8973                           &trace_time_stamp_mode_fops);
8974 
8975         tr->buffer_percent = 50;
8976 
8977         trace_create_file("buffer_percent", 0444, d_tracer,
8978                         tr, &buffer_percent_fops);
8979 
8980         create_trace_options_dir(tr);
8981 
8982 #if defined(CONFIG_TRACER_MAX_TRACE) || defined(CONFIG_HWLAT_TRACER)
8983         trace_create_maxlat_file(tr, d_tracer);
8984 #endif
8985 
8986         if (ftrace_create_function_files(tr, d_tracer))
8987                 MEM_FAIL(1, "Could not allocate function filter files");
8988 
8989 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACER_SNAPSHOT
8990         trace_create_file("snapshot", 0644, d_tracer,
8991                           tr, &snapshot_fops);
8992 #endif
8993 
8994         trace_create_file("error_log", 0644, d_tracer,
8995                           tr, &tracing_err_log_fops);
8996 
8997         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu)
8998                 tracing_init_tracefs_percpu(tr, cpu);
8999 
9000         ftrace_init_tracefs(tr, d_tracer);
9001 }
9002 
9003 #ifndef CONFIG_TRACEFS_DISABLE_AUTOMOUNT
9004 static struct vfsmount *trace_automount(struct dentry *mntpt, void *ingore)
9005 {
9006         struct vfsmount *mnt;
9007         struct file_system_type *type;
9008 
9009         /*
9010          * To maintain backward compatibility for tools that mount
9011          * debugfs to get to the tracing facility, tracefs is automatically
9012          * mounted to the debugfs/tracing directory.
9013          */
9014         type = get_fs_type("tracefs");
9015         if (!type)
9016                 return NULL;
9017         mnt = vfs_submount(mntpt, type, "tracefs", NULL);
9018         put_filesystem(type);
9019         if (IS_ERR(mnt))
9020                 return NULL;
9021         mntget(mnt);
9022 
9023         return mnt;
9024 }
9025 #endif
9026 
9027 /**
