9028  * tracing_init_dentry - initialize top level trace array
9029  *
9030  * This is called when creating files or directories in the tracing
9031  * directory. It is called via fs_initcall() by any of the boot up code
9032  * and expects to return the dentry of the top level tracing directory.
9033  */
9034 int tracing_init_dentry(void)
9035 {
9036         struct trace_array *tr = &global_trace;
9037 
9038         if (security_locked_down(LOCKDOWN_TRACEFS)) {
9039                 pr_warn("Tracing disabled due to lockdown\n");
9040                 return -EPERM;
9041         }
9042 
9043         /* The top level trace array uses  NULL as parent */
9044         if (tr->dir)
9045                 return 0;
9046 
9047         if (WARN_ON(!tracefs_initialized()))
9048                 return -ENODEV;
9049 
9050 #ifndef CONFIG_TRACEFS_DISABLE_AUTOMOUNT
9051         /*
9052          * As there may still be users that expect the tracing
9053          * files to exist in debugfs/tracing, we must automount
9054          * the tracefs file system there, so older tools still
9055          * work with the newer kerenl.
9056          */
9057         tr->dir = debugfs_create_automount("tracing", NULL,
9058                                            trace_automount, NULL);
9059 #else
9060         tr->dir = ERR_PTR(-ENODEV);
9061 #endif
9062 
9063         return 0;
9064 }
9065 
9066 extern struct trace_eval_map *__start_ftrace_eval_maps[];
9067 extern struct trace_eval_map *__stop_ftrace_eval_maps[];
9068 
9069 static void __init trace_eval_init(void)
9070 {
9071         int len;
9072 
9073         len = __stop_ftrace_eval_maps - __start_ftrace_eval_maps;
9074         trace_insert_eval_map(NULL, __start_ftrace_eval_maps, len);
9075 }
9076 
9077 #ifdef CONFIG_MODULES
9078 static void trace_module_add_evals(struct module *mod)
9079 {
9080         if (!mod->num_trace_evals)
9081                 return;
9082 
9083         /*
9084          * Modules with bad taint do not have events created, do
9085          * not bother with enums either.
9086          */
9087         if (trace_module_has_bad_taint(mod))
9088                 return;
9089 
9090         trace_insert_eval_map(mod, mod->trace_evals, mod->num_trace_evals);
9091 }
9092 
9093 #ifdef CONFIG_TRACE_EVAL_MAP_FILE
9094 static void trace_module_remove_evals(struct module *mod)
9095 {
9096         union trace_eval_map_item *map;
9097         union trace_eval_map_item **last = &trace_eval_maps;
9098 
9099         if (!mod->num_trace_evals)
9100                 return;
9101 
9102         mutex_lock(&trace_eval_mutex);
9103 
9104         map = trace_eval_maps;
9105 
9106         while (map) {
9107                 if (map->head.mod == mod)
9108                         break;
9109                 map = trace_eval_jmp_to_tail(map);
9110                 last = &map->tail.next;
9111                 map = map->tail.next;
9112         }
9113         if (!map)
9114                 goto out;
9115 
9116         *last = trace_eval_jmp_to_tail(map)->tail.next;
9117         kfree(map);
9118  out:
9119         mutex_unlock(&trace_eval_mutex);
9120 }
9121 #else
9122 static inline void trace_module_remove_evals(struct module *mod) { }
9123 #endif /* CONFIG_TRACE_EVAL_MAP_FILE */
9124 
9125 static int trace_module_notify(struct notifier_block *self,
9126                                unsigned long val, void *data)
9127 {
9128         struct module *mod = data;
9129 
9130         switch (val) {
9131         case MODULE_STATE_COMING:
9132                 trace_module_add_evals(mod);
9133                 break;
9134         case MODULE_STATE_GOING:
9135                 trace_module_remove_evals(mod);
9136                 break;
9137         }
9138 
9139         return NOTIFY_OK;
9140 }
9141 
9142 static struct notifier_block trace_module_nb = {
9143         .notifier_call = trace_module_notify,
9144         .priority = 0,
9145 };
9146 #endif /* CONFIG_MODULES */
9147 
9148 static __init int tracer_init_tracefs(void)
9149 {
9150         int ret;
9151 
9152         trace_access_lock_init();
9153 
9154         ret = tracing_init_dentry();
9155         if (ret)
9156                 return 0;
9157 
9158         event_trace_init();
9159 
9160         init_tracer_tracefs(&global_trace, NULL);
9161         ftrace_init_tracefs_toplevel(&global_trace, NULL);
9162 
9163         trace_create_file("tracing_thresh", 0644, NULL,
9164                         &global_trace, &tracing_thresh_fops);
9165 
9166         trace_create_file("README", 0444, NULL,
9167                         NULL, &tracing_readme_fops);
9168 
9169         trace_create_file("saved_cmdlines", 0444, NULL,
9170                         NULL, &tracing_saved_cmdlines_fops);
9171 
9172         trace_create_file("saved_cmdlines_size", 0644, NULL,
9173                           NULL, &tracing_saved_cmdlines_size_fops);
9174 
9175         trace_create_file("saved_tgids", 0444, NULL,
9176                         NULL, &tracing_saved_tgids_fops);
9177 
9178         trace_eval_init();
9179 
9180         trace_create_eval_file(NULL);
9181 
9182 #ifdef CONFIG_MODULES
9183         register_module_notifier(&trace_module_nb);
9184 #endif
9185 
9186 #ifdef CONFIG_DYNAMIC_FTRACE
9187         trace_create_file("dyn_ftrace_total_info", 0444, NULL,
9188                         NULL, &tracing_dyn_info_fops);
9189 #endif
9190 
9191         create_trace_instances(NULL);
9192 
9193         update_tracer_options(&global_trace);
9194 
9195         return 0;
9196 }
9197 
9198 static int trace_panic_handler(struct notifier_block *this,
9199                                unsigned long event, void *unused)
9200 {
9201         bool ftrace_check = false;
9202 
9203         trace_android_vh_ftrace_oops_enter(&ftrace_check);
9204 
9205         if (ftrace_check)
9206                 return NOTIFY_OK;
9207 
9208         if (ftrace_dump_on_oops)
9209                 ftrace_dump(ftrace_dump_on_oops);
9210 
9211         trace_android_vh_ftrace_oops_exit(&ftrace_check);
9212         return NOTIFY_OK;
9213 }
9214 
9215 static struct notifier_block trace_panic_notifier = {
9216         .notifier_call  = trace_panic_handler,
9217         .next           = NULL,
9218         .priority       = 150   /* priority: INT_MAX >= x >= 0 */
9219 };
9220 
9221 static int trace_die_handler(struct notifier_block *self,
9222                              unsigned long val,
9223                              void *data)
9224 {
9225         bool ftrace_check = false;
9226 
9227         trace_android_vh_ftrace_oops_enter(&ftrace_check);
9228 
9229         if (ftrace_check)
9230                 return NOTIFY_OK;
9231 
9232         switch (val) {
9233         case DIE_OOPS:
9234                 if (ftrace_dump_on_oops)
9235                         ftrace_dump(ftrace_dump_on_oops);
9236                 break;
9237         default:
9238                 break;
9239         }
9240 
9241         trace_android_vh_ftrace_oops_exit(&ftrace_check);
9242         return NOTIFY_OK;
9243 }
9244 
9245 static struct notifier_block trace_die_notifier = {
9246         .notifier_call = trace_die_handler,
9247         .priority = 200
9248 };
9249 
9250 /*
9251  * printk is set to max of 1024, we really don't need it that big.
9252  * Nothing should be printing 1000 characters anyway.
9253  */
9254 #define TRACE_MAX_PRINT         1000
9255 
9256 /*
9257  * Define here KERN_TRACE so that we have one place to modify
9258  * it if we decide to change what log level the ftrace dump
9259  * should be at.
9260  */
9261 #define KERN_TRACE              KERN_EMERG
9262 
9263 void
9264 trace_printk_seq(struct trace_seq *s)
9265 {
9266         bool dump_printk = true;
9267 
9268         /* Probably should print a warning here. */
9269         if (s->seq.len >= TRACE_MAX_PRINT)
9270                 s->seq.len = TRACE_MAX_PRINT;
9271 
9272         /*
9273          * More paranoid code. Although the buffer size is set to
9274          * PAGE_SIZE, and TRACE_MAX_PRINT is 1000, this is just
9275          * an extra layer of protection.
9276          */
9277         if (WARN_ON_ONCE(s->seq.len >= s->seq.size))
9278                 s->seq.len = s->seq.size - 1;
9279 
9280         /* should be zero ended, but we are paranoid. */
9281         s->buffer[s->seq.len] = 0;
9282 
9283         trace_android_vh_ftrace_dump_buffer(s, &dump_printk);
9284         if (dump_printk)
9285                 printk(KERN_TRACE "%s", s->buffer);
9286 
9287         trace_seq_init(s);
9288 }
9289 
9290 void trace_init_global_iter(struct trace_iterator *iter)
9291 {
9292         iter->tr = &global_trace;
9293         iter->trace = iter->tr->current_trace;
9294         iter->cpu_file = RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS;
9295         iter->array_buffer = &global_trace.array_buffer;
9296 
9297         if (iter->trace && iter->trace->open)
9298                 iter->trace->open(iter);
9299 
9300         /* Annotate start of buffers if we had overruns */
9301         if (ring_buffer_overruns(iter->array_buffer->buffer))
9302                 iter->iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_ANNOTATE;
9303 
9304         /* Output in nanoseconds only if we are using a clock in nanoseconds. */
9305         if (trace_clocks[iter->tr->clock_id].in_ns)
9306                 iter->iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_TIME_IN_NS;
9307 }
9308 
9309 void ftrace_dump(enum ftrace_dump_mode oops_dump_mode)
9310 {
9311         /* use static because iter can be a bit big for the stack */
9312         static struct trace_iterator iter;
9313         static atomic_t dump_running;
9314         struct trace_array *tr = &global_trace;
9315         unsigned int old_userobj;
9316         unsigned long flags;
9317         int cnt = 0, cpu;
9318         bool ftrace_check = false;
9319         unsigned long size;
9320 
9321         /* Only allow one dump user at a time. */
9322         if (atomic_inc_return(&dump_running) != 1) {
9323                 atomic_dec(&dump_running);
9324                 return;
9325         }
9326 
9327         /*
9328          * Always turn off tracing when we dump.
9329          * We don't need to show trace output of what happens
9330          * between multiple crashes.
9331          *
9332          * If the user does a sysrq-z, then they can re-enable
9333          * tracing with echo 1 > tracing_on.
9334          */
9335         tracing_off();
9336 
9337         local_irq_save(flags);
9338         printk_nmi_direct_enter();
9339 
9340         /* Simulate the iterator */
9341         trace_init_global_iter(&iter);
9342         /* Can not use kmalloc for iter.temp */
9343         iter.temp = static_temp_buf;
9344         iter.temp_size = STATIC_TEMP_BUF_SIZE;
9345 
9346         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
9347                 atomic_inc(&per_cpu_ptr(iter.array_buffer->data, cpu)->disabled);
9348                 size = ring_buffer_size(iter.array_buffer->buffer, cpu);
9349                 trace_android_vh_ftrace_size_check(size, &ftrace_check);
9350         }
9351 
9352         old_userobj = tr->trace_flags & TRACE_ITER_SYM_USEROBJ;
9353 
9354         /* don't look at user memory in panic mode */
9355         tr->trace_flags &= ~TRACE_ITER_SYM_USEROBJ;
9356 
9357         if (ftrace_check)
9358                 goto out_enable;
9359 
9360         switch (oops_dump_mode) {
9361         case DUMP_ALL:
9362                 iter.cpu_file = RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS;
9363                 break;
9364         case DUMP_ORIG:
9365                 iter.cpu_file = raw_smp_processor_id();
9366                 break;
9367         case DUMP_NONE:
9368                 goto out_enable;
9369         default:
9370                 printk(KERN_TRACE "Bad dumping mode, switching to all CPUs dump\n");
9371                 iter.cpu_file = RING_BUFFER_ALL_CPUS;
9372         }
9373 
9374         printk(KERN_TRACE "Dumping ftrace buffer:\n");
9375 
9376         /* Did function tracer already get disabled? */
9377         if (ftrace_is_dead()) {
9378                 printk("# WARNING: FUNCTION TRACING IS CORRUPTED\n");
9379                 printk("#          MAY BE MISSING FUNCTION EVENTS\n");
9380         }
9381 
9382         /*
9383          * We need to stop all tracing on all CPUS to read
9384          * the next buffer. This is a bit expensive, but is
9385          * not done often. We fill all what we can read,
9386          * and then release the locks again.
9387          */
9388 
9389         while (!trace_empty(&iter)) {
9390                 ftrace_check = true;
9391 
9392                 if (!cnt)
9393                         printk(KERN_TRACE "---------------------------------\n");
9394 
9395                 cnt++;
9396 
9397                 trace_iterator_reset(&iter);
9398                 trace_android_vh_ftrace_format_check(&ftrace_check);
9399                 if (ftrace_check)
9400                         iter.iter_flags |= TRACE_FILE_LAT_FMT;
9401 
9402                 if (trace_find_next_entry_inc(&iter) != NULL) {
9403                         int ret;
9404 
9405                         ret = print_trace_line(&iter);
9406                         if (ret != TRACE_TYPE_NO_CONSUME)
9407                                 trace_consume(&iter);
9408                 }
9409                 touch_nmi_watchdog();
9410 
9411                 trace_printk_seq(&iter.seq);
9412         }
9413 
9414         if (!cnt)
9415                 printk(KERN_TRACE "   (ftrace buffer empty)\n");
9416         else
9417                 printk(KERN_TRACE "---------------------------------\n");
9418 
9419  out_enable:
9420         tr->trace_flags |= old_userobj;
9421 
9422         for_each_tracing_cpu(cpu) {
9423                 atomic_dec(&per_cpu_ptr(iter.array_buffer->data, cpu)->disabled);
9424         }
9425         atomic_dec(&dump_running);
9426         printk_nmi_direct_exit();
9427         local_irq_restore(flags);
9428 }
9429 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(ftrace_dump);
9430 
9431 int trace_run_command(const char *buf, int (*createfn)(int, char **))
9432 {
9433         char **argv;
9434         int argc, ret;
9435 
9436         argc = 0;
9437         ret = 0;
9438         argv = argv_split(GFP_KERNEL, buf, &argc);
9439         if (!argv)
9440                 return -ENOMEM;
9441 
9442         if (argc)
9443                 ret = createfn(argc, argv);
9444 
9445         argv_free(argv);
9446 
9447         return ret;
9448 }
9449 
9450 #define WRITE_BUFSIZE  4096
9451 
9452 ssize_t trace_parse_run_command(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
9453                                 size_t count, loff_t *ppos,
9454                                 int (*createfn)(int, char **))
9455 {
9456         char *kbuf, *buf, *tmp;
9457         int ret = 0;
9458         size_t done = 0;
9459         size_t size;
9460 
9461         kbuf = kmalloc(WRITE_BUFSIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
9462         if (!kbuf)
9463                 return -ENOMEM;
9464 
9465         while (done < count) {
9466                 size = count - done;
9467 
9468                 if (size >= WRITE_BUFSIZE)
9469                         size = WRITE_BUFSIZE - 1;
9470 
9471                 if (copy_from_user(kbuf, buffer + done, size)) {
9472                         ret = -EFAULT;
9473                         goto out;
9474                 }
9475                 kbuf[size] = '\0';
9476                 buf = kbuf;
9477                 do {
9478                         tmp = strchr(buf, '\n');
9479                         if (tmp) {
9480                                 *tmp = '\0';
9481                                 size = tmp - buf + 1;
9482                         } else {
9483                                 size = strlen(buf);
9484                                 if (done + size < count) {
9485                                         if (buf != kbuf)
9486                                                 break;
9487                                         /* This can accept WRITE_BUFSIZE - 2 ('\n' + '\0') */
9488                                         pr_warn("Line length is too long: Should be less than %d\n",
9489                                                 WRITE_BUFSIZE - 2);
9490                                         ret = -EINVAL;
9491                                         goto out;
9492                                 }
9493                         }
9494                         done += size;
9495 
9496                         /* Remove comments */
9497                         tmp = strchr(buf, '#');
9498 
9499                         if (tmp)
9500                                 *tmp = '\0';
9501 
9502                         ret = trace_run_command(buf, createfn);
9503                         if (ret)
9504                                 goto out;
9505                         buf += size;
9506 
9507                 } while (done < count);
9508         }
9509         ret = done;
9510 
9511 out:
9512         kfree(kbuf);
9513 
9514         return ret;
9515 }
9516 
9517 __init static int tracer_alloc_buffers(void)
9518 {
9519         int ring_buf_size;
9520         int ret = -ENOMEM;
9521 
9522 
9523         if (security_locked_down(LOCKDOWN_TRACEFS)) {
9524                 pr_warn("Tracing disabled due to lockdown\n");
9525                 return -EPERM;
9526         }
9527 
9528         /*
9529          * Make sure we don't accidentally add more trace options
9530          * than we have bits for.
9531          */
9532         BUILD_BUG_ON(TRACE_ITER_LAST_BIT > TRACE_FLAGS_MAX_SIZE);
9533 
9534         if (!alloc_cpumask_var(&tracing_buffer_mask, GFP_KERNEL))
9535                 goto out;
9536 
9537         if (!alloc_cpumask_var(&global_trace.tracing_cpumask, GFP_KERNEL))
9538                 goto out_free_buffer_mask;
9539 
9540         /* Only allocate trace_printk buffers if a trace_printk exists */
9541         if (&__stop___trace_bprintk_fmt != &__start___trace_bprintk_fmt)
9542                 /* Must be called before global_trace.buffer is allocated */
9543                 trace_printk_init_buffers();
9544 
9545         /* To save memory, keep the ring buffer size to its minimum */
9546         if (ring_buffer_expanded)
9547                 ring_buf_size = trace_buf_size;
9548         else
9549                 ring_buf_size = 1;
9550 
9551         cpumask_copy(tracing_buffer_mask, cpu_possible_mask);
9552         cpumask_copy(global_trace.tracing_cpumask, cpu_all_mask);
9553 
9554         raw_spin_lock_init(&global_trace.start_lock);
9555 
9556         /*
9557          * The prepare callbacks allocates some memory for the ring buffer. We
9558          * don't free the buffer if the CPU goes down. If we were to free
9559          * the buffer, then the user would lose any trace that was in the
9560          * buffer. The memory will be removed once the "instance" is removed.
9561          */
9562         ret = cpuhp_setup_state_multi(CPUHP_TRACE_RB_PREPARE,
9563                                       "trace/RB:preapre", trace_rb_cpu_prepare,
9564                                       NULL);
9565         if (ret < 0)
9566                 goto out_free_cpumask;
9567         /* Used for event triggers */
9568         ret = -ENOMEM;
9569         temp_buffer = ring_buffer_alloc(PAGE_SIZE, RB_FL_OVERWRITE);
9570         if (!temp_buffer)
9571                 goto out_rm_hp_state;
9572 
9573         if (trace_create_savedcmd() < 0)
9574                 goto out_free_temp_buffer;
9575 
9576         /* TODO: make the number of buffers hot pluggable with CPUS */
9577         if (allocate_trace_buffers(&global_trace, ring_buf_size) < 0) {
9578                 MEM_FAIL(1, "tracer: failed to allocate ring buffer!\n");
9579                 goto out_free_savedcmd;
9580         }
9581 
9582         if (global_trace.buffer_disabled)
9583                 tracing_off();
9584 
9585         if (trace_boot_clock) {
9586                 ret = tracing_set_clock(&global_trace, trace_boot_clock);
9587                 if (ret < 0)
9588                         pr_warn("Trace clock %s not defined, going back to default\n",
9589                                 trace_boot_clock);
9590         }
9591 
9592         /*
9593          * register_tracer() might reference current_trace, so it
9594          * needs to be set before we register anything. This is
9595          * just a bootstrap of current_trace anyway.
9596          */
9597         global_trace.current_trace = &nop_trace;
9598 
9599         global_trace.max_lock = (arch_spinlock_t)__ARCH_SPIN_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
9600 
9601         ftrace_init_global_array_ops(&global_trace);
9602 
9603         init_trace_flags_index(&global_trace);
9604 
9605         register_tracer(&nop_trace);
9606 
9607         /* Function tracing may start here (via kernel command line) */
9608         init_function_trace();
9609 
9610         /* All seems OK, enable tracing */
9611         tracing_disabled = 0;
9612 
9613         atomic_notifier_chain_register(&panic_notifier_list,
9614                                        &trace_panic_notifier);
9615 
9616         register_die_notifier(&trace_die_notifier);
9617 
9618         global_trace.flags = TRACE_ARRAY_FL_GLOBAL;
9619 
9620         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&global_trace.systems);
9621         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&global_trace.events);
9622         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&global_trace.hist_vars);
9623         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&global_trace.err_log);
9624         list_add(&global_trace.list, &ftrace_trace_arrays);
9625 
9626         apply_trace_boot_options();
9627 
9628         register_snapshot_cmd();
9629 
9630         return 0;
9631 
9632 out_free_savedcmd:
9633         free_saved_cmdlines_buffer(savedcmd);
9634 out_free_temp_buffer:
9635         ring_buffer_free(temp_buffer);
9636 out_rm_hp_state:
9637         cpuhp_remove_multi_state(CPUHP_TRACE_RB_PREPARE);
9638 out_free_cpumask:
9639         free_cpumask_var(global_trace.tracing_cpumask);
9640 out_free_buffer_mask:
9641         free_cpumask_var(tracing_buffer_mask);
9642 out:
9643         return ret;
9644 }
9645 
9646 void __init early_trace_init(void)
9647 {
9648         if (tracepoint_printk) {
9649                 tracepoint_print_iter =
9650                         kmalloc(sizeof(*tracepoint_print_iter), GFP_KERNEL);
9651                 if (MEM_FAIL(!tracepoint_print_iter,
9652                              "Failed to allocate trace iterator\n"))
9653                         tracepoint_printk = 0;
9654                 else
9655                         static_key_enable(&tracepoint_printk_key.key);
9656         }
9657         tracer_alloc_buffers();
9658 }
9659 
9660 void __init trace_init(void)
9661 {
9662         trace_event_init();
9663 }
9664 
9665 __init static int clear_boot_tracer(void)
9666 {
9667         /*
9668          * The default tracer at boot buffer is an init section.
9669          * This function is called in lateinit. If we did not
9670          * find the boot tracer, then clear it out, to prevent
9671          * later registration from accessing the buffer that is
9672          * about to be freed.
9673          */
9674         if (!default_bootup_tracer)
9675                 return 0;
9676 
9677         printk(KERN_INFO "ftrace bootup tracer '%s' not registered.\n",
9678                default_bootup_tracer);
9679         default_bootup_tracer = NULL;
9680 
9681         return 0;
9682 }
9683 
9684 fs_initcall(tracer_init_tracefs);
9685 late_initcall_sync(clear_boot_tracer);
9686 
9687 #ifdef CONFIG_HAVE_UNSTABLE_SCHED_CLOCK
9688 __init static int tracing_set_default_clock(void)
9689 {
9690         /* sched_clock_stable() is determined in late_initcall */
9691         if (!trace_boot_clock && !sched_clock_stable()) {
9692                 if (security_locked_down(LOCKDOWN_TRACEFS)) {
9693                         pr_warn("Can not set tracing clock due to lockdown\n");
9694                         return -EPERM;
9695                 }
9696 
9697                 printk(KERN_WARNING
9698                        "Unstable clock detected, switching default tracing clock to \"global\"\n"
9699                        "If you want to keep using the local clock, then add:\n"
9700                        "  \"trace_clock=local\"\n"
9701                        "on the kernel command line\n");
9702                 tracing_set_clock(&global_trace, "global");
9703         }
9704 
9705         return 0;
9706 }
9707 late_initcall_sync(tracing_set_default_clock);
9708 #endif
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
